loans.name: Johana

texts.en: Johana is 40 years old and married with three children who go to school. He has been running a cafeteria for two years and has two employees. He also grows fruits such as pineapples which he sells to earn more income to provide for his family and educate his children. He had previously taken out a loan from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business. He plans to renovate his business premises so as to attract more customers. He has requested for a loan to add more cooking ingredients.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kigunda Group 1, Rukungiri

texts.en:
M. Joseph is a hardworking and devoted man. He is 40 years old and married with four children aged 8, 6, 4 and 2 years, with three in primary section while the youngest is in infant section.

Joseph is in the business of selling cattle from Kigango trading centre. For the fifteen years that he has been in business, he has faced challenges like the low market prices, quarantine of the animals, as well as the diseases - hence affecting his cash flow.

Due to his long time in business, Joseph has learnt how to handle his customers and his dream is to ensure that he sells cattle on a commercial basis and to educate all his children for a better future.

Joseph needs a loan to be able to buy more cows for increased stock.

loans.use: To buy more cows for his business

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is married with a son. She is a farming entrepreneur from Vinogradovo, Kherson region. Katerina owns several greenhouses and grows versatile farming produce for retail sale. She grows corn, peppers, cabbage, and squash. Katerina is very responsible and disciplined. She started this venture 3 years ago. Her diligence and natural composure have helped her succeed in this business. 

Katerina has invested about 70,000 Grivnyas in this venture. Her income is about 30,000 – 33,000 Grivnyas a month. Katerina is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase drip irrigation units for her greenhouses as well as some fertilizers and peat. Besides greenhouses, Katerina also owns a cow and breeds rabbits.

loans.use: to purchase drip irrigation units and fertilizer

loans.name: Silvia Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Silvia Elena Salina H. tiene una panadería ubicada en el reparto Bayardo Arce de la florida y tiene una pulpería ubicada de la Gasolinera Santa Ana 1 1/2c al oeste esta la administra la suegra ella atiende la panadería de lunes a domingo  se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos son tres los que tiene que mantener  su esposo trabaja y la apoya bastante.
La Joven Silvia Salina es comerciante desde hace seis años anteriormente estudiaba en su panadería tiene tres muchachos trabajadores  que le ayudan a la elaboración de todo el pan. El financiamiento lo solicito para comprar mercadería para su negocio ya que este producto es tiene que mantener bastante en existencia lo que es la harina, manteca, azúcar, huevos etc.  La Joven S. H. se siente muy agradecida con los financiamientos ya que a podido salir adelante gracias a Dios y estos créditos he podido hacer mi sueño realidad ver mi panadería trabajar y verla grande y que mi casa la vallamos acondicionando poco a poco.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Elena S. H. has a bakery located in the Bayardo Arce de la Florida market, and also a convenience store in the Santa Ana gas station, 1 and ½ kilometers to the west, which her mother-in-law manages. She runs the bakery from Monday to Sunday. She works very hard so that her three children can get ahead. Her husband works and is very supportive. The young Silvia S. has been a businesswoman for the past six years. Before that she studied. She has three workers who help her making the bread. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her business since for this product she has to have flour, shortening, sugar, eggs, etc. on hand. The young S. H. feels very grateful with the financing since she has been able to get ahead. Thanks to God and these loans she has been able to make her dream come true of seeing her bakery function and grow. She has also been able to fix up her house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, sugar, to make bread

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: Parveen is an ambitious and happy-natured lady. She runs a business selling sugar cane. She supplies sugar canes to the juice corners on a daily basis, and in this way earns income. Her income helps her to run the financial unit of her house. Parveen's husband, N. M., has had a wheat-selling business for the past five years. Parveen is applying for a loan to buy wheat in bulk to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married and has two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Gladkovka, Kherson region. Nataliya grows and sells farmed produce, e.g. cabbage, radishes and potatoes. Her son is actively helping her with transportation of merchandise as he owns a nice truck. Nataliya started this business 6 years ago. Currently, she receives about 30,000 – 35,000 Grivnyas of income a month. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase new polyethylene film to replace ruined film in her greenhouses, as well as to buy fertilizers and seeds for this spring farming season. She is confident that availability of lending services will help her repair her greenhouses and start farming season in time thus facilitating further expansion of her agricultural venture. Nataliya’s goal is to continue refining her business skills so that she can keep her venture growing and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, polyethylene film, fertilizers.

loans.name: José Noel

texts.es:
El Señor José Noel Z. Q., tiene un taller de reparación de vehículo ubicado a tres cuadras del Mercado Santa Ana ahí el repara todo tipo de vehículo el señor Z. Q. es casado tiene dos hijos  que mantener y su esposa.
Anteriormente el señor Z. era trabajador de un taller y dependía de un salario luego decidio poner el su propio negocio ahorrando y llegar a obtener un capital de C$ 8,000.00 desde hace 25 años que puso su negocio y con este capital compro materiales para su taller, ahora tengo bastante mercadería para mi negocio repuestos para carros, tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel y de estos financiamientos ha podido hacer cada vez mas grande mi taller tener mas inventario y acondicionar mi hogar.
texts.en:
Noel Z. Q. has a workshop where he repairs vehicles located 3 blocks from the Santa Ana Market. There he repairs all types of vehicles. Señor Z. Q. is married; he has a wife and two children to support. Previously he was an employee in a repair shop and he used to depend on a salary. Later he decided to save in order to have his own business, gradually accumulating capital of $8,000 Nicaraguan cordobas. He started this business 25 years ago, and with this capital he bought materials for his shop. Now he has a substantial amount of merchandise for his business including spare parts for cars. He has worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years, and with these financings he has been able to grow his business, increase his inventory, and fix up his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for vehicles to have in his business

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married and has two children. He is a businessman from Vinogradovo, Western Ukraine. Pavlo sells retail items, e.g. batteries, paper tissues, razors, etc. in the central local marketplace called “Urozhai” (“Harvest”). Pavlo has been in this business for 5 years. Presently, he has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. His net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas per month. 

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital. He enjoys working with this type of merchandise as these small items always sell well with his customers. Pavlo’s business has benefited much from the loans he has received in the past. We believe that this loan will continue to help his enterprise to be successful and provide the much needed income for him and his family.

loans.use: to increase his turnover capital.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres "las Divinas" Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en Cantón Las Flores, San Bernardino, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron un  
crédito en la Asociación ASDIR, ya que contaban con una venta pero por la falta de capital de trabajo no 
podían darle continuidad a dichas ventas, por lo que presentando su solicitud de crédito se les autorizó un 
capital de trabajo el cual lo invirtieron sus ventas de repostería, medicina, ropa, panes y servicios de costu-
rería, los cuales comercializan en el municipio de San Bernardino Such. Y que a través de estas ventas 
mejoraran sus condiciones de vida ya que no solamente contaran con el poyo económico de sus esposos
sino que ahora también ellas contribuirán  con los gastos del hogar y esto se debe al apoyo crediticio
que la Asociación brinda a estas familias.
texts.en:
This group of people lives in Cantón Las Flores, San Bernardino, Suchitepéquez. They asked for a loan in the Asociación ASDIR, since they had a sale but due to a lack of capital, couldn't continue with said sale. They presented their loan application and their working capital was authorized. They invested their earnings in pastry making, medicine, clothes, bread and tailoring, which they offer in the town of San Bernardino Such. Through these sales, they improved their living conditions since then they not only have the economic support of their husbands, they contribute to the household expenses as well. This is due to the loan support the Asociación offers these families.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Re-structuring merchandise these people have with their businesses, but due to lack of capital they didn't continue their activities and with this loan they will outfit their small businesses again.

loans.name: Mikhailo

texts.en:
Mikhailo is married with a teenage son. He is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine. Mikhailo used to be a policeman and has had much experience working in the security industry. After he resigned three years ago, he opened a private security guard services agency and hired several security officers. Mikhailo invested about 50,000 Grivnyas in his business. Currently, he receives about 6,000 Grivnyas in net profit each month. 

Mikhailo is requesting a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to purchase new uniforms for his employees – security guards. All his employees are trained to work in this sphere deterring illegal actions and criminal activity. Their duties include manning posts at different offices and facilities, checking people and vehicles entering and leaving the property and monitoring alarms and security cameras.

loans.use: to purchase new uniforms for his employees

loans.name: Niamat's Group

texts.en: Niamat is a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. Her husband, A. A., is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local, three-wheeled motor vehicle). Niamat supports him with her artificial flower-making business. Her flowers are used to decorate houses and the stage at wedding functions. She obtains orders from different shops in the market and generates a profit in this way. Both Niamat and A. A. use their income to meet their family's financial expenses. Niamat is applying for a loan to repair her husband’s auto-rickshaw because there is a problem with its engine.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Gilberto Rafael

texts.es:
Gilberto Rafael M. Hernández de 50 años de edad vive en el barrio Moras IV Etapa del municipio de Soledad, municipio al sur de Barranquilla y dice que su barrio es relativamente sano con vecinos muy colaboradores. Está casado con un hijo de 28 años de edad. Tiene un negocio en su casa donde vende mercancía, especialmente ropa y calzado, junto con su esposa y justamente quiere financiación por valor de $1.600.000 para comprar  la mercancía descrita.
Antes Gilberto trabajaba con muebles y productos de hogar y  se desempeñó también como mensajero durante 17 años hasta el año 1997, cuando se retiró por quiebra de la empresa. Al recibir su  liquidación empezó a viajar a Magangue, municipio en el departamento de Bolívar en las orillas del río Magdalena, el río más importante de Colombia. De Magangue Gilberto traía pescado que vendía y también su esposa elaboraba y vendía  bolis, una variedad de helado colombiana, que actualmente ella vende en el Estadio Metropolitano cuando hay partidos de Futbol. Simultáneamente además de los bolis, los dos venden en su casa helados, dulces y mercancía como ropa, calzado y detalles.
Este es su segundo crédito e invirtió el anterior en mejorar el surtido de mercancía en el negocio. Más adelante, sueña con tener un negocio más grande con buena localización: montarlo es también su mayor desafío ya que requiere dinero. Además, su meta es implemetarle un taller a su hijo, que está estudiando cursos de tecnólogo de autotécnica y técnico en gas vehicular en el SENA, órgano nacional que fomenta el aprendizaje.
texts.en:
Gilberto Rafael M. Hernández is 50 years old and lives in the Moras IV Etapa neighborhood in the town of Soledad, south of Barranquilla. He says that his neighborhood is relatively safe with very cooperative neighbors. He is married and has a 28 year old son. He has a business in his home where he sells merchandise, espcecially clothing and shoes. He does this with his wife and it is why he is asking for a loan of $1.600.000, to buy the described merchandise. Gilberto used to work with furniture and products for the home. He also worked as a messenger for 17 years until 1997, when he stopped because the business went broke. When he received his severance, he began to travel to Magangue, a town in the department of Bolívar on the shores of the Magdalena river, the most important river in Colombia. Gilberto would bring fish from Magangue which he would sell. His wife also would make and sell bolis, a type of Colombian ice cream. She sells it now in the Estadio Metropolitano when there are soccer games. In addition to selling the bolis, both of them sell ice cream, candy and merchandise such as clothes, shoes and acccesories from the house. This is his second loan and he invested the last one in improving the selection of merchandise in his business. In the future, he dreams of having a bigger business in a good location. Setting it up is also his biggest challenge since money is required. Additionally, his goal is to establish a workshop for his son, who is taking classes in automotive technology and vehicular gas technology in the SENA, a national organization that encourages learning.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, especially clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Grpo Las Mujeres Trunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de personas residen en Caserío Santa Rita Pachipá, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron  
un crédito en la Asociación ASDIR, ya que cada una emprendió una venta y dos de ellas venden lo que son 
cocos el cual lo comercializan en Quetzaltenango y las otras tienen venta de tortillas y pollos que lo comercializan en el municipio de San Antonio. A través de estas ventas se ha visto el mejoramiento económico
de estas familias, gracias al apoyo crediticio que la Asociación les ha brindado y al buen manejo del mismo
que estas personas le han dado al crédito ya que sus ingresos ha venido a cambiar la condición de vida de 
sus hogares.
texts.en:
This group of people live in en Caserío Santa Rita Pachipá, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They are seeking a loan with ASDIR. Each of them has a sales business. Two sell coconuts in Quetzaltenango, and the others sell tortillas and chickens in the town of San Antonio. By means of their businesses, these women have improved the economic conditions of their families. This is thanks to the loans provided by ASDIR and their good management of these funds. Their increased earnings have changed the quality of life in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more coconuts and chickens to sell and enlarge tortilla shop in San Antonio

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres El Quetzal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo D. personas residen en Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez, y solicitaron un  
crédito en L. Asociación ASDIR, con el cual cada una inició con una venta, los cuales son venta D. productos D. belleza, venta D. frutas, venta D. aguas, venta D. pollos, el cual lo comercializan en diferentes puntostanto en el municipio D. San Antonio como también en los municipios aledaños. Con estas ventas que realizan se ha visto L. superación que han tenido estas familias ya que el ingreso que ellas obtienen se ha conbertido  en una base fuerte que contribuye al mejoramiento económico del hogar y al mismo tiempo al logro D. los sueños para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of this group live in Prados El Quetzal, San Antonio, Suchitepéquez. They took out a loan with ASDIR which each of them invested in a sales business. The businesses incluD. sales of beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens. The sales are maD. at different places in the town of San Antonio and the neighboring towns. With their businesses, these families have seen improvements in their lives. Their earnings have improved the economic conditions of their homes and, at the same time, are fulfilling their dreams for their children.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products, fruit, soft drinks, and chickens for sale

loans.name: Nuevos Senderos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca se encuentra el  Banco Comunal Nuevos Senderos integrado por mujeres y hombres visionarios que no se dejan abatir por los inconvenientes del día a día, éste sector se caracteriza por la belleza natural de sus paisajes andinos, la arquitectura colonial de su centro histórico, su gastronomía y su gente atractivos turísticos de ésta hermosa región interandina del país. 

 María  Virginia arrienda una casa en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca allí vive con su esposo que trabaja en el IESS (Instituto Ecuatoriano Seguro Social) en el área de mantenimiento y con su última hija de 14 años de los cuatro que engendró, pues los tres ya son casados y viven independientes

A sus 46 años María Virginia se dedica a la venta  de comida rápida en ésta actividad lleva  20 años gracias a su hermano quien le enseñó este trabajo con él ha  logrado salir adelante con su familia, mantiene un pequeño local en su casa donde labora de  2 p.m. hasta las 8 p.m.

 Por su carisma y gran humor se lleva con todas las compañeras del bankito en el que se encuentra tres  ciclos y fue una socia quien la invito a formar  parte de este hermoso grupo de mujeres y hombres  luchadores, con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar gaseosas, aguas, papas, carnes, palillos y otros implementos para preparar sus comidas y  seguir creciendo en su negocio,  siendo su meta seguir saliendo adelante en su negocio y consu familia.
 
Carmen V. también es también socia de éste banco, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con su pareja en unión libre y con sus tres hijos de 11, 10 y 5 años, su esposo trabaja  como chofer en una empresa de transporte pesado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo gracias a una amiga que es socia del bankito,  el credito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la primera comunión de su hijo comprándole ropa y para pagar los gastos de la celebración eucarística, su meta es montar  una tienda que espera hacerlo realidad lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Nuevos Senderos” (New Paths) is located in the urban area of Cuenca and is made up of men and women visionaries who do not allow themselves to be discouraged by their day to day challenges. This sector is characterized by the natural beauty of its landscapes, the colonial architecture of its historical center, its food, and the friendly people from this lovely region of the country. María Virginia leases a home in the urban center of Cuenca. She lives there with her husband, who works as a maintenance man for the Ecuadorian Social Security Institution, and with her youngest daughter of 14. [María Virginia ] has a total of four children, but the others are married and independent. María Virginia is 46 years old and has been selling fast food for the past 20 years, thanks to her brother who taught her this line of work. Her intent is to help her family come out ahead. She works from 2:00 pm to 8:00 pm from a small area in her home. Her charisma and sense of humor allow her to get along very well with the other members of her little bank, which is in its third cycle. She was one of those invited to become part of this wonderful group of hard working men and women. She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, waters, potatoes, meats, toothpicks, and other implements needed to prepare her foods and to continue to grow her business. Her goal is to continue to move ahead with her family and business. Carmen is also a member of this bank and lives in the urban area of Cuenca with her life partner and three children, ages 11, 10, and 5. Her husband works as a driver for a heavy transport company. They don’t have their own house, so they rent. She is in her third cycle, thanks to a friend who is a member of the bank. She will use the money from this loan to pay for her son’s first communion. She will buy him clothes and pay for the Eucharistic expenses. She would like to open a store as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory / Communion expenses

loans.name: Balvina

texts.es: Doña Balvina es casada tiene 5 hijos.  Doña Balvina es comerciante desde hace 15 años tiene una venta en el mercado municipal de Antigua Guatemala los dias martes y jueves, y durante los dias viernes y domingos vende en el mercado municipal de San Martin Jilotepeque; en los dos puestos vende artículos de consumo diarío y en su tiempo libre teje güipiles, Doña Balvina solicita el crédito para invertir en la venta de artículos de consumo diario que tiene, comprar material para la elaboración de güipiles y gallinas.
texts.en:
Balvina is married and has five children. She has been a merchant for the past 15 years with a sales post at the municipal market of Antigua Guatemala from Monday through Thursday, and on Fridays and Sundays she sells at the municipal market of San Martin Jilotepeque. She sells grocery items at her posts, and in her free time she weaves traditional garments. Balvina is requesting the loan to invest in her business and also purchase chickens and weaving materials to make her garments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her sales posts and also purchase chickens and weaving materials.

loans.name: Solecitos Group

texts.es:
El nombre del grupo surge por que comentan que ellas son como el sol que brilla. Ellas se reúnen semanalmente para realizar sus pagos. Este grupo esta ubicado en Rancho Grande municipio de Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa Oax. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes de las cuales todas salen en la foto.


La representante del grupo se llama Nelida A. Rodríguez tiene 25 años y 2 hijos ella se dedica ala venta de cosméticos y cría marranos (cerdos) y necesita el préstamo para invertir en su actividad y así poder salir adelante y darle una buena educación a sus hijos, así como una alimentación adecuada.


Su meta es criar más marranos (cerdos)  y poder tener su propia carnicería, ampliar más su negocio de cosméticos.


Los integrantes del grupo son: Nelida A. Rodríguez vende cosméticos y cría marrano, Norma P. R. vende tamales, Flor Ofelia M. P. vende antojitos, Maritza M. P. vende antojitos, Natalia C. P. vende gasolina, Antonia C. V. vende antojitos, Paulina Domínguez V. vende ropa, Margarita Rodríguez Torales compra alimento para criar animales, Janette A. Rodríguez vende antojitos, Judith M. U. y abarrotes.
texts.en:
The name of the Solecitos group comes from the word "Sol" ("Sun") and is because the women are shining like the sun. The members meet weekly to make their payments. This group is located in the municipality of Rancho Grande, Acatlan de Pérez Figueroa Oax. The group consists of 10 members, all of whom are in the photo. They are represented by Nelida A. Rodríguez, who is 25 years old and has two children. She makes a living selling cosmetics and raising pigs, and needs the loan to invest in her activities so she can make headway and give her children a good education and adequate nourishment. Her goal is to raise more pigs and be able to have her own butcher shop, and also expand her cosmetics business more. The other members of the group are: Nelida A. Rodríguez, who also sells cosmetics and raises pigs; Norma P. R., who sells tamales; Flor Ofelia M. P. who sells snacks; Maritza M. P., who also sells snacks; Natalia C. P., who sells gasoline; Antonia C. V., who sells snacks; Paulina Domínguez V., who sells clothing; Margarita Rodríguez Torales, who buys animal feed; Janette A. Rodríguez, who sells snacks; and Judith M. U., who sells groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses to increase their income and offer a better future for their families

loans.name: Flor Pabla

texts.es:
Flor L. de 50 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es policía metropolitano ellos tienen 3 hijos de 28, 24 16 años.  

Flor inicio haciendo desayunos en la estación de líneas de furgonetas pero como no le era muy rentable decidió asociarse con una vecina para hacer almuerzos y meriendas en otro lugar. Ya tiene 16 años con un pequeño restaurante en su casa cocina mariscos, arroz con todo tipo de legumbres y carnes por estrategia ya no sigue asociada con su vecina. 

Trabaja todos los días desde las 08:00 am hasta las 15:00 pm. Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesas, sillas y ollas para su negocio de comidas. En el futuro quiere seguir con su negocio y que se incremente en clientela.
texts.en:
Flor is 50 years old and lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil in a cement house with basic services. Her husband is a police officer, and they have three children, ages 28, 24 and 16. Flor started out making breakfasts at the bus station, but because it wasn't very profitable she decided to join forces with a neighbor making lunches and snacks at another location. She now has 16 years' experience at the small restaurant she runs out of her home, making seafood, rice and all kinds of meats and legumes, and by strategy her business no longer is associated with her neighbor. Flor works every day from 8 a.m. until 3 p.m. With the loan, she plans to purchase tables, chairs and pots for her business. In the future, she wants to continue with the business and increase her clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables, chairs and pots

loans.name: Darling Scarleth

texts.es:
La Señora Darling Scarleth G. D. es casada tiene un niño de apenas dos añitos de edad,  tiene un puesto de venta de comida rápida ubicado al frente del Almacén mundo Elegante de Chinandega, lleva alrededor de 8 años de tener su  propio negocio anteriormente ella le ayudaba a ver el negocio a su mamá a Darling le gusto la idea de poner su negocio y no seguir dependiendo de ella lo inicio con un capital de C$5,000.00 aporte de su esposo, comenzó  vendiendo hogdog y gaseosas. 
La Señora Darling G. en la actualidad vende hamburguesas, shanwis, enchiladas, tacos, hogdog, gaseosas etc. Habre su negocio de lunes a domingos de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde sin descansar un solo día tiene dos trabajadores con ella  que le ayudan a preparar la comida su negocio lo a acondicionado poco a poco con estos financiamientos
texts.en:
Señora Darling Scarleth G. D. is married and has a son who is just 2 years old. She has a stall where she sells fast food located in front of the "Mundo Elegante" store in Chinandega. She has had this business for about 8 years. Previously she helped out with her mother's business. This gave her the idea of having her own business so that she would not continue to be dependent. She started out with capital of 5,000 Nicaraguan cordobas that was contributed by her husband. She began selling hot dogs and soft drinks. Currently Señora Darling G. sells hamburgers, sandwiches, enchiladas, tacos, hot dogs, soft drinks, etc. She operates her business from Monday to Sunday from 7 in the morning until 6 in the evening, without resting even one day. She has 2 people who work with her who help her to prepare the food for her business, which is gradually becoming a well-equipped business with these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sausage, bread, soft drinks, tomato sauce and cabbage

loans.name: Maria Yadira

texts.es:
La  Señora Maria Yadira P. O. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 22 años, ella vende ropa interior, ropita de niño y de adulto vende en la acera a dos cuadra aledañas del mercado. Su financiamiento lo solicito par comprar más mercadería al contado y no agarrarle a los proveedores que dan al crédito más cara y aveces ni le logra sacar loe esperado en ganancias.
La señora P. Oliva  anteriormente vendía al lado del el Mayoreo  el Bisne  ropa pero no tenia una ubicación estable su negocio lo inicio con C$3,000.00 ahorro propio de ella tiene dos hijos que mantener los cuales se encuentran en colegios y hay que sacarlos adelante.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel y de los cuales se siente muy bien con nosotros ya que le hemos servido para que su negocio mejore para incrementar su inventario y al suave ha venido mejorando su calidad de vida tambien
texts.en:
Señora Maria Yadira P. O. has been a merchant for 22 years. She sells underwear and clothing for children and adults. She sells on the sidewalk 2 blocks from the market. She requests a loan to buy more merchandise on a cash basis. This way she can avoid the other lenders who give very expensive credit, so that at times she does not manage to have the expected earnings. Señora P. Oliva previously sold clothing near the Bisne wholesale market, but she did not have a fixed location for her business. She started the business with 3,000 Nicaraguan cordobas of her own savings. She has 2 children to support; they are in school and she wants them to get ahead. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 10 years, and she feels very good about working with us, since we have served her to increase the inventory of her business and improved her quality of life as well.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business: clothing for children and adults, socks, lingerie, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Señoras De Taguan (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Señoras de Taguan es un banco comunal formado por mujeres emprendedoras que luchan para salir adelante junto a sus familias, este banco está ubicado en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  donde podemos disfrutar de la  belleza natural de la zona urbana y su cadena montañosa  que encierra laderas y mucha vegetación forjando un paisaje singular,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura,  ganadería y también a la elaboración de sombreros tejidos a mano.

Rosa tiene 40 años, se encuentra separada hace 7 años de su esposo ya que se fue ha trabajar en la costa Ecuatoriana y se hizo de otro compromiso, en su matrimonio concibió ocho hijos uno de ellos  es casado y vive de manera independiente, dos hijos trabajan en la ciudad  en el oficio de  albañil y es solo para sus gastos, otro de sus hijos no estudia pero le ayuda en casa, y los  otros cuatro aun son pequeños y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.  Su vivienda es propia aunque pequeña y de adobe  pero eso les brinda seguridad. 

Ella  se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva  la tierra de quienes le dan trabajo ocasional, también cría animales  tiene una vaquita, un borrego y gallinas las que vende solo cuando tiene algún apuro económico. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal  con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar un chancho para criarlo, engordarlo y venderlo.

Su sueño es superarse cada día más, incrementar sus animales y arreglar poco a poco su casa.

La señora María C. vive en la comunidad de Taguan en el  cantón  Sigsig, tiene como atractivos el Castillo De Chobshi que se encuentra a solo 7 Km. de la cabecera cantonal de Sígsig al sureste del Azuay, éste es  un conjunto arquitectónico de tipo “kallanca” es decir de forma rectangular con gruesos muros de aproximadamente un metro y medio.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años, se encuentra casada y es madre de ocho hijos de los cuales uno una hija se suicido dejando en la orfandad a dos  niños que ahora se  encuentran a su cargo y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad,  cinco de sus hijos  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca y los otros  salieron  de su comunidad en busca de mejores oportunidades y casi nunca le van a visitar, por ahora  vive sólo con su  hijo de 14 años que es  quien le ayuda en su hogar, sus dos nietos y  su esposo que  trabaja como albañil en centro de la ciudad y solo la visita el fin de semana, tienen  una casita pequeña que es de su propiedad.

María cría de animales como chanchos, gallinas, cuyes, ganado y solo los vende en sus apuros económicos, también se dedica a la agricultura siembra  hortalizas para luego viajar a  Cuenca y venderlas,  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el primer credito compró pollos que ya están listos para la venta y con el nuevo préstamo comprará unos chanchos para engordarlos y venderlos.  Su  sueño es de poder comprar más vacas para vender la producción de leche y elaborar quesos.
texts.en:
Señoras de Taguan is a community bank formed by enterprising women who work hard to make headway for their families. The group is located in the city of Cuenca, where they can enjoy the natural beauty of the city where the surrounding mountain range and plentiful vegetation forge a unique landscape. The locals make a living in agriculture, livestock and also making hand-woven sombreros. Rosa is 40 years old and has been separated from her husband for seven years, after he left to work on the Ecuadorian coast and found someone else. She had eight children from her marriage, one of whom is married and independent, two who work in the city at a construction office and help with expenses, one who is out of school but helps with the house, and the other four are still young and in school. She owns her home, which is small and made of adobe but still provides security. She makes a living in agricultural, cultivating the land and occasionally hiring workers. She also raises animal and has a cow, a sheep and chickens, which she sells only when she's in some economic trouble. This is her second loan cycle working with her community bank, and with the money she plans to purchase a pig to raise, fatten and sell. Her dream is to better herself more everyday, increase her number of livestock and fix her house up little by little. María C. lives in Taguan in the Sigsig area, which is located only 7 kilometers from Castillo De Chobshi, which is a popular architectural structure. She is 56 years old, married and has eight children. One of her daughters committed suicide, orphaning her two children, who are now under María's care and going to the community school. Five of María's children live in the city of Cuenca and the others left in search of better opportunities and almost never come to visit. For now, she only lives with her 14-year-old son, who helps around the house, her two grandchildren and her husband, who is a construction worker in the city center and only comes home on weekends. They have a small home that they own. María raises animals such as pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cattle, and only sells them during times of economic trouble. She also makes a living harvesting vegetables and selling them in the city of Cuenca. This is her second loan cycle with the community bank, and with the first one she purchased chicken that are now ready to sell, and with the new loan she plans to purchase pigs to fatten and then sell. Her dream is to be able to have more cows so she can sell their milk and make cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Sandra Maribel's Group

texts.es: Sandra, Andrea y Doña Raymunda se dedican a actividades diferentes, Sandra tiene una tienda en su casa en la cual vende articulos de consumo diario, Andrea se dedica a la compra y venta de periodicos en su casa y Doña Raymunda tiene una tortilleria y se dedica también a la crianza de gallinas, cerdos, etc. esto le ayuda y también tiene 2 hijos en Estados Unidos los cuales le envian ayuda, Doña Raymunda solicita el crédito para poder comprar mas concentrado para sus animales y maíz, ya que en esta época es mucho mas barato
texts.en:
Sandra, Andrea y Raymunda make a living in different activities. Sandra runs a store out of her home selling grocery items, Andrea buys and sells periodicals out of her home and Raymunda has a tortilla shop and also raises cattle, pigs and other animals. Raymunda also has two children in the United States who send back money. She is requesting the loan to purchase more feed and corn for her animals since those items are very cheap at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains and other items

loans.name: Carla Mayela

texts.es:
La Señora Carla Mayela P. P.  es comerciante de este mercado desde hace  11  años es casada tiene tres hijos por los cuales ella se esfuerza grandemente por sacarlos adelante.
Su negocio empezo con un capital de C$5,000.00 que fueron aporte de su esposo con esto ella empezo vendiendo solo bolsos pero se iba a vender a la ciudad de el viejo luego decidio dejar de vender en el viejo y puso su negocio en la acera de el negocio de su esposo. Ella ocupa los financiamientos para comprar mercadería para su negocio y tenerlo surtido comprar bolsos finos, billeteras de hombres fajas, carteras de mano de dama fajas de dama, chinelas de marca de dama y de varón vende de todo un poco.
Sus niños estudian los tres en tiempos   libres le ayudan a vender en el negocio ella se esfuerza por la educación de sus hijos para sacarlos adelante, según doña Carla P. le agradece infinitamente a la institución  por que nunca le han dicho que no siempre le han ayudado a inyectarle a mi negocio y a ir mejorando mi calidad de vida para mis hijos ya que hemos sabido administrar muy bien los créditos.
texts.en:
Carla Mayela P. P. has been a shopkeeper in the market for the past 11 years. She is married and has three children. They are the reason she puts forth such a big effort to get ahead. Her business began with a capital of C$5,000.00, an investment provided by her husband. With this, she started selling just bags in the city of El Viejo, but later, she decided to stop selling there and instead sell on the sidewalk in front of her husband's business. She needs the financing to buy merchandise for her business and have a varied purchase of good quality purses, men's wallets, men's and women's belts, women's handbags, name brand men's and women's sandals, etc. She sells a little bit of everything. All of her children attend school, but in their free time they help her sell her merchandise. She works hard for the education of her children so that they come out ahead. Carla says "I really appreciate the institution because they have never told me no and have always helped foster the progress of my business so I can improve the quality of life for my children, now that we know how to manage the loans well.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags and wallets

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa,  tiene 60 años y tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su esposo José Luís trabaja en la institución educativa de "La Salle" de Urubamba, él trabaja como técnico de mecánica.  

Santusa nos cuenta que estudió corte y confección en la ciudad de Lima en el centro educativo ocupacional “Arte Femenino” y que le sirvió mucho para emprender su propio negocio entonces la socia al ver que sus vecinas necesitaban que se les arreglaran sus ropas, la socio decidió abrir en su casa un taller de corte y confección y así de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos. Actualmente, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su taller de costura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

Santusa pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente,  la socia requiere el préstamo para el gasto familiar. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Santusa is 60 years old and has five children. She is a responsible mother who directs her energies daily toward looking for ways to get ahead and to offer her children a better future. Her husband José Luís works as a technical mechanic in the La Salle educational institution in Urubamba. Santusa studied dressmaking in the city of Lima in the Feminine Arts occupational education center. This helped her to launch her own business. Upon seeing that her neighbors needed their clothes altered, she decided to open a dressmaking shop within her home to address their needs. She actually alternates between household activities and dressmaking activities. She has been working in this profession for several years already and it has gone very well due to the effort and determination she puts into her work. Santusa is a member of the Third Millennium communal bank of the Arariwa Association. Her first loan as a member was for $100, which she invested in her business. She needs the current loan for family expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she is offered through Kiva partner Third Millennium, and she promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For family expenses.

loans.name: Cándida Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Cándida Rosa D. H. es comerciante de este mercado desde hace 14 años que vende en su puesto de venta ella vende todo lo que es medicina natural vende piñatas que las elabora ella con la ayuda de su mamá anteriormente ella estudiaba y su mamá le administraba su negocio pero ahora ella decidio permanecer en el tramo para que la mamá descanse.
Ambas administran el negocio empezaron el negocio con un capital de C$ 8,000.00 con poco inventario  ahora su negocio es más grande mejor acondicionado ahora tengo unos cajones en donde guardo la mercadería elabora tambien piñatas, ofrenda florales, altares etc.
Sus financiamientos siempre los solicita para su negocio de los cuales saca ganancias  y es donde mejora su calidad de vida no tiene hijos que mantener pero si tiene a cargos a sus padres que ya estan señores y ella los ve.
texts.en:
Cándida Rosa D. H. has been a merchant in this market for 14 years. In her stall, she sells natural medicines and also piñatas that she makes with the help of her mother. Previously, Cándida studied while her mother tended the store, but now she has decided to run the business and let her mother rest. They both manage the business. They began with an investment of 8000 cordobas and very little inventory. Today, it is much larger, with trunks where they can store merchandise. In addition to piñatas, they make floral offerings and altars. Cándida always profits from the loans she takes out for the business. This is how she improves her quality of life. She doesn’t have children, but she is responsible for the care of her elderly parents.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for store and materials for making piñatas

loans.name: Grupo Unido Group

texts.es:
JUDITH MARISOL, TIENE 34 AÑOS, TIENE DOS PEQUEÑOS HIJOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO D. NOMBRE "GRUPO UNIDO", FORMADO POR 10 PERSONAS MUY TRABAJADORAS RESIDENTES DEL DISTRITO D. CARABAYLLO, QUIENES LA ELIGIERON COMO SECRETARIA D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
JUDITH MARISOL TIENE DOS ACTIVIDADES, QUE SON LAS QUE LE GENERAN INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS PARA MANTENER A SUS DOS HIJOS YA QUE ELLA ES PADRE Y MADRE PARA ELLOS.
UNA D. SUS ACTIVIDADES HACE CUATRO AÑOS, ES PRESTAR SERVICIO A UNA EMPRESA EN LA FABRICACIÓN D. ARTICULOS D. ARTESANÍA, CON LOS INGRESOS D. ÉSTA ACTIVIDAD ELLA HA PODIDO ADQUIRIR POCO A POCO SUS MÁQUINAS PARA PRESTAR SERVICIO D. CONFECCIÓN ACTIVIDAD A LA QUE SE DEDICA HACE HACE DIEZ AÑOS.
CON SUS INGRESOS, ELLA HA LOGRADO TENER UNA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA, Y SE PROYECTA A CONSEGUIR MAS ADELANTE APERTURAR UN TALLER D. COSTURA CON MÁQUINAS COMPLETAS Y MODERNIZADAS.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA D. MATERILAES NECESARIOS PARA LA FABRICACIÓN D. ARTÍCULOS D. ARTESANÍA.
texts.en:
Judith Marisol is 34 years old and has two small children. She heads up the “Grupo Unido” [United Group] communal bank. Grupo Unido has ten hardworking members from the Carabayllo district, who have elected Judith as their secretary of the board of directors. Judith has two businesses to generate income for her family, where she fills the roles of both father and mother. For the last four years, she has worked for a company making handicrafts. With these earnings, she has, little by little, acquired the machines for making clothing, a traD. she has practiced for ten years. With her earnings, Judith has achieved economic stability. In the future, she plans to open a tailor workshop with complete and modern equipment. This loan will be used to buy materials for making handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for making handicrafts

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Ana Mercedes B. S., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys se desempeña como sub-director del centro, es casada con dos hijas, ambas viven con ella pero no dependen de ella.

La señora Ana María B. S. solicito el crédito para repara el techo de su casa ya que lo tiene bien sarroso y se le pasa toda el agua cuando llueve, además que las puertas que tiene son tablones y necesitas comprarlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Mercedes B. S. works for the Marcos Dessys School as the center’s assistant director. She is married and has two daughters. They both live with her, but they are not dependents.

Sra. Ana Mercedes is requesting a loan to repair the roof of her house. It is covered with sediment from all the water when it rains. In addition, the doorways of her house have wooden planks covering them, so she needs to buy doors to install.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, crossbeams, and doors

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Julia S. R., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es soltera, con un hijo a su cargo.

La señora Bertha Julia solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras en su casa ya que tiene paredes de tablas y necesita levantarlas de concreto poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha Julia S. R. works as an elementary school teacher as the Marcos Dessys School in Chinandenga. She is single and has a dependent child.

Sra. Bertha Julia is requesting a loan to make improvements to her home. The wooden frames for the walls are already built, but the concrete needs to be poured in gradually.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blocks, crossbeams, and nails

loans.name: Elourdes Maribel

texts.es:
La señora  Elourdes Z. es socia del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente, vive en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay,  está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera de los Andes Ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la venta de bisutería en un puesto propio en el mercado de la feria libre (Mercado de Cuenca), labora de 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. solo tres días a la semana y el resto de días se dedica a su hogar pero ya se encuentra en la posibilidad de trabajar todos los días.

Elourdes es oriunda de la provincia del Guayas se encuentra cuatro años en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 35 años  casada hace varios años  y ha concebido tres  hijos quienes se encuentran de 20, 19 y 6 años, sus dos primeros hijos pasan en casa y  su ultimo hijo estudia en una escuela de la urbe, su esposo es comerciante de pollos, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el dinero que reciba del nuevo préstamo va a  comprar  diademas, moños, vinchas, aretes y mas bisutería para su negocio. Su sueño es de llegar a comprarse un carro.
texts.en:
Elourdes Z. is a member of the "Sol Naciente" ("Rising Sun") communal bank. She lives in the urban area of the city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province. The city lies in the central valley of the Ecuadorian Andes; it is Ecuador's third leading city and is well-known for maintaining the beauty and tranquility of an older city. Its historic center was declared a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site in 1999. Elourdes works selling costume jewelry from her own stand in the open market (Cuenca Market). She works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m., only three days a week, and on the other days she dedicates herself to her household tasks. However, she is considering the possibility of working every day. Elourdes is a native of Guayas province who has lived in Cuenca for four years. She is 35 years old and has been married for some years. She has three children who are now aged 20, 19 and 6. Her two older children stay at home, and her youngest child goes to school in the city. Her husband works selling chickens. They do not have their own house, so they live in rented quarters. She is currently in her third loan cycle, and the loans have benefited her business. With the funds she receives from the new loan, she will buy diadems, bows, headbands, earrings and more costume jewelry for her business. Her dream is to be able to buy herself a car.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying diadems, bows, headbands, earrings and more costume jewelry to stock her business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es natural de Urubamba,  tiene 54 años y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales todavía depende de la socia,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Claudia tiene una pequeña empresa de venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo cemento, arena, piedra y muchas cosas más, ella empieza su actividad de trabajo a las 6 de la mañana cuando preparara desayuno para sus hijos y para su esposo, ella después se va a trabajar al negocio. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Claudia pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar dos volquetes de hormigón. El anhelo de la socia es abrir una empresa familiar donde se alquilé maquinaria pesada y desearía empezar comprando una palanca mecánica.   
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Claudia is a native of Urubamba. She is 54 years old and has four children who still depend on her. She is a responsible mother who works hard and is always looking for opportunities to get ahead and to build a better future for her children. Claudia has a small business selling construction materials including cement, sand, rock and much more. She starts working at 6 in the morning, when she prepares breakfast for her children and husband. Afterward, she goes to her place of business. She has already spent six years in this line of work and has done very well thanks to the effort she puts forth in her job. Claudia is a member of the Third Millinneum communal bank, part of the Arariwa Association. Her first loan as a member was for $100, which she invested in her business. She requires the current loan in order to buy two cement trucks. Her dream is to open a family business of heavy machinery rentals, and she would also like to purchase a mechanical lift. She is grateful for the opportunity offered to her by Kiva partner Third Millinneum communal bank, and she promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two cement trucks.

loans.name: Adán William

texts.es:
Adán Rodríguez de 47 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa le ayuda en la tienda ellos tienen 3 hijos de 11, 17 y la de 18 años que es incapacitada. 

Cuando Adán trabajaba invirtió su sueldo en un congelado pequeño y compro algunos víveres que son dispensables en una tienda. Poco a poco aumento su mercadería con legumbres y carnes.

Adán ahora tiene una tienda muy surtida uno de los productos que mas vende es el arroz, trabaja desde las 07:00 am.  Para tener otros ingresos el trabaja como soldador. La inseguridad que siente en el sector por donde vive le es de dificultad para trabajar con excelencia.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceites, legumbres para su tienda. En el futuro quiere arreglar el patio de su casa y poderles dar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adán Rodríguez, 47 years old, lives in the Paraíso sector of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement, and the only utilities it has are lights and water. His wife helps him in the store. They have three children, ages 11 and 17 years, and an 18-year-old daughter who is disabled. While Adán was working, he invested his salary in a small freezer and bought some perishable items at a store. Little by little he added legumes and meats to his merchandise. Adán now has a well-stocked store. One of his best-selling products is rice. He works from 7:00 am on, and for extra income he works as a solderer. The insecurity felt in his sector of the city makes it difficult to do excellent work. With this loan he wants to buy rice, oil, and legumes for his shop. In the future he would like to fix up the patio of his house and be able to give his children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, legumes

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
Elva tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Desde muy joven se dedicó a la actividad agrícola, específicamente al cultivo de la hoja de coca. Ella siempre trata de que su parcela tenga una buena producción, ya que posee una tierra excelente para la siembra de su producto; para ello cuenta con su esposo y los trabajadores que contrata para la siembra y cosecha. Por lo general su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a un precio que le permita cubrir las necesidades familiares. 
Para el futuro piensa seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura, comprando más terrenos con la finalidad de cultivar su producto tradicional y a la vez empezar con la producción de piña.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y asegura cumplir fielmente el pago de todas sus cuotas; además se siente contento con su banco comunal, ya que le brinda apoyo ante cualquier circunstancia. Con el dinero solicitado hará el mantenimiento de sus tierras de cultivo, para que no existan contratiempos en el futuro.
texts.en:
Elva is 30 years old. She is married and has three school-aged children. She lives in Quimbiri, where she has her own home. She has been farming since she was very young, specifically coca leaves. She always tries to make her parcel produce a good harvest, now that she has good land for cultivating. Her husband and hired hands help with the planting and harvest. For the most part she sells her harvest in gathering places in her area, at prices that allow her to cover her family expenses. In the future she would like to buy more land in order to continue farming her traditional crop and also begin growing pineapple. This will be her first loan through MFP and she promises that she will make all of her payments on schedule. She is very happy with her communal bank, because it provides support for her under any circumstance. She will use the money from this loan to provide maintenance on her land to avoid future complications.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farmland Maintenance

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es: Blanca Estela, tiene 43 años, junto con su esposo se dedican a comercializar sandalias en los lugares aledaños de sonde viven, la actividad vienen ejerciendo aproximadamente hace 10 años, la cual les ha ayudado para sostener a su familia, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, el primero lo pagaron sin problemas de atraso, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona trabajadora y colaborador en su comunidad, el crédito le servirán para incrementar su venta.
texts.en:
Blanca is 43 years old and she and her husband sell sandals in the outskirts of the zone where they live. They have been doing this for about ten years and it has helped them to support their family. This will be her second loan through ASDIR. She repaid the previous one without falling behind in her payments. Her personal references tell us that she is a very hard working person who contributes to her community. She will use the money from this loan to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for making sandals

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifania tiene 32 años, actualmente vive con su prometido y tienen 3 hijos en edad escolar. Reside en la majestuosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen su casa propia.

Aunque creció en una casa hecha a base de quincha y barro, no significó que la vida no le iba dar la oportunidad de progreso. Desde hace 10 años viene trabajando en un puesto dentro de una escuela de menores; vende comida rápida, golosinas, galletas, gaseosas, etc. Generalmente trabaja sola y se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, ya que le brinda buenos resultados, suficientes para solventar sus necesidades familiares. Para el futuro espera construir su casa de material noble, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y asegura que estos créditos he han traído muchos beneficios. En efecto, se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas puntualmente, además se siente satisfecha y contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal.

Con el dinero que ahora solicita planea comprar más productos para su puesto, ya que con ello tendrá mayor variedad de productos qué ofrecer a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Epifania is 32 years old and currently lives with her fiancé and 3 school-age children. They reside in the majestic Ayacuchana jungle, specifically in a place called "Quimbiri," where they have their own home. Although she was raised in a house made of wattle and daub, life has still given her opportunity to advance. For 10 years she has worked in a retail store selling fast food, sweets, cookies, soft drinks, etc. She generally works alone and feels satisfied with her work. It has already given her enough money to pay for household necessities. In the future, she hopes to build a house of noble material, with the goal of improving her children's standard of living. This is her third loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. She assures us that the loans have brought her many benefits. She is committed to making her payments on time, and she feels satisfied and content to be a member of her communal bank. With this loan, she plans to purchase more products for work; therefore, she will have a greater variety of products to offer to her more-demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Santos Sabina

texts.es: Santos Sabina, es de 49 años de edad, se dedica a la confección y venta de roba para dama, tiene 5 hijos 2 barones y 3 mujeres quienes le ayudan en atender el negocio, en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y participativa en su comunidad, el crédito lo invierta en la compara de materiales para confeccionar sus productos.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and makes and sells ladies clothing. She has five children, two gentlemen, and three ladies who help her run the business. This will be her first loan through ASDIR. Her personal references tell us that she is a very responsible person who contributes to her community. She will use the money from this loan to invest in materials and supplies that she needs to make her products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and Supplies

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María Leonor tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene a su cargo dos hijos menores, reside en Monsefú, zona bastante conocida dentro del departamento de Lambayeque por sus fiestas religiosas, la mayor parte de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la artesanía.

Se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado San Cristóbal, un mercado situado en una zona marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Ella tiene mas de 15 años de experiencia en el rubro y es bastante conocida en el sector. La mayor parte de comerciantes de este mercado se dedican a la venta de verduras y abarrotes, carnes y otros productos al publico en general y a las amas de casa. Es un mercadillo que tiene mas de 25 años de instalado y cuenta con bastante afluencia de publico comprador.

Este negocio es la unica fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerlo, la calidad de los productos que brinda y el buen trato que ofrece la han hecho conocida y ahora cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren su negocio.

Maria Leonor se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en hacer mejoras en su vivienda, pues debido a las lluvias, se ha filtrado agua, es buscando el bienestar de su familia que realizara las mejoras necesarias.

Ella es una mujer entregada a su trabajo y a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos una educación de calidad que les garantice un próspero porvenir. María Leonor ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Leonor is 40 years old. She is a single mother, and she has two minor children. She lives in Monsefú, a region within the Lambayeque department that is well-known for its religious festivals. Most of the inhabitants work at farming and handicrafts. She sells fish at the San Cristóbal market, which is in the outlying area of the city of Chiclayo. She has over 15 years of experience in this field, and she is well known in the area. Most of the merchants in this market sell vegetables, groceries, meat, and other products to the general public and housewives. The market has been set up for over 25 years, and there are plenty of people who go there to make purchases. This business is the only source of income she has to get her children ahead. Therefore, she tries to give the best of herself to maintain it. The good quality of the products and the good service she provides have made her well known. She now has a group of loyal customers who prefer her business. María Leonar is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 2,000 PEN. She plans on investing in making improvements to her house. Due to the rains, water has been leaking. She will make the necessary improvements because she is looking out for the well-being of her family. She is a woman who is devoted to her work and her family. Her greatest wish is to give her children a quality education that guarantees them a prosperous future. María Leonor has previously worked with our institution, and she has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the rain damage to her house

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando P. M. tiene 44 años y vive en el barrio Las Palmas de la ciudad de Barranquilla, se dedica a vender en su negocio llamado Arreglos florales “La bendición García” allí él y su esposa compran flores y los jarrones rudimentarios que convierten en hermosos floreros decorados externamente, portando las mas hermosas flores artificiales, que a través de dos vendedores y distribuyen por toda Barranquilla en dos vehículos de madera con 3 ruedas llamados carretillas. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar floreros rudimentarios, flores artificiales  en Ponedera, un pueblo del departamento del Atlántico y también compraran mecedoras que vienen desde San Pues en el Departamento de Sucre.  

Su negocio de arreglos florales lo inició hace cuatro años y su venta de mercancías como mecedoras entre otras, la agregó hace 2 años, su venta las hacen 2 empleados mediante el sistema de crédito y Orlando cobra semanalmente o de acuerdo al plan de pagos que hayan pactado con los clientes.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Santo Domingo, con los financiamientos ha logrado mayor impacto en las ventas y por eso hoy tienen 2 trabajadores que son los que ahora reparten. Su sueño es montar una distribuidora que reparta mercancía en todas las poblaciones del área metropolitana de Barranquilla
texts.en:
Orlando P. M. is 44 years old and lives in the Las Palmas neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla. He has a flower-arranging business called "La Bendición García." He and his wife buy flowers and plain jars, which they turn into beautiful decorated vases containing gorgeous artifical flowers. They have two salesmen and deliver throughout all of Barranquilla in two three-wheeled wooden vehicles called "carretillas." They are currently requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 pesos to buy vases and artifical flowers in Pondedera, a town in the department of Atlántico. They will also buy rocking chairs that come from San Pues, in the department of Sucre. They started their flower-arranging business four years ago, and started selling rocking chairs and other merchandise two years ago. Two employees take care of the sales, and the business offers weekly and other types of payment plans, which Orlando charges for. This is his third loan with the Fundación Santo Domingo. He's used the financing to increase his sales, which is why they now have two employees to share the work. His dream is to set up a distribution business that would deliver merchandise to all the communities in the greater Barranquilla metropolitan area.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plain vases, artificial flowers, and rocking chairs

loans.name: Digna Ada Luz

texts.es:
La señora Digna Ada Luz M. se desempeña como maestra de primaria y trabaja en la escuela Marcos Dessys  en la Ciudad de Chinandega, es casada pero vive sola ya que su esposo esta fuera del país habita en el Reparto 12 de Septiembre.

La señora Digna solicitó el crédito para gastos personales servicios básicos y para cancelar deudas y para ayudarle a su familia con gastos.
texts.en:
Sra. Digna Ada Luz M. is an elementary school teacher who works at the Marcos Dessys School in the city of Chinandega. She is married, but she lives alone in the September 12th division because her husband is out of the country.

Sra. Digna is requesting a loan for personal expenses such as basic services, cancellation of debts, and to help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses & cancellation of debts

loans.name: Jesús Julián

texts.es: Jesús Julián es de 29 años de edad, cuenta con dos hijos varones, es maestro de educación primaria, en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable, el crédito lo invierte en la compra de una computadora que le es de mucha utilidad para desarrollar sus mejor su labor como maestro.
texts.en:
Jesús Julián is 29 years old. He has two sons and is an elementary school teacher. This is the first loan he's applied for with ASDIR. His personal references say he is a responsible person. He is using the loan to buy a computer, which will be very useful to him in his work as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciano, tiene 36 años y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales todavía depende de la socia,  ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Feliciana tiene una pequeña empresa de venta de golosinas en el Terminal Terrestre de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Feliciana pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son 6 años que participa en el banco comunal y su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, galletas, caramelos, yogurt y helados. El anhelo de la socia es tener una propia tienda en su domicilio. La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que su mamá tenia una casa en la ciudad de Zurite pero por la causa de las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad, inundaron la casa de su mamá dejándola deshabitada. Actualmente, su mamá esta viviendo en un campamento cerca a la ciudad.  
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Zurite esta situada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 36 years old. She has four children who still depend on her. She is a responsible mother who's always looking for opportunities to get ahead and with her daily efforts provide her children with a better future. Feliciana has a little business selling sweets in the bus station in the city of Urubamba. She's had the business for six years and it's gone very well because of her commitment to her work. Feliciana belongs to the Tercer Milenio village bank, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She's been a member for six years, and her first loan was for $100, which she invested in her business. Currently, she is requesting the loan to purchase soft frinks, cookies, candies, yogurt, and ice cream. Her dream is to have her own shop in her home. She tells us sadly that her mother had a house in the city of Zurite, but that because of heavy rain in the city, the house was flooded, leaving her homeless. At the moment, her mother is living in an encampment near the city. Feliciana is grateful for the opportunity this offers her and is committed to making her payments in full and on time. Zurite is 45 minutes from the city of Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, cookies, candies, yogurt, and ice cream

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es una mujer muy amable y sociable de 25 años, es casada y fruto de ello tienen una hermosa hijita. Vive en la selva ayacuchana, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una humilde casa construida a base de madera.

Cuando Haydee observó de cerca a los comerciantes de comestibles, tanto mayoristas y minoristas, y las ganancias que obtenían por ello, decidió incursionar en el mismo negocio. Hasta el momento le va muy bien, tanto en el aspecto económico y familiar, pues logra cubrir los gastos de su pequeña hija, ya que para ella y su esposo es la razón de poder seguir trabajando incansablemente. Ocasionalmente recibe la ayuda de su esposo cuando él dispone de tiempo libre, pero por lo general trabaja sola en su tienda de abarrotes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Para el futuro tiene pensado ampliar su tienda, para poder captar a más clientes y a la vez fidelizar a los que ya tiene, ofreciendo productos acorde a su poder adquisitivo.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se siente seguro de cumplir con sus pagos, además agradece por las facilidades que le otorgan con el crédito. El dinero solicitado lo usará para la compra de más productos con los cuales surtir su tienda, con la finalidad de incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a very kind and sociable 25 year old woman, married, and has a beautiful little daughter. She lives in the jungle in Ayacucho, in the locality of "Quimbiri," where she has a humble home constructed from wood.

When Haydee looked at nearby food sellers, both wholesale and retail, and the profits they made, she decide to enter the same business. From the moment she started, things have been going well, both with the business and with her family, The business helps to cover the expenses of her baby girl, who is the reason she and her husband work incessantly. Occasionally her husband helps out when he has free time, but generally she works alone in her grocery store from 6 in the morning until 8 at night. In the future she wants to expand her store to be able to gain more clients while staying loyal to those she already has, offering them greater purchasing power.

This is her first loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be able to complete her payments. Also she is grateful for being offered this loan. The loan will be used to buy more products to stock her store to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
Mayra T. es socia del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, siendo esta ciudad muy conocida por sus ríos, su belleza arquitectónica, su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable. Nuestra socia tiene 31 años,  de estado civil casada y madre de tres hijos de 13, 12 y 7 años,  todos estudiantes de educación básica,  su esposo trabaja en una fábrica de elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en  casa de un familiar.

Mayra se dedica al arreglo y limpieza  de casas de  lunes a viernes en un horario extendido de  8 a.m. a 7 p.m. actividad que realiza por ya siete años,  los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de salchipapas en las canchas deportivas de su sector y lleva cinco años en esta dura labor;  como es una mujer luchadora siempre ha buscado la manera de salir adelante y ahora  se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo dentro de su banco comunal  y todos los créditos los ha invertido en  su negocio y en su hogar, con el dinero que reciba del crédito solicitado va a pagar de  una freidora y cocina industrial que compró a sus jefes para incrementar su negocio de comida rápida.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mayra T. is a member of the Sol Naciente (Rising Sun) Communal Bank. She lives in the suburbs of the city of Cuenca, well known for its rivers, beautiful architecture, restaurants and warm, friendly people. Our member is 31 years old, married and mother of three children ages 13, 12 and 7. All the children are basic education students and her husband works in a factory making stucco ceiling tiles. Although they don’t live in a home of their own, they live in the house of a family member. For the past seven years, Mayra has tidied and cleaned houses from Monday to Friday from 8am to 7pm. On the weekends she sells “salchipapas” (a type of fast food made of fried potatoes and sausages) at the local sports fields. She has been doing this for the past 5 years. As she is a high-spirited woman, she has always looked for ways to advance herself. She is now in her 4th cycle with the communal bank and all the loans have been used for her business and for her home. With the money she receives from the loan she is currently soliciting, she will pay for a deep fat fryer and an industrial cooking range that she bought from her bosses in order to expand her fast food business. Her goal is to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the purchase of a deep fat fryer and an industrial cooking range.

loans.name: Jasmina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jasmina del Socorro M. R., es trabajadora de la escuela Marcos Dessys se desempeña como directora del centro, es casad con tres hijas todas estudian.

La señora M. R. solicito el crédito para reparar su casa de habitación ya que se acerca el invierno y se le pasa el zinc.
texts.en:
Sra. Jasmina del Socorro M. R. works for the Marcos Dessys School as the center’s director. She is married and has three daughters in school.

Sra. M. R. is requesting a loan to repair her house, which is lacking zinc, in anticipation of winter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for home repairs such as zinc, cement, and blocks

loans.name: Paola Elizabeth

texts.es: Paola es de 21 años de edad, es soltera en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita,  trabaja en una institución de desarrollo, el préstamo lo necesita para comprar una computadora, que le servirá en estudio universitarios que actualmente esta cruzando, sus referencias indican que es una persona responsable con ganas de superar.
texts.en:
Paola is 21 years old, single and a member of ASDIR. This is the first loan she has requested. She works in a development institution. The loan is needed to buy a computer that will be used for the university courses that she is currently taking. Her references show she is a responsible person with the desire to excel.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase items for his home such as a television, wardrobe, and refrigerator

loans.name: Mercedes Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes Azucena E. hurtada     ella se desempeña como profesora de educación primaria ella tiene de laborar como docente  treinta y dos  años, es madre de tres hijos, ella es casada actualmente.
