Ha tenido  nueve  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una construcción de un muro  en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mercedes Azucena E. H. has been a primary school teacher for thirty-two years. She is the mother of three children and is currently married. She has had nine previous loans from CEPRODEL and has used each of them to make improvements to her home. She will use this loan to build a wall and thereby make her home more respectable.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials such as stones and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Juana del Socorro H. H., trabaja para la escuela Marcos Dessys de la ciudad de Chinandega, se desempeña como maestra de primaria es casada tiene un hijo de tan solo 1 añito, habita en el barrio Roberto González.

La señora Juana solicito el crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que la tiene a media y necesita a asegurarla por que la mayor parte del tiempo pasa sola y se le pueden meter a robar sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro H. H. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School in Chinandega. She is married, lives in the Roberto González neighborhood, and has a one-year-old son. Juana is requesting a loan to make repairs to her home, since it is not currently secure and robbers could enter to steal her belongings.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, bricks, and zinc tiles

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas E Independientes Group

texts.es:
Cuando Lorena recibió la invitación para pertenecer a  “EDAPROSPO” no imagino que su vida cambiaria, ella  es una persona que  ha conocido la pobreza extrema aun recuerda con nostalgia cuando no tenia para comer ni un lugar digno donD. vivir, junto a su esposo pasaron mucha necesidad, como ella sabia tejer empezó a confeccionar chompas y ponchos los que vendía a sus amigos y familiares D. la misma forma  también aprendió a preparar yogurt, mermelada. Esas ventas le permitieron obtener ganancias y ahorrar, su  primer préstamo lo invirtió en la compra D. lanas  así pudo juntar un capital y puso una bodega en su casa y compro su primer auto, ahora tiene 3 autos que alquila a terceros lo cual le genera ingresos diarios, con  sus ganancias pudo construir su casa D. material noble y llevar una mejor calidad D. vida.
Lorena esta feliz por todo lo que ha logrado sabe que le costo mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ella siempre se proyecta para el futuro, ahora quiere tener una empresa D. moto taxis esta estudiando el mercado y piensa comprar algunas motos D. segunda mano y empezar en ese negocio, su préstamo lo usara para abastecer su bodega con mas mercadería  ya que por dedicarse a los autos la descuido un poco, por otro lado es la presidenta del grupo “MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES “  grupo recién formado pero con mucho animo para trabajar.

* La Sra. Lorena es la tercera D. las paradas aparece con polo rojo
texts.en:
When Lorena received the invitation to be part of “EDAPROSPO” she never imagined it would change her life. She is a person who has known extreme poverty and she reflects on the time when she had nothing to eat and nowhere to live. Along with her husband, she suffered great hardships. As she knew how to knit, she began making sweaters and ponchos that she sold to her friends and family. She also learned how to make yogurt and jams. These sales allowed her to obtain a living and also to save. She used her first loan to buy wool and in this way amass capital. She put a small store in her house and bought her first car. She now has 3 cars that she rents to third parties, generating her daily income. With her earnings she will be able to build her house from solid material and gain a better quality of life. Lorena is happy for all that she has accomplished. She knows that is took a lot of strength and sacrifice. She always planned for the future. Now that she has a taxi car business, she is studying marketing and is thinking about buying a few second hand cars and starting this business. She will use her loan to supply her home store with more merchandise as while she has been busy with the car business her home has been a little neglected. On the siD. is the president of the group “MUJERES DECIDIDAS E INDEPENDIENTES” (Decisive and Independent Women), a group recently created but with a lot of desire to work. * Mrs. Lorena is three over, wearing a red shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to replenish the small store in her home.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Vive en la ceja de la selva ayacuchana, en la  localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Desde hace 10 años tiene un disco centro donde vende CD’s para todo público, anteriormente tenía una botica. Aunque nunca se imaginó que su actual negocio lo llevaría a ver tan buenas ganancias por la venta de sus artículos. Es por ello, que quincenalmente compra nuevos CD’s en grandes cantidades y de toda las variedades, pues con ello logra captar a sus clientes de manera rápida y oportuna. Actualmente tiene dos locales en puntos estratégicos de su localidad y cuenta con una persona que se hace cargo de uno de ellos.
En el futuro piensa ampliar su cartera de clientes incursionando en la venta de ropa y artefactos electrodomésticos, para que así pueda satisfacer la amplia demanda de sus clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y agradece los beneficios que le otorgan, es por ello que cumplirá con sus cuotas establecidas; también agradece la confianza de su banco comunal y el buen manejo que llevan entre todos los integrantes.

Con el dinero que solicita comprará más CD’s clásicos y contemporáneos, según los gustos y preferencias de sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Juan is 42-years old, married and has three children. He lives at the edge of the Ayacuchana jungle, in the area of Quimbiri, where he lives in his own house. For ten years now, he has had a music store where he sells CD’s for all audiences; before, he had a pharmacy shop. He never imagined that his current business would bring such good profits for selling his products. For this reason, every two weeks, he buys new CD’s in large quantities and in a varied assortment to attract his customers quickly and at the right moment. He currently has two locations strategically located in the area, and has an employee that tends one of the stores. In the future, he plans to increase his customer portfolio by expanding into the sales of clothes and home appliances to meet the wide demand of his customers. This is his third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the benefits provided; for this reason, he is committed to fulfill the established payments; he is also grateful for the trust from his community bank and the good management by all its members. With the money from the loan, he will buy more classic and contemporary CD’s for the varied tastes and preferences of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase his merchandise

loans.name: Yerkenie

texts.es: El Sr. Yerkenie G. S.     él se desempeña como Profesor de educación primaria  el tiene de laborar  para esta institución doce  años, es padre de un  hijos en edad escolar, el es casado  actualmente. Ha tenido  tres  créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras en  su casa de habitación, para tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Yerkenie G. S. has been a primary school teacher for twelve years. He is the father of two school-age children and is currently married. He has had three previous loans from CEPRODEL. He will use this loan to purchase building materials to make improvements to his home and thereby make it a more respectable dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand and bricks for construction on his home

loans.name: Marcia Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Marcia Guadalupe C. B., es trabajadora de  la escuela Marcos Dessys, es maestra de primaria y habita en el barrio Camilo Ortega.

La señora Marcia Guadalupe es casada con tres hijos y  todos dependen de ella y habitan en la misma casa , ella solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Marcia Guadalupe C. B. lives in the Camilo Ortega neighborhood and is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School. Marcia Guadalupe is married and has three dependent children who all live with her. She is requesting a loan to make improvements on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, wood, nails, and cement.

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es:
Sandra L. es otra socia activa del Banco Comunal  Sol Naciente ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca, ella vive en  el sector de la Feria Libre considerado el  sector el más comercial de la ciudad pues aquí se realizan las ferias más grandes de la urbe que se realizan los días miércoles, sábados y domingos, donde se reúnen todos los comerciantes de diferentes partes del país y de la ciudad para ofertar sus productos.

Nuestra socia  tiene una gran amistad con todas sus amigas del Bankito, este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con los créditos que otorga la Fundación Espoir con ellos ha ido incrementando  poco a poco  su negocio de venta de comida en el cual lleva diez años atendiendo de  6 a 10 a.m. y por la tarde de 3 a 6 p.m. tiempo en el que acaba su rica comida, se decidió por éste  negocio porque es rentable aunque es muy sacrificado, pues antes era consultora de belleza de productos Yanbal pero no le fue muy bien y decidió cambiar de actividad. Con el  credito solicitado va a comprar una carreta para dar un mejor servicio a sus  clientes.

Sandra es oriunda de la provincia de los Ríos y se radicó en Cuenca hace diez años invitada por una amiga, ahora tiene 28 años vive en unión libre y ha concebido tres niños que  se encuentran de 10, 9, 1 año, su primer hijo es un niño especial tiene síndrome de Down  y vive con los abuelos en la costa ecuatoriana,  su esposo le ayuda en el negocio  porque ya tiene su buena clientela, con nostalgia nos comenta que aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando y espera primero hacer realidad el sueño de tener su casita propia.
texts.en:
Sandra L. is an active member of the Sol Naciente Communal Bank, which is located in the city of Cuenca. She lives in the Feria Libre sector. It is considered the most commercial sector of the city. They have the biggest fairs in this major city. The fairs are held on Wednesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. All of the merchants from different parts of the country and the city gather to offer their products. She has a great friendship with all of her friends in the communal bank. This is her fourth cycle working with loans from the Fundación Espoir. With the loans she has, little by little, been increasing her business of selling food. She has had the business for ten years. She works from six to ten a.m. and from three to six p.m. In that time her she sells all of her delicious food. She decided on this business because it is profitable even though it requires much sacrifice. Previously she was a beauty consultant for Yanbal products. That did not go well for her, so she decided to change her activity. She will use the requested loan to buy a cart to give her customers better service. Sandra is a native of the Ríos province, and she settled in Cuenca ten years ago after being invited by a friend. She has now lived in a common law marriage for 28 years and has three children. They are 10, 9, and 1 years old. Her first son is a special boy. He has Down syndrome and lives with his grandparents on the coast of Ecuador. Her husband helps with the business because she has a good amount of customers. She nostalgically tells us that she does not have her own house yet. They rent where they live. She hopes to make her dream of having her own little house a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cart

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián tiene 32 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su casa propia.

Anteriormente era únicamente agricultor, pero en el presente se dedica al sector transporte, específicamente al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Su recorrido empieza a las 6 AM y termina a las 10 PM. Este trabajo le gusta mucho, pues le brinda la oportunidad de socializar con sus clientes y  además obtiene buenas ganancias. 
Para el futuro, piensa reincorporarse a la actividad  agrícola, sin dejar de lado su trabajo actual, para que así tenga ingresos paralelos.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, donde se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos mensuales; además hace hincapié en la buena organización que existe en su banco comunal, por lo que se siente satisfecho de ser parte.

Con el dinero solicitado comprará terrenos de cultivo para café, también hará el mantenimiento de su motocarro, con el propósito de trabajar con  mayor seguridad y confianza para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julián is 32 years old, and is married with four children. He lives in Quimbiri, in the Peruvian jungle, where he has his own house. Previously, Julián was working in agriculture, but now he works in the transportation sector, transporting passengers in his mototaxi. His workday begins at 6AM and ends at 10 PM. He enjoys this work, as he has the opportunity to chat with his clients and also earn good money. In the future, Julián would like to renew his agricultural work without giving up the mototaxi. In this way, he would have two parallel income streams. This is Julián’s fifth loan with MFP, where he commits to making his monthly payments. Also, he makes an effort to help with the good organization of his communal bank, and he is happy to be a part of it. With this loan, Julián will buy land for the cultivation of coffee. He will also spend some money on maintenance of his mototaxi, so as to provide more security and confidence for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land for agriculture and do vehicle mainenance

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es: Leonel Antonio es de 37 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos tres varones y dos mujeres, tiene establecida una tienda de consumo en la plaza de la localidad, en ASDIR es el primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias indican que es una persona trabajadora, el crédito lo invierte en la compra de mercadería para su tienda, surtir mejor para ganar clientela.
texts.en:
Leonel Antonio is 37 years old and has 5 children – 3 boys and 2 girls. He has a grocery store set up in the local plaza. This is the first loan for which he is applying with ASDIR. His references indicate that he is a hardworking person. He will use the loan for the purchase of merchandise for his store to have a better supply to gain more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana del Socorro H. se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio. Ella es casada y con un hijo de un añito al que cuida y vela por su bienestar.

Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y de esta manera brindar mayor seguridad tanto a su hijo como a su familia. Ella espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así levar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto lo necesita.
texts.en:
Juana del Socorro H. H. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School in Chinandega. She is married, lives in the Roberto González neighborhood, and has a one-year-old son. Juana is requesting a loan to make repairs to her home, since it is not currently secure and robbers could enter to steal her belongings..

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement, bricks, and zinc tiles

loans.name: Maurino

texts.es:
Maurino tiene 60 años, es casado y tiene 16 hijos. Vive en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, zona de ceja de selva, donde tienen su casa propia.

Su familia se dedicaba a la carpintería, específicamente a fabricar muebles, es por ello que desde muy joven ha quedado grabado en su memoria el sonido de las máquinas y el olor de la madera. Actualmente está dedicado de lleno a la misma actividad, durante casi 38 años, trabajando desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. A Maurino le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que le proporciona buenos resultados económicos. Él elabora muebles tradicionales y contemporáneos, pues sabe que la diversificación es la clave de las buenas ventas. Para el futuro, espera ampliar el espacio donde trabaja, para almacenar su materia prima, los artículos acabados y comprar nuevas máquinas.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos de manera puntual, además se siente contento con la solidaridad de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado adquirirá más madera (cedro, caoba y tornillo) con la finalidad de cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Maurino is 60 years old, married, and has 16 children. He lives in the town of Quimbiri on the edge of the jungle, where he has his own house.

His family works in the carpentry business, specifically making furniture. This is why since he was young, the sound of the machines and the smell of the wood has been etched in his memory. He is has been in the same business for almost 38 years and works from 6am to 8pm. Maurino likes his job very much, since it provides him with good earnings. He makes traditional and contemporary furniture and he knows that diversification is the key to good sales. In the future, he hopes to expand the space in which he works to store his raw material, finished work, and to purchase new machines.

This is his third loan with MFP and he promises to continue making his scheduled payments on time. In addition, he is happy with the solidarity of his communal bank. With the requested loan, he will purchase more wood (cedar, mahogany, tornillo) with the purpose of fulfilling his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Candida Del Socorro

texts.es: La   Sra. Cándida del Socorro Q. M.    su actividad es trabajar con venta de abarrotes y cosméticos   ella  tiene seis   años de  trabajar con este negocio,  es casada  actualmente. Este es su  crédito nº diez con CEPRODEL y este préstamo lo quiere para la compra de granos básicos y ampliar mas su negocio por q con estos préstamos es que ella ha llegado a crecer con su negocio y le ayudan en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Cándida del Socorro Q. M. is married and has sold groceries and cosmetics for six years. This is her tenth loan from CEPRODEL and she will use it to purchase staple merchandise to continue developing her business. Her previous loans have helped her in both her personal and professional life.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staples such as rice, sugar, beans, and soft drinks for Holy Week

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene una mirada sincera y es un visionario neto, tiene 21 años, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en la comunidad de Puerto Naranjal, ubicada en la selva ayacuchana, donde reside en casa de su madre.

Desde muy niño le gustó estar en el campo, en aquellas épocas sus padres se dedicaban a la actividad agrícola y él siguió los mismos pasos, de lo que no se arrepiente. Con todo lo aprendido incursionó en el cultivo de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, poco a poco fue creciendo en su producción y ganancias, y aunque existen rezagos del terrorismo en su zona sabe que con mucho esfuerzo puede forjarse un futuro prometedor. Regularmente recibe la ayuda de sus padres, pero en también contrata peones para los trabajos en sus chacras. Sus productos, los vende en los centros de acopio de una localidad aledaña, y en un futuro cercano piensa adquirir más terrenos con la finalidad de producir en mayor cantidad y por consiguiente abastecer a más comerciantes.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y está muy a gusto por el crédito rápido, por lo que se compromete  a cumplir con todas sus cuotas establecidas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará insumos y abono para darle mayor fertilidad a su tierra, por ende producirá con mayor calidad y sus productos tendrán un precio más competitivo.
texts.en:
Roger has a sincere look and a clear visionary. He is 21 years old, single, and does not have any children. He lives in the Puerto Naranjal community, located in the jungle of Ayacucho, where he lives in a house with his mother.

He liked being in the countryside since he was very young. At that time, his parents worked in agriculture and he followed the same footsteps, which he does not regret. With everything learned, he began in cacao, coffee, and citrus fruit production. Little by little he increased his production and earnings and although effects of terrorism in the area still remain, he knows that with hard work he can create a promising future. He usually has the help of his parents, but he also hires workers for the jobs on his farmlands. He sells his products in the wholesale centers of a neighboring town. In the near future, he plans to purchase more lands with the aim of producing more crops and obtaining more businessmen.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is happy for the quick funding, which he promises to repay according to the established schedule. With the loan requested, he will purchase consumables and fertilizer so that his lands will be more fertile, which will provide better quality products and they will have a more competitive price.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: El señor Marcelino Padrón es casado con la señora Nicolasa y son un matrimonio unido y establecido, viven solitos ya que sus hijos están casados; el labora para una empresa de venta de libros y realiza gestiones de cobranza, además cuenta con un ingreso extra ya que tiene un negocio propio donde realiza productos de herrería tales como puertas, portones,ventanas, etc. el señor Marcelino es un cliente distinguido de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se le otorgo un crédito para la compra de material para su negocio y nuevamente esta solicitando para invertir en el mediante la compra de pintura y acabados.
texts.en:
Marcelino Padrón is married to Nicolasa in a united and stable relationship. They live alone as their children are all married. Marcelino works at a bookstore where he negotiates payments. He also has his own business making products from iron, such as doors, gates, windows, etc. Marcelino is a distinguished client of FVP, having a prior loan for the purchase of materials for his business. With this loan, Marcelino will buy paint and finishes.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials for blacksmith shop

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba M. M., tiene 76 años y vive con su hijo que trabaja,  en el barrio 7 de Abril ubicado en el Sur Occidente de Barranquilla.  Ella vende en su enfriador refrescos como Boli, hielo, bolsas de agua por un lado y   mercancías variadas por otro;justamente solicita $1.000.000 para comprar refrescos y mercancias como toallas, cubrelechos y conjuntos femeninos especialmente. 
Su negocio empezó cuando en el año 1975 se vino a vivir en Barranquilla procedente de Caucasia, en el Departamento de Antioquia, donde vivía y se ganaba la vida lavando ajeno y su cónyuge trabajaba como jornalero. Al llegar a Barranquilla, se radicó en el barrio Galán donde continuó con el mismo trabajo, hasta después de 4 años que su hija mayor   le pide que se vaya a vivir con ella,  para  ayudarla a cuidar su casa, porque esta trabajaba viajando; con su traslado al barrio 7 de Abril, donde empezó a vivir con su hija empieza a vender refrescos como cerveza  y gaseosas en lugares de alto trayectoria comercial; una vez comienzó a irle bien, vende su casa del barrio galán y se radicó definitivamente en 7 de Abril comprando una mejora cerca de su hija; es en este barrio y en su nueva  casa , donde  aprovechando su cercanía a escenarios deportivos como una cancha de futbol, empezó a vender refrescos como gaseosas, cervezas, pony malta y gradualmente fue adicionándole a su negocio la venta de mercancía variada.
Desde hace 5 años ha recibido con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 5 prestamos, estos le han ayudado a continuar trabajando y capitalizándose para sostener sus gastos personales. Su meta es arreglar su enfriador que funciona en un 50% , poner rejas en su casa para protegerse de las pelotas que caen en su casa cuando juegan
texts.en:
Rosalba M. M. is 76 years old and lives with her working son. They live in the 7 de Abril neighborhood located in the south of Barranquilla. Among other products, from her refrigerator she sells products such as Boli, ice, bags of water. She is asking for 1,000,000 COP to buy drinks and other merchandise like towels, bedspreads and other products that women might like. She started her business in 1975 when she came to live in Barranquilla from Caucasia, which is in the Antioquia department. There she used to earn a living washing clothes. Her partner used to work as a day laborer. When she arrived in Barranquilla, she settled in the Galán neighborhood where she continued with the same work. Since she is elderly, four years later her eldest daughter asked her to move in with her and help her keep house. When she moved to the 7 de Abril neighborhood and began to live with her daughter, she started selling drinks like beer and soda in very commercial neighborhoods. As soon as this began to go well she sold her house in the Galán neighborhood and moved completely to the 7 de Abril neighborhood and bought a house near her daughter. Now, she lives in a new neighborhood, and a new house. Here she is able to take advantage of the fact that she lives near several sports events, like a soccer field, and sell drinks like soda, beer, a local drink called pony malta and bit by bit begin to sell other merchandise. For the last 5 years she has been a client of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has taken out five loans which has helped her to keep working and increase the capital she needs to cover her personal expenses. Her immediate desire is to fix her fridge which right now, is at 50% capacity, and to install bars on her house to protect it from the soccer balls that hit it during matches.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks and other products like bed spreads

loans.name: Las Calandrias Group

texts.es:
LA FOTO DEL GRUPO LAS CALANDRIAS  FUE TOMADA EN LA CASA DE LA SRA. MARIA JUANA B. G., QUE ESTA UBICADA EN LA LOCALIDAD DE SANTA RITA TLAHUAPAN, SN SALVADOR EL VERDE, PUEBLA. EN MEXICO.
EL GRUPO TIENE 11 INTEGRANTES  Y LA SEÑORA MARIA SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DE PLANTAS QUE INICIO DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS. MARIA NO TUVO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE ESTUDIAR, PERO SE HA ESFORZADO PARA DARSELA A SU HIJA QUE ESTA CURSANDO EL 3ER GRADO DE PREPARATORIA, VIVE EN UNION LIBRE Y ES LA 1ª VEZ QUE SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO EN CREDICOMUN PARA INVERTIR EN SEMILLA Y TIERRA PARA LA PLANTA Y ASI PODER HACER SUS MACETAS.
ELLA SE SIENTE MUY ORGULLOSA AL HABER SOLICITADO ESTE CREDITO QUE LE SERVIRA PARA TENER MUCHA MAS VARIEDAD DE PLANTAS Y ARBOLITOS, TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE CON EL PRESTAMO TENGA MAS SOLVENCIA PARA PODER SEGUIR PAGANDO LOS ESTUDIOS DE SU HIJA YA QUE QUIERE VERLA SALIR ADELANTE Y QUE TENGA UNA BUENA CARRERA.
GABRIELA S. N.,  ES DEL MISMO GRUPO, Y SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA. ESTUDIO HASTA EL  3ER AÑO DE PRIMARIA,  ES DIVORCIADA Y CUENTA CON 2 HIJOS Y UNA HIJA DE 6 MESES DE EDAD. DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS TIENE ESTE NEGOCIO  Y SOLICITA ELCREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE UNA ESTUFA CON VARIAS PARRILLAS PARA FACILITAR EL SERVICIO A SUS CLIENTES, QUIENES REGRESAN A SU COMEDOR FAMILIAR POR SU BUENA SAZON.
 AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR SU PRESTAMO EN CREDICOMUN ELLA SE SIENTE CON MUCHA EMOCION PUES CUENTA CON UNA ESTUFA DEMASIADO PEQUEÑA. TAMBIEN ESPERA QUE CON LA AYUDA DEL CREDITO PUEDA SEGUIR CON LA MANTENCION DE SUS HIJOS.

LAS DEMAS INTEGRANTE EL GRUPO SON:
MARIA GUILLERMINA C. V., VENTA DE ROPA PARA NIÑO.
ERIKA D. R., VENTA DE JOYERIA EN ORO.
MARIA LUISA D. R., VENTA DE ZAPATO Y ROPA.
MARCELINA G. B., VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO.
MA CARMEN H. J., VENTA DE ROPA PARA BEBE.
TERESA P. S., TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y VENTA DE COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO.
CATALINA R. P., VENTA DE CHAMARRA DE PIEL.
PETRA R. P., LA VENTA DE ZAPATO POR CATALOGO.
ANAYELI R. R., VENTA DE BLANCOS.
texts.en:
This photograph of the group "Las Calandrias" was taken in the home of Mrs. Maria Juana B. G., which is located in Santa Rita Tlahuapan, San Salvador el Verde, in Puebla, Mexico. This group has 11 members. Maria has a business cultivating plants that she started 3 years ago. Maria did not have the opportunity to study, but she has made an effort to give her daughter an education. Her daughter is currently in her 3rd year of high school. She lives in a common-law marriage and this is the first time that she has requested a loan from CREDICOMUN to invest in seeds and land to plant and materials to make her pots. She is very proud of having requested this loan, which will allow her to have a much greater variety of plants and small trees. In addition, she hopes that with the loan she will have more resources to pay for the education of her daughter, as she wants to see her succeed and have a good career. Gabriela S. N., in the same group, sells food. She completed her primary studies through the 3rd year. She is divorced and has 2 sons and a daughter who is 6 months old. She has had this business for 4 years, and she requests the loan to buy a stove with several grills to make it easier for her to serve her customers, who return to her family eatery for the flavorful food. At the moment of requesting this loan she is very excited because her current stove is too small. In addition she hopes that with the help of the loan she can continue to support her children. The other members of the group are: MARIA GUILLERMINA C. V. - sells clothing for children ERIKA D. R. - sells gold jewelry MARIA LUISA D. R. - sells clothing and shoes MARCELINA G. B. - sells shoes through a catalog MA CARMEN H. J. - sells clothing for babies TERESA P. S. - has a grocery store and sells cosmetics through a catalog CATALINA R. P. - sells leather jackets PETRA R. P. - sells shoes through a catalog ANAYELI R. R. - sells linens

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in seed and land to plant, and materials to make her pots

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
La señora María Ernestina D. se desempeña como maestra de primaria en un pequeño colegio del departamento de Chinandega. Ella es casada y con dos hijas que mantiene ya que viven con ella y una está culminando sus estudios universitarios.
La señora María Ernestina solicita el crédito para ayudar a su hija con el pago de la universidad puesto que está terminando su carrera y es de necesidad realizar dicho pago para llegar a cumplir el deseo de su mamá de tener una hija profesional.
texts.en:
María Ernestina D. C. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys School. She is married and has two dependent daughters who live with her. Ana María Barrera Sobalvarro is asking for a loan because one of her daughters is about to finish college.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Jesus Andres

texts.es: El señor Jesús Andrés Meja es casado con la señora Laura y son una familia joven y unida, el labora para una empresa nacional de ferrocarriles, y están tramitando este crédito para la colocación de un piso en la parte posterior de su casa además de instalar el portón de su hogar ya que en su colonia se han presentado actos de vandalismo. Así ellos sentirán mejor seguridad para su familia y hogar.
texts.en:
Jesús Andrés Meja and his wife Laura are a young and united family. He works for a national train company. They are seeking this loan to build a floor on the rear portion of their house. They will also build a gate on their home, as there have been some acts of vandalism in their neighborhood. In this way, they will feel more secure in their home and family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a concrete floor and a gate

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El   Sr. Francisco Javier López Martínez    su actividad es trabajar con venta de abarrotes, cosméticos y ropa  él  tiene dos   años de  trabajar con este negocio.  Este es su  crédito nº dos con CEPRODEL y este préstamo lo quiere para la compra de granos básicos y ampliar mas su negocio por q con estos préstamos es que el tiene pensado ampliar mas y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier López Martínez has sold groceries, cosmetics, and clothing for the last two years. This is his second loan from CEPRODEL and he will use it to purchase staple items to expand his inventory. These loans help him further develop his business.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of staple items such as oil, soap, sugar, rice, and other groceries

loans.name: Lisely

texts.es:
Lisely, de 25 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus suegros a su esposo, Vidal de 30 años, quien trabaja brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Lo que más desea es brindarle una buena educación a sus dos querida hijas, Celeste y Antuanette.

Desde muy joven se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para tener un sustento económico, puesto que a los 15 años ya era madre y tenía una hija qué mantener. Fue así que su cuñada, con el afán de ayudarla, la contrató como ayudante en el puesto de comida que tiene en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde ahora trabaja sirviendo los platos y apoyando en todas las labores de la cocina.
Lisely disfruta mucho de cocinar y no desaprovecha las escasas oportunidades que le brinda su cuñada, cuando le pide que cocine y se encargue del negocio. Lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos los comensales al mismo tiempo. 
En los próximos meses planea implementar su propio puesto de comida, ya que siente que es hora de tener su negocio propio.

Este es el quinto préstamo al que accede Lisely con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará las mesas y sillas que necesita para su propio puesto de comida.
texts.en:
Lisely, 25 years old, is a hard-working, cheerful mother. She lives in the house her in-laws left to her husband Vidal, 30 years old, who transports passengers in his motorized trishaw. Her fondest wish is to offer her two darling daughters, Celeste and Antuanette, a good education. From early on she saw it was necessary to work to make a living, since by 15 years old she was already a mother with a daughter to support. Her sister-in-law, wanting to help her out, hired her as an assistant in her food stall in the city market, where Lisely now works serving customers and helping with all the kitchen duties. Lisely really enjoys cooking and takes full advantage of the few opportunities her sister-in-law gives her when she asks her to cook and take care of the business. She's been working in the food stall for six years, and what she finds most challenging is attending to all the customers at once. In the next few months she plans to set up her own food stall, since she feels it's time to have her own business. This is Lisely's fifth loan with MFP and, just as she did with her previous loans, she intends to pay it off in full and on time. She's very respected in her village bank, since she's the most active, committed member. She will use the 800 soles requested to buy the tables and chairs she needs for her own food stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy furniture for her future food stall

loans.name: María Rina

texts.es:
La señora María Rina C. se desempeña como maestra de primaria y trabaja en la escuela Marcos Dessys  en la Ciudad de Chinandega, es casada y tiene 1 hijos uno menor de edad habita en el Reparto Libertad.

La señora María Rina solicitó el crédito para gastos personales servicios básicos y para ayudarle a sus padres con medicinas ya que el papá se encuentra enfermo y pagar deudas.
texts.en:
María Rina C. is a primary school teacher at Marcos Dessys school in Chinandega. She is married, lives in the Reparto Libertad area, and has one dependent child. María Rina is requesting a loan to cover her personal expenses, household expenses, repay some debts, and help her parents with their medical expenses since her father is sick.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover personal expenses, household expenses, etc.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es: La señora Olga Leticia E. es casada y es una joven mama de un pequeñito. Ella labora para una empresa de comida rápida reconocida a nivel nacional en el departamento de cocina, y su esposo labora para una empresa desde hace 2 años,están tramitando este crédito para los acabados exteriores de su casa, ya que hace pocos meses terminaron la construcción de su barda y desean darle un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Olga Leticia E. is a young mother of one small son. She works for a national fast food company in the kitchen. Her husband has been working for a company for two years. They are seeking a loan to finish the exterior of their house. It has been a few months since the exterior wall was built and they would like a better finish on it.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the exterior of their house

loans.name: Marcony Alberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Marconi Alberto S. García   él se dedica a la venta de repuestos automotriz el tiene catorce  años de tener este negocio, es padre  de un  hijo en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  Onces  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su negocio para ampliarlo más y de esta manera llegar a crecer en su negocio. Igualmente este crédito lo solicita para comprar productos para su negocio como es bomba inyectora, bujías para carros etc.
texts.en:
Marconi Alberto S. García has sold spare parts for automobiles for fourteen years. He is married and the father of one school-aged son. He has had eleven previous loans from CEPRODEL and each has allowed him to develop and improve his business and thereby help it to grow. He will use this loan to purchase items for his business, such as injection pumps, spark plugs, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for automobiles

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys  de Chinandega se desempeña como maestro de primaria es soltero sin hijos y aun está estudiando en la Universidad.

El señor Miguel Ángel SalI. O., solicito el crédito para pagar su matrícula  en la Universidad y para materiales  de estudio.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel SalI. O. works at Marcos Dessys School in Chinadega. He is a primary school teacher. He is single without children. He is even taking university classes. Miguel Ángel SalI. O. is asking for a loan to pay for his university registration fees and study materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University registration fees and study materials

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser owns a small grocery store in Rafah city in Gaza Strip in a very good location with a high population. Yaser is a single man with no other resources than the store.

Yaser needs more variety in his inventory, so he applied for a loan from FATEN to buy the needed goods and increase the store's sales.

Yaser stands in his store in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for a small shop

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El joven Francisco Javier C. es soltero y vive con sus padres y los apoya económicamente, el labora para un restaurante como mesero y cajero, además cuenta con los ingresos de su mama ya que ella prepara y vende comida rápida,
Ellos como una familia muy unida y responsable están tramitando este crédito para la mejora de los acabados interiores y exteriores de su hogar
texts.en:
This young man, Francisco Javier C., is single and lives with his parents, supporting them financially. He works as waiter and cashier in a restaurant, and also has income from his mother, who prepares and sells fast food. They are a close family, very responsible. They are requesting this loan to improve their home inside and out.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work on their home, internal and external

loans.name: Nohemí Ruth

texts.es:
La señora Nohemí Ruth S. B. se desempeña como maestra de primaria y trabaja en la escuela Marcos Dessys  en la Ciudad de Chinandega, es casada y tiene 2 hijos uno mayor de edad el otro de 9 años habita en la Colonia Roberto González costado oeste de la iglesia Ermita.

La señora Nohemí solicito el crédito para reparar su vivienda ya que se aproxima el invierno y tiene dañado el techo de su casa, además realizara otros anexos en la misma.
texts.en:
Nohemí Ruth S. B. is a primary school teacher. She works in Marcos Dessys School in Chinandega. She is married with two children; one is grown and one is nine . She lives in Colonia Roberto González on the west side of the Ermita church. Nohemí is asking for a loan to repair her home. Winter is nearing and her roof is damaged. She will also make other additions to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cement, blocks, steel, brick, nails, beams, etc.

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo, tiene 42 años y tiene cinco hijos, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a sus hijos.

Rosendo se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, él sale a trabajar a las 4 de la madrugada y se queda hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días.  Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. (Mototaxi es una motocicleta de tres ruedas y con techo que se usa como medio de transporte popular para trechos cortos a cambio de dinero de la misma forma que un taxi.).
  
Rosendo pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son tres años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del mototaxi. El anhelo del socio es comprarse un carro. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 42 years old and has 5 children. He is a responsible father who searches with daily effort and every moment for opportunities to get ahead for his children. Rosendo is dedicated to offering transportation services in his mototaxi (a motorcyle with 3 wheels and a roof that is a popular form of transportation for short trips, in exchange for money, just like a taxi.). He goes to work at 4:00 am and stays until 8:00 at night every day. Its now 10 years that he has been in this business and things have gone well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Rosendo belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa. He has participated for 3 years now. His first loan was for $100 dollars and was invested in his business. At present he needs a loan to perform maintenance on his mototaxi. His goal is to buy a car. Rosendo is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, also, he is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: FOR NECESSARY MAINTENANCE ON HIS MOTOTAXI (MOTORCYCLE TAXI)

loans.name: Ena Del Carmen

texts.es: La  Sra. Ena del Carmen Velásquez N.   ella es trabajadora del Hospital Central Managua tiene cuatros años trabajar para esta empresa, es madre de dos  hijos en edad escolar, es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  Onces  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una ampliación en su vivienda y así tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Ena del Carmen Velásquez N. works at Hospital Central Managua. She has worked their for four years. She is a married mother of two school-age children. She has had 11 loans with CEPRODEL. With each loan, she has made home improvements. She wants this loan to make an extension on her home and therefore be able to have dignified housing.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials like rock sand and cement

loans.name: Mayra Estefani

texts.es: La srta. Mayra Estefani S. J. de  19 años de edad, es soltera. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el caserio de la Venta Alta. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda ya que se encuentra en construcción. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Senorita Mayra Estefani S. J. is 19 years old and is single. She has her own house located in the little village of Venta Alta. She works as a field worker in agricultural businesses. She is an entrepreneurial person, who succeeded in acquiring her property thanks to her determination. She needs the loan to finish building her house, since it is now under construction. Her dream is to succeed in constructing the whole house, with the goal of attaining a better quality of live. She is very grateful for the support that we can offer her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Homero

texts.es: El joven Homero Gómez es soltero y vive solo en su hogar, el labora para una empresa de noticias y publicaciones diarias, desde hace 5 años, y esta tramitando este crédito para la construcción de una barda en el frente de su casa para mayor seguridad, ya que por razones de trabajo su casa esta sola en el transcurso del día.
texts.en:
Young Homero Gómez is single and lives alone in his home. For the past five years, he has worked for a news and daily publications company. He is applying for a loan so that he can build a fence in front of his house to improve his security, since, because he is away at work during the day, his house is empty and vulnerable for most of the day.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construccion de una barda en el frente de su casa

loans.name: Luisa Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Luisa Victoria M. Álvarez, es trabajadora de la escuela Marcos Dessys de Chinandega es maestra de primaria y habita en el Barrio el Rosario, tiene un  hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera. 
La señora Luisa Victoria M. Álvarez solicito el crédito  para componer el entejado en su casa ya que es viejísimo y teme se le moje en este invierno
texts.en:
Luisa Victoria M. Álvarez works in the Marcos Dessys de Chinandega School. She is a primary teacher and lives in the Rosario neighbourhood. She has one son to look after and is a single mother. Luisa Victoria M. Álvarez is asking for the loan to seal her house as it is very old and she worries that it will be damp this winter.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new door frames, nails and paint

loans.name: Amado

texts.es: El señor Amado es casado con la señora Patricia y son padres de familia de 4 pequeñitos, 2 en edad escolar, el señor Amado es empleado de una empresa aduanal como tramitador desde hace 4 años, y su esposa tiene un negocio propio, donde le realiza cortes de cabello a caballeros y damas, además de tintes, mechas entre otros servicios. Ellos son una familia establecida y unida que están tramitando este crédito para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en le frente de su casa, ya que desean ampliarse para el negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
Amado is married to Paticia and they have four children, two still school-aged. Amado has been employed as an expediter for a customs agent for the last 4 years. He and his wife own their own beauty parlor where they serve both men and women offering haircuts and hair coloring, among many other services. They are an established and united family that are negotiating this loan in order to finish building a room in front of their house that they want in order to enlarge the wife's business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: María Lilliam

texts.es:
La señora María Lilliam B. R., es trabajadora de la escuela Marcos Dessys de Chinandega es maestra de primaria y habita en el Reparto jirón, tiene  dos hijos los cuales dependen de ella y de su esposo.

La señora María Lilliam B. R. solicito el crédito para terminar de reparar su casa ya que tiene las puertas en espera y tiene su Baño
texts.en:
María Lilliam B. R. works at the Marcos Dessys de Chinandega School. She is a primary teacher and lives in the Reparto jirón. She and her husband look after their two children.

María Lilliam B. R. is asking for this loan to finish repair work on her house as they have doors on hold and need to work on the bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors and improve their bathroom

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro Ríos Cárdenas es casado con la señora Mabi Isabel y son padres de un niño en edad pre-escolar, el labora para una empresa desde hace 7 años de antigüedad, su esposa vende ropa semi nueva y usada los fines de semana, la cual ya tiene su clientela, ya que vende producto en buenas condiciones; ellos están tramitando este crédito para la terminación de un cuarto en construcción, y así tener mayor espacio en su hogar.
texts.en:
Pedro Ríos Cárdenas is married to Mabi Isabel and they are the parents of a pre-schooler. He has been empolyed for 7 years and she sells used clothing on weekends; she has a regular customer base because she sells clothes that are in good condition. They are negotiating a loan so that they can finish building a room addition to their house in order to have more room.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building a room.

loans.name: Lester Antonio

texts.es: El  Sr. Lester Antonio F. M.   él se dedica al servicio de taxi, el tiene un  año de trabajar en  este negocio, es soltero Es su segundo créditos con CEPRODEL el préstamo lo quiere pagar terminar de pagar su vehículo que lo utiliza para su negocio de taxi el espera que con este préstamo le vaya bien para crecer económicamente en su negocio y en su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Lester Antonio F. M. provides taxi service. He has been working in this business for one year. He is single. This is his second loan with Ceprodel. He wants the loan to finish paying for the vehicle that he uses for his taxi business. He hopes that with the loan things will go well for him to grow economically in his business and in his family life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the car he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Edwing Otoniel

texts.es: El  Sr. Edwin Otoniel E. García   su actividad es trabajar con oro, plata   el tiene cinco  años de  trabajar con este rubro, es padre de tres hijos en edad escolar, es casado actualmente. Es su primer crédito con CEPRODEL  lo utilizo para mejora de su casa y este préstamo ahora lo  quiere para utilizarlo en la compra de oro y plata para ampliar y mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Edwin Otoniel E. García works with gold and silver. He has worked in this field for five years. He has three school age children, and he is currently married. He used his first loan with Ceprodel to improve his house. He wants to use this loan to buy gold and silver to expand and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to work with gold and silver

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela es una mujer de 28 años de edad, está casada y tiene una bella hija en edad escolar. Vive en zona de la selva cuzqueña en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una casa alquilada.

Mayela sabe lo difícil que es para una familia de pocos recursos económicos el progreso. Luego de trabajar durante casi 10 años en diversos oficios encontró algo que le apasionaba: la compra y venta de terrenos. Ahora no se arrepiente de haber incursionado en esta actividad, ya que le brinda buenas ganancias y siente más ganas de seguir trabajando por el bienestar de su familia. Trabaja junto a su esposo, y constantemente están en busca de nuevos terrenos en valle para lotizarlos y venderlos a un buen precio, ellos hacen un buen equipo. A mediano plazo piensa adquirir un terreno para luego construir su casa propia que tanto ansía.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, también agradece la oportunidad que le están dando para progresar y cumplir sus metas. Con el dinero solicitado comprara terrenos en lugares estratégicos, para venderlos a al mejor postor.
texts.en:
Mayela is a woman of 28. She is married and has a beautiful daughter of school age. She lives in wooded area around Cusco in the locallity of Quimbiri, where they have a rented house.

Mayela knows how difficult progress is for a family of few economic resources. After working for almost 10 years in various jobs, she found something that she is passionate about: buying and selling pieces of land. Now she does not regret having gone into this activity, since it offers good earnings, and she has a greater desire to continue working for the well-being of her family. She works with her husband, and they are constantly looking for new land in the valley to divide into lots and sell at a good price. They make a good team. In the not-too-distant future, she is thinking of acquiring a piece of land to build their own house, which she so much wants.

This is her third loan with MFP. Therefore she promises to make her payments on time. She is also grateful for the opportunity which they offer her to make progress and reach her goals. With the money that she is seeking, she will buy pieces of land in strategic locations, to sell them to the highest bidder.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy land

loans.name: Nestor Filomeno

texts.es:
Néstor es natural de la ciudad de Puno, tiene 42 años y tiene un hijo, él es un padre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su hijo.

Néstor es odontólogo, por la mañanas trabaja en ESSALUD y  por las tardes atiende su propio consultorio.
  
Néstor pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son cuatro años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para curar dientes como por ejemplo resinas, etc. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nestor is a native of the city of Puno. He is 42 years old and has a son. He is a responsible father who always looks for opportunities to advance and to help his son through his daily efforts.

Nestor is an odontologist. In the mornings he works at ESSALUD, and in the afternoons he works at his own practice.

Nestor belongs to the community bank "Tercer Milenio" (Third Millenium) of the Arariwa Association. He has already participated in the community bank for four years. His first loan as a member was for 100 dollars, which he invested in his business. Now he needs a loan to buy materials for treating teeth, such as resins, etc.

This community bank member is grateful for the opportunity offered by the loans and thus promises to make his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to treat teeth, such as resins, etc.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores y uno mayor de edad. Vive en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Pedro es un agricultor de 25 años de experiencia en el cultivo de la hoja de coca y café, y tiene una historia llena de sacrificios y satisfacciones. Para la siembra y cosecha trabaja con su esposa, pero regularmente contrata a peones para agilizar su producción, la cual generalmente la vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad a un buen precio. Adicionalmente a esta actividad, su esposa tiene una tienda de bebidas, galletas y golosinas con la finalidad de ahorrar dinero para las temporadas cuando no se cosecha. En el futuro, Pedro piensa ampliar el negocio de su esposa, reacondicionando el local, adquiriendo nuevos equipos y muebles para brindar mejor atención a sus clientes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, por consiguiente se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos a tiempo; además se siente bien de ser parte de banco comunal, ya que todos se solidarizan entre sí. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más productos para la tienda de su esposa y lo que sobre será para el pago de sus peones.
texts.en:
Pedro, 42, is married and has 2 minor children and one grown child. He lives in the beautiful Cuzqueñan forest, in the town of “Quimbiri," where he has his own house. Pedro has 25 years of experience working in agriculture, growing coca leaves and coffee, and has a history full of sacrifices and satisfactions. At sowing and harvest times he works with his wife, but he regularly hires laborers to speed up his production. He usually sells his products in the collection center in his area for a good price. In addition to this activity, his wife has a store selling drinks, cookies and sweets in order to save money for the seasons when there is no harvest. In the future, Pedro is thinking of expanding his wife's business, refurbishing the premises and acquiring new equipment and furniture to provide better service to the customers. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he is committed to making his payments on time. In addition, he feels good to be part of a communal bank, where the members all support each other. With the money he now requests he will buy more products for his wife's store and will pay his workers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La  Sra. Ana María M. García   ella es trabajadora del Hotel de playa Barceló Monte limar ella tiene de elaborar para esta empresa dieciséis años, es madre de un  hijos en edad escolar, ella es soltera actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatros   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una ampliación en su vivienda y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Ana María M. García works for a beach hotel, Barceló Montelimar. She has been working for this business for 16 years. She has school age children, and she is currently single. She has had four loans with Ceprodel. She used each one to make improvements on her house. She wants to use this loan to enlarge her house in order to have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like sand and rocks

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene 23 años, es casado y tiene una hija. Vive en un hermoso valle de la región Cuzco, en una localidad llamada “Quimbiri”, donde tienen una casa propia de material noble y madera.

Más importante que sólo ofrecer un servicio Roger tiene el objetivo claro de explotar sus conocimientos y progresar. Actualmente trabaja en la Municipalidad de su comunidad, específicamente en la reparación de maquinaria pesada. A él le fascina su trabajo, ya que se divierte mucho y por ende tiene grandes satisfacciones emocionales y monetarias, es por ello que sus planes a futuro son de abrir su propio taller mecánico y acondicionarlo con los equipos necesarios para la reparación de todo tipo de vehículos. Adicionalmente, junto a su esposa (con quien aparece en la foto) tiene un puesto de comida rápida (frituras) con cuyas ganancias también solventan los gastos familiares.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas de pago en las fechas establecidas, también menciona que se siente conforme con la transparencia y organización de sus banco comunal. Con el dinero que esta vez solicita invertirá en el negocio de venta de comida, comprando los ingredientes necesarios al por mayor, con el objetivo de incrementar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Roger, age 23, is married and has one daughter. He lives in a beautiful valley of the Cuzco region, in an area called “Quimbiri”. He has his own house built of solid material and wood.

Rather than simply offering a service, Roger has the clear goal of using his knowledge and progressing. Currently, he works in his community’s municipality repairing heavy machinery. His work fascinates him and he enjoys it a lot. As a consequence, he gets great emotional, as well as financial, satisfaction from it. That’s why his plans for the future are to open his own mechanical shop and furnish it with the equipment necessary to repair all types of vehicles.

In addition, together with his wife (who appears with him in the photo) he has a fast food stall selling fried snacks. The profits from this also contribute to the family’s upkeep.

This is his third loan with MFP. He promises to pay all his installments on time. He also mentioned that he feels good about the transparency and organization of his communal bank. This time, he will invest the money that he is applying for in the food selling business, buying necessary ingredients at wholesale, with the goal of increasing family income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients.

loans.name: Juana Nicolasa's Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “LA BENDICION” es creado por un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y con iniciativa, el cual ellas se dedican a diversas actividades, son un total de once señoras, organizadas por doña Elia Lucia Y. Velásquez, de 42 años de edad, mujer responsable, honesta y muy respetada por la sociedad. Ella se dedica a la Tejeduría “Elaboración de Cortes Tipicos para mujeres”, viendo la necesidad de un pequeño capital para poder incrementar la productividad de su negocio decide crear este banco comunal que es a beneficio de todas teniendo ya 6 meses de estar formándolo. Se Acercan a las instalaciones de ASDIR  solicitando un Financiamiento para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darle mejores condiciones de vida a sus familias. La ubicación de Grupo es en el Cantón Juchanep, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala.
texts.en:
“La Bendicion” (The Blessing) Communal Bank was created by a group of enterprising women with initiative who are dedicated to diverse activities. A total of 11 women are members and they were organized by Mrs. Elia Lucia, a 42-year-old, responsible, honest woman who is very respected by society. She is dedicated to the art of weaving, making typical clothing for women. Recognizing that she needed some capital to increase her business's productivity, she created this bank. It has been 6 months since it was formed and it has benefited all its members. They approached the office of ASDIR to request financing to cover their customer demand and provide better conditions of life for their families. The group is located in Juchanep Canton in the municipality and department of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EXPANDING THEIR INVESTMENT TO MAKE ARTESAN CLOTHING

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar. Vive en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, ubicada en la selva cuzqueña, donde tienen su casa propia.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la actividad agrícola, pero como no lo estaba dando buenos  resultados incursionó en la venta de comida (brochetas de corazón de res y postres) en su barrio. En esta actividad ya lleva 15 años y trabaja arduamente desde las 4 de la tarde hasta las 11 de la noche, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en el tiempo de vacaciones escolares (enero y febrero). No satisfecha con ello, se propone abrir en un futuro cercano, una tienda donde venda galletas, gaseosas, golosinas, etc., con el propósito de obtener mayores ganancias y clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos en las fechas oportunas; también agradece a su banco comunal por las facilidades que le otorgan cuando existe cualquier eventualidad económica.

Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la implementación del local para su futura tienda y en la compra de los ingredientes para sus comidas.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 42, is married and has 4 school-aged children. She lives in the town of “Quimbiri," located in the Cuzqueñan forest, where she has her own house. Previously she worked in agriculture, but as this was not giving her good results she entered into the business of selling food (skewers of beef heart and pastries) in her neighborhood. She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years, and she works tirelessly from 4 in the afternoon until 11 at night. Her children help her during the months of school vacation (January and February). Not satisfied with just this activity, she is proposing to open a store in the near future where she will sell cookies, soft drinks, sweets, etc., with the objective of having a greater number of customers and higher earnings. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and she is committed to making her payments at the scheduled times. In addition she is grateful to her communal bank for giving her the opportunity to borrow at reasonable terms at times when she needs the money. With the money requested she will invest in the installation of a site for her future store, and will also purchase ingredients for her meals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Wilfredo De Los Angeles

texts.es: El  Sr. Wilfredo de los Ángeles M. C.   él es trabajadora del Hotel de playa Barceló Monte limar el tiene de elaborar para esta empresa seis años, es padre de tres hijos dos  en edad escolar, el es acompañado actualmente. El ha tenido  seis   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito él lo quiere para hacer una ampliación y mejora en su casa de habitación y así tener una vivienda digna
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo de los Angeles works at the Barceló Monte Limar beach hotel. He has been employed at this enterprise for 6 years and is the father of 3 children, 2 of whom are school age. He is living with someone at present. Wilfredo has had 6 loans with CEPRODEL and he took out each one to make improvements on his home. He will use the present loan to expand and improve his house and thus, make it a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS SUCH AS SAND AND CEMENT FOR IMPROVING HIS HOME

loans.name: Ilusion 1 Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Cecilia G. García, que es integrante del grupo ILUSION I, ubicado en la comunidad de San Buenaventura Tecalcingo en el estado de Puebla, México. En ella podemos apreciar a 9 de las 11 integrantes del Grupo,  con algunos de  los productos que venden y elaboran. Cecilia se dedica a su tienda de abarrotes que inició hace 10 años, con el apoyo de créditos para incrementar su inventario. Su negocio se encuentra a una cuadra de la iglesia del pueblo, así que sus principales clientes son habitantes de esta comunidad. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su inventario y en el momento de solicitarlo se siente emocionada porque su ilusión, como el nombre del grupo lo dice, es contar con una tienda bien surtida y poder ofrecer a sus clientes todos los productos que ellos le demandan.
Cecilia tiene 36 años y estudió la primaria, es soltera pero ella ayuda a su mamá económica y moralmente con lo que obtiene del negocio, el cual en un inicio fue complicado ya que la tienda que actualmente tiene en su domicilio primero la tuvo que establecer en otro lugar y pagar renta, por lo que las ganancias eran más limitadas. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son:	
Inés Álvarez M., Elvia B. R., Araceli García Q., Felicitas G. García, Marcelina M. Juárez, Ana Pérez M., Guadalupe Ramírez A., María Azucena R. P., Wendidalet Sánchez M. y María Leonor S. S..
texts.en:
This photo was taken at Cecilia G. García’s house. She is a member of the ILUSION (Illusion) group, located in San Buenaventura Tecalcingo, Puebla, México. In the photo, we can see 9 of the 11 members of the group with some of the products they make or sell. Cecilia has had a grocery store for the past 10 years; she has used loans to increase her stock inventory. Her store is located a block from the town’s church so its main customers are residents of the area. She is asking for funds to increase her stock inventory and she is thrilled because her illusion, as the group name suggests, is to have a well-stocked store and be able to offer her customers all the products they ask for. Ceilia is 36 years old and finished elementary school; she is single, but she supports her mother both economically and emotionally with her earnings from the store. At the beginning, her business was pretty complicated because the store that she now has in her home was originally somewhere else and she had to pay rent thereby decreasing her profits. The remaining group members are: Inés Álvarez M., Elvia B. R., Araceli García Q., Felicitas G. García, Marcelina M. Juárez, Ana Pérez M., Guadalupe Ramírez A., María Azucena R. P., Wendidalet Sánchez M. and María Leonor S. S..

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase store's stock inventory.

loans.name: Norgen Wilbert

texts.es: El Sr. Norgen Wilbert B. M.     él se desempeña como guarda de seguridad en el hospital de masachapa  el tiene de laborar  para esta institución ochos  años, es padre de dos hijos ambos en edad escolar, el es soltero  actualmente. Ha tenido  dos   créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de un electrodoméstico para su hogar.
texts.en:
Norgen Wilbert B. M. works as a security guard in the Masachapa hospital. He has worked for this institution for eight years. He has two school age children, and he is currently single. He has had two loans with Ceprodel. He is requesting this loan to buy an electric appliance for his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a television

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila P. D. Martínez   D. 50 años  vive en el barrio  El Carmelo,  Municipio D.  Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos D.  26  y 23  años que son su máxima motivación; se dedica a  la venta D. mercancía en general, negocio para el cual está solicitando un crédito por valor D. $1.800.000, que  será invertido en la compra D. pantalones, sabanas, toallas, camisa D. colegios, blusas, y todo lo solicitado por sus  clientes D. los diversos  barrios D. la ciudad.
Lucila P. D. Martínez fue empleada D. una empresa, quedo sin trabajo y su esposo   quedo solo trabajando y un único ingreso no les alcanzaba; fue así como su tía residente en los Estados Unidos le ayudo enviándole una mercancía para que la vendiera a sus compañeras antiguas D. trabajo, sus amistades y vecinos,  y  como cada día aumentaban la solicitudes Lucila empezó a viajar a Medellín, Barranquilla y Bucaramanga y fue abriendo nuevos mercado. Sostiene que su negocio ha sido la fuente D. ingreso importante en su hogar y  más aun cuando su esposo se  queda sin trabajo, y tiene que  sacar D. su negocio  los gastos del hogar y especialmente en relación con los estudios D. sus hijos. Su mercado lo conforman   vecinas y empleadas D. empresas D. la ciudad D. Cartagena, a quienes les suministra vestidos, uniformes, blusas, pantalones y lo requerido  por cada uno D. ellos.
La señora Lucila   le da gracias a Dios por su familia y por haberle dado  la creatividad que ha tenido para cada día poder cumplir su misión con mucho con amor,  así ha conseguido todo lo que tienen en su hogar y lo que sus hijos han necesitado ( estudios, vestidos, diversión y necesidades básicas).  
Este es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido D. la Fundación Santo Domingo,   con el primero compró  mercancía en general y amplió su cobertura D. clientes; su vida ha cambiado con su negocio ya que pudo ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida y eso le brinda a ella mucha satisfacción a nivel personal, familiar  y en el negocio ya  pudo ofrecer mejores servicios y cubrir mayores clientes con diferentes necesidades.
Su sueño es ver su negocio crecer, tener empleadas, ofrecer sus servicios a muchas más  personas y ser reconocida; otro D. sus sueños es que sus hijos sean felices con sus profesiones, por que considera que es la mejor herencia que pueD. dejarle, tener una casa propia y este último es precisamente su mayor desafío.
texts.en:
Lucila P. D. Martínez, 50, lives in the El Carmelo neighborhood of Cartagena with her husband and their 2 children, aged 26 and 23. Her children are her greatest motivation. She sells general merchandise in a business for which she is requesting a loan of 1.8 million Colombian pesos, which will be invested in the purchase of pants, sheets, towels, school shirts, blouses, and other items demanded by her customers, who are from the various neighborhoods of the city. Lucila P. D. Martínez was employed by a company, but was laid off so that only her husband was working, and a single income was not enough. Her uncle, who lives in the United States, helped her by sending merchandise that she could sell to her colleagues from her former job, her friends and her neighbors. As each day the demand for her merchandise was increasing, Lucila started to travel to Medellín, Barranquilla and Bucaramanga and was opening new markets. She claims that her business has been the source of significant income at home and even more so when her husband is unemployed and her business must generate the income to pay for the household expenses and the education of their children. Her market is maD. up of neighbors and employees of companies in the city of Cartagena, to whom she supplies clothing, uniforms, blouses, pants and any other items her customers require. Lucila is grateful to God for her family and for having given her the creativity that she has needed every day to accomplish her goals with a lot of love, thereby getting everything she has in her home and all that her children have needed (education, clothing, entertainment and basic necessities.) This is the 2nd loan that she has received from the Fundación Santo Domingo. With the first she bought general merchandise and expanded her customer base. Her life has changed with this business, since she can now offer her children a better quality of life, and this provides her with a lot of personal satisfaction. In her business she was able to offer better services to more customers with different needs. Her dream is to see her business grow, to have employees, and to offer her services to many more people and become well-known. Another of her dreams is that her children become happy with their professions, which she believes is the best legacy that she can leave them, and to have her own home. This latter dream is currently her greatest challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise including pants, sheets, towels, school uniforms and blouses

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia L. tiene ya más de 14 años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes. 
Doña Antonia ya es una persona mayor de edad y tiene poco tiempo que es viuda, por atender a su esposo, desatendió el negocio y le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertirle en el negocio en mercancía, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así poder tener más variedad de productos para la venta. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
La señora Antonia L. has already spent more than 14 years selling groceries. She is a senior citizen and recently became a widow. To care for her husband, she left her store unattended, and she now lacks a variety of merchandise. Because she does not have money to invest in her business, she has applied for this loan and will use the proceeds to purchase a variety of products that she can sell. She plans to make loan payments with earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ukotzijal Chotacaj Group

texts.es: Doña Juana Vicenta Hernández de 40 años de edad, casada, de oficios Estudiante, ella vende “Ropa Típica para Mujeres” responsable, honesta, respetuosa, viendo la necesidad de obtener un pequeño capital y unas vecinas que se conocen hace mucho tiempo, el cual las actividades de ellas son diversas, deciden organizar un pequeño grupo para poder  acercarse a las oficinas de ASDIR a solicitar un préstamo grupal, el mismo será utilizado como capital de trabajo. Donde ellas podrán mejorar la demanda de clientela, condiciones de vida como la de su familia. El grupo es conformado por  Diez mujeres, denominado “UKOTZIJAL CHOTACAJ”, que traduciéndolo significa  “Flor de Chotacaj”. La residencia del grupo se encuentra en Cantón Chotacaj, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Vicenta Hernández, age 40, is married and has studied crafts. She sells traditional clothing for women and is responsible, honest and courteous. Seeing the need to obtain a bit of capital, she and a few neighbors who have known each other for a long time decided to organize a small group in order to get it.
