They have applied for a group loan from ASDIR which will be used as working capital. They hope that they will be able to improve the demand from customers and their families’ living conditions.

The group is made up of ten women and called “UKOTZIJAL CHOTACAJ”, which translates as “Chotacaj Flower”. The group is located in Chotacaj Canton in the municipality and department of Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luís es instructor de gimnasio, él es un joven que tiene 25 años que se caracteriza por ser responsable y que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario apoyar a su familia. 

José Luís es un joven emprendedor que abrió en la ciudad del Urubamba un gimnasio “Luis Gym” que cuenta con 32 maquinas,  él nos cuenta que al principio sus amigos le ayudaban con la atención del cliente pero actualmente sus amigos trabajan para él. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica al servicio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.     

José Luís pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son cuatro años que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar una maquina trotadora que cuesta aproximadamente de 2000 soles y pronto va inaugurar un gimnasio  en la ciudad de Calca. El anhelo del socio es abrir una cadena de gimnasios por el valle sagrado. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
José Luís is a gym instructor. He is a youth of 25 years who is characterized as being responsible, and who is always on the lookout for opportunities to get ahead. He supports his family with his daily efforts. José Luís is an enterprising youth who opened a gymnasium in the city of Urubamba called "Luis Gym," that has 32 machines. He tells us that at the start his friends helped him attend to the customers, but currently his friends work for him. He has had this business for 4 years, and it has gone very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. José Luís belongs to the communal bank "Tercer Milenio," that works with the Asociación Arariwa. He has belonged to this communal bank for 4 years. His first loan was for 100 dollars that he invested in his business. Currently, he needs a loan to buy a treadmill that costs about 2,000 Peruvian soles. Very soon he is going to open a gym in the city of Calca. His wish is to open a chain of gyms in the Sacred Valley. He is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and he pledges to make his payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a treadmill

loans.name: Juaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Reside en la selva alta cusqueña, en la comunidad de “Santa Fe”, donde tiene su casa propia.

Ella se caracteriza por ser multifacética, ya que una actividad no le es suficiente. Es por eso que se las ingenia para no sólo administrar su tienda de abarrotes como fuente principal, sino a la vez cultiva café y cacao, productos que le están dando buenas ganancias. Para la agricultura trabaja con su esposo y en tiempo de vacaciones escolares, sus hijos también la apoyan. Sus productos agrícolas también los vende en su propia tienda, pero por lo general los lleva a los centros de acopio de su localidad. En el futuro, piensa ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, para así ofrecer sus productos a precios más bajos para sus clientes.

Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente, también menciona estar conforme con los acuerdos que tratan en su banco comunal y en la metodología de trabajo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su tienda, en  los que tienen mayor demanda, lo que resta lo usará en el mantenimiento de sus terrenos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Joaquina is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has her own home in the community "Santa Fe," in the high cusqueña (frontier or province) jungle. She is multifaceted, one business is not enough for her. Her grocery store is not her only source of income. She also cultivates coffee and cocoa, which products are providing good earnings. She works in agriculture with her husband, and during school vacations the children also help their parents. They sell their harvest in their own store, but take most of their harvest to the local market. She is thinking about expanding her grocery store in the future to offer her products to her customers at lower prices. This is her third loan with MFP (local lending institution); therefore, she is committed to making her payments on time. We also note that she is satisfied with the agreements concerning her communal bank and her loan. This loan will be invested in much-requested products for her store and will be used for the maintenance of her cultivated land.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her store

loans.name: Albino

texts.es:
Albino tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos en edad escolar. Vive en la selva cuzqueña, en la localidad de “Quimbiri”, donde tiene su casa propia construida a base de madera y techo de calamina.

Para Albino el cultivo alternativo es la clave del éxito, cree que es mejor esforzarse para un mayor logro a mediano y a largo plazo, que el dinero fácil, y sin dañar el medio ambiente. Este pensamiento lo caracteriza como una persona emprendedora, que no se detiene ante los obstáculos que se le presentan. Desde hace 30 años se dedica al cultivo de café, achote y la hoja de coca, esta experiencia le da la oportunidad de obtener buenos resultados, obteniendo productos que vende en los centro de acopio de su localidad. En el futuro piensa aumentar su producción, comprando terrenos para sembrar sus tres productos al mismo tiempo. 

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, ya que para él es muy importante contar con la oportunidad de crédito. Con el dinero solicitado piensa invertir en el mantenimiento de sus tierras, con la finalidad de producir a gran escala en un corto plazo.
texts.en:
Albino is 43 years old, married, and has five children who are of school age. He lives in the Cuscan jungle in the town of Quimbiri, where he has built his own house made of wood with a tin roof.

For Albino, crop rotation has been the key to his success. He believes it is better in the medium and long term because it results in easy money without damaging the environment. This belief shows that he is an enterprising person who is not stopped by obstacles that get in the way. Albino has been growing coffee, annatto, and coca leaf for thirty years. This experience has given him the opportunity to achieve good results and obtain products to sell to the local collection centers. In the future, he plans to increase his production by acquiring more land so that he can grow three products simultaneously.

This is Albino’s first loan with MFP. He promises to make his payments on time because this credit opportunity is very important to him. The money he requested will be invested in the maintenance of his land so that he can produce on a large scale in a short amount of time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of his farmland

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente vive con su pareja y madre de sus tres hijos. Su casa, la cual está aun en construcción está ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical cusqueña.

Marcial es un hombre lleno de ganas y fuerzas por querer llegar lo más lejos posible. En el presente trabaja en la Municipalidad de su localidad, específicamente en el área de construcción. Le gusta lo que realiza, ya que gracias a ello recibe una remuneración justa, para poder cubrir las necesidades de su hogar y llevar felicidad a su familia. Para el futuro desea ser independiente y tener su propio negocio, implementando una tienda de abarrotes donde trabaje junto a su esposa.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir con las cuotas en las fechas establecidas. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la construcción de su casa, con la finalidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcial is 30 years old. He currently lives with the mother of their three children. His house, which is still under construction, is in the beautiful tropical jungle cusqueña (frontier or province). Marcial is a man full of desires and strengths to go as far as possible. Today he works for a nearby town in the field of construction. He likes his work and receives fair compensation, with which he pays for necessary household expenses and brings happiness to his family. In the future, he wishes to be independent and have his own business by setting up a grocery store where he and his wife can work together. This is his first loan with MFP (local lending institution); he is committed to making his payments on time. This money will be invested in the construction of his house, with the purpose of improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of his house

loans.name: Nueva Jerusalen Group

texts.es: Doña Juana B., es casada de 42 años de edad, se dedica a vender “utensilios de cocina” en la plaza del mercado municipal de Totonicapán, con la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, decide crear un grupo con sus vecinas del cantón, logrando reunir diez señoras responsables y que se dedican a diversas actividades, el Banco Comunal de denomina “NUEVA JERUSALEN”, se acercan a las oficinas de ASDIR solicitando un préstamo grupal, para poder mejorar la rentabilidad de sus actividades económicas y condiciones de vida, la ubicación del grupo es en el Cantón Chotacaj, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala.
texts.en:
Juana B., 42, is married and sells "kitchen utensils" in Totonicapán's municipal market's plaza. With the aim in mind to increase her business, she organized a group of ten, responsible neighbors into a group; each woman in the group is involved in a different commercial activity. The communal bank they formed is called: "NUEVA JERUSALEN" (New Jerusalem) and they came by ASDIR's offices to request a group loan designed to increse the profitability of their businesses and improve their living conditions. The group is located in Chotocaj, Totonicapán, Guatemala.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Gioconda De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Gioconda de los Ángeles López E.     ella se desempeña como directora de un colegio   ella tiene de laborar  para esta institución diecinueve  años, es madre de dos hijos ambos en edad escolar, ella es casada  actualmente. Ha tenido  nueve   créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un aumento a su casa de habitación, para tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Gioconda de los Ángeles López E. works as the principal of a school. She has worked for this institution for 19 years. She has two school age children, and she is currently married. She has had nine loans with Ceprodel. She is requesting this loan to buy construction materials to enlarge her house and have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement and sand

loans.name: Blanca Nubia

texts.es: La  Sra. Blanca Nubia H. C.    ella se desempeña como profesora de educación primaria ella tiene de laborar como docente  veinte y dos  años, es madre de tres hijos dos  en edad escolar, ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  sietes   créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una ampliación en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Blanca Nubia H. C. works as an elementary school teacher. She has worked as a teacher for 22 years. She has three school age children, and she is currently married. She has had seven loans with Ceprodel, and she has used each one to improve her house. She wants to use this loan to enlarge her house and have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga G. is from the village of Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 53 years old. Dominga is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Dominga owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store which sells food, daily use products, and variety of drinks in the local market. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dominga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the family income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Junita Ortiz Group

texts.en:
Junita O. is from the village of Naga,Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Junita is the leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Junita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Junita owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Junita has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Junita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Junita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Junita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Junita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Eib

texts.en: Mrs. Eib M. is 51 years old and she is a villager who lives in Prey Bay village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Deng Touch, are farmers who own a 3-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this farming business, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their growing crops. Thus, Mr. & Mrs. Eib M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed to support this purpose. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Deng Touch is a barber who can earn a small income to support his family’s living. Mrs. Eib M. is a mother of five children, one is seamstress in the garment factory, one sells cars at car dealership, one is farmer who supports the parents’ farming and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Mrs. Saturnina L. is from the village of Dimaluna, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old, married, and has two adult and two school-aged children.

Saturnina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store selling home products. She has been engaged in her business for ten years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In July 2009, Saturnina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC.

Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 14,995 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products for her retail store. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC:

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sa Em

texts.en: Mrs. Sa Em O. is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Tonle Village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sokong Long, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living for their family. Aside from being farmers, they are also rice middlemen who can earn a small income to improve their family's living conditions. They have a rice mill machine for this business, but they do not have enough money to buy enough rice to grow their business. Thus, Mrs. Sa Em O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to sell. This couple has two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more rice

loans.name: Surn

texts.en: Mrs. Surn H. is 56 years old, and she is a villager in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 4.5-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for her family. Although they try to work hard with their farming, they still earn too little income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Surn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy 2 cows for breeding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions. This couple has five children, two of whom are farmers who support their parents' farming, while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows

loans.name: Trork

texts.en: Mr. Trork K. is 62 years old and a villager in Ta Preah village in TaK. province. He and his wife, Mrs. Mao Tet, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn an income for their family. As farmers, they do not have any oxen for plowing. Thus, Mr. Trork K. decided to ask for a loan to buy 2 oxen for plowing. Aside from farming, this couple breeds ducks and can earn a small income to support their family. Mr. Trork K. is the father of two children; they are duck breeders who support their parents' business. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy 2 oxen

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Mr. Luy H. is 46 years old and a villager who lives in Thma Sa village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kroem Sao, are salt sellers who can earn a small income to support their family. Since this business is going well, Mr. Luy H. wants to expand it. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy more salt to sell. With this loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions. This couple has two children; one is a seamstress in the garment factory, while the other is a salt seller who supports the couple's business. His wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more salt

loans.name: Jose Irnel

texts.en:
Mr. Jose Irnel G. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 41 years old and married with three children. He manages his sari-sari to improve his living situation. He earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from his sari-sari store. He has managed his business for almost two years. Other sources of income come from his farm and his boarding house (rental income).

   He joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. He successfully repaid his previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC and this loan is for the expansion of his store. As of now, he has a new loan amounting to 15,000 PHP taken from PMPC. It is the third loan taken from PMPC.

loans.use: Additional capital for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mr. Nov P. is 57 years old and he is a villager who lives in A Cheang village in Takeo province. He is a widow with two children. One of the children stays at home and supports his father's business and the other one is a student. 
                
Mr. Nov P. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Although he tries to work hard with his farming, he still does not earn enough income to support his family. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow and pigs for breeding. He hopes to increase his income to improve his family's standard of living with this loan.

loans.use: To buy a cow and pigs

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey H. is 47 years old and a villager who lives in Lieb village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Meng Mos, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, her husband is a fisherman who can earn a small income to support his family. Even with both businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support the family. In order to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Srey H. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Srey H. is a mother of four children. One of the children is a seamstress in the garment factory and the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie H. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 28 years old. Melanie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Melanie owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Melanie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melanie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou L. wished to be enlightened and find a way to improve her family's standard of living, so she joined Kiva partner, ASHI, in 1999 and felt very glad to be given the opportunity of a loan. Her first few loans enabled her to support her variety store and tend to her canteen eatery (preparation of food ready to eat), the profits of which have been the main source of family income. Now that Marilou has access to capital, her profits are better than before. Therefore, she is requesting another ASHI loan through Kiva for a much larger amount of 40,000 PHP to purchase groceries for her store and to support the maintenance of the canteen eatery. This will allow her to further grow the businesses so that her children can fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and finding good jobs.

Marilou also dreams of achieving the best for her family, reflected in an expanded business and a happy family. During the course of her membership in ASHI, she has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded in pursuing these dreams. Her long term goals are to launch a poultry business for her husband so she can expand their weekly revenue. With her hard work, focus, and determination, Marilou is hopeful that her businesses will continue to be more productive and improve the family's overall standard of living.

Marilou is happy that her living conditions have improved through the generation of more income from the businesses. She would like to send all her best wishes to all of her lenders around the world and hopes that they will support her again in the future.

About ASHI:

As a micro-finance institution that uses the Grameen methodology, Ahon sa Hirap (ASHI), being the first practitioner in the field, saw how poor mothers work hard to earn money for their families and provide their children with better lives. Because the micro-credit that ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly to their villages and on the doorstep of their houses, it is giving them hope that someday they will rise above poverty. (“Rise above poverty” is a direct English translation of “Ahon sa Hirap”).

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store and to support the maintenance of her canteen eatery

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey D. is 48 years old and a villager in Lieb village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sarorn Hun, are farmers who own a 2.50-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. They face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm crop. Thus, Mrs. Srey D. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seeds to support her farm. Aside from farming, Mr. Sarorn Hun is a fisherman who can make a little income to support his family. Mrs. Srey D. is the mother of two children who are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and rice seed

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda A. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old. Nilda is married and has 3 grown-up children. To make a living, Nilda has a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in her local community. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Nilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Nilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Babie Jane

texts.en:
Babie Jane A. is from the village of Highway Lawis. She is 24 years old. Babie Jane is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Babie Jane has a furniture making business, making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Babie Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Babie Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Babie Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Babie Jane is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Babie Jane from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Koem Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Yen S. is 38 years old and lives in Prey Thum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who grows rice on her land, and has applied for a loan to buy pesticide so that she can produce a good crop. Her husband, Mr. Ry Kong, is a driver who earns a small income which is not enough to support his family. He and his wife have four children, three of whom are in the public school while the youngest is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy pesticide

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida B. is 40 years old and lives in the village of Highway Lawis with her husband and their three school-aged children. To earn a living, she makes furniture for local businesses and her neighbors. Nida has been in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2000, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid eleven previous loans, and has applied for a new loan to buy supplies she needs to make more furniture. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea T. is 34 years old and lives in Pou Roung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tharn Kang, are farmers who own a 1.3-hectare field on which they grow rice. To make it possible to produce a good crop, Sophea has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to hire a helper. Mr. Tharn Kang supplements his farming income by also working as a fisherman. The couple has three children, all of whom are students in a local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline and to hire a helper.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol is a positive and hopeful mother who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. Marisol makes and sells food. She has been in business for more than 10 years. She believes that her proposed loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) will be a big help and will contribute to the growth of her business. She will use all of the loan funds to buy rice, sugar and other supplies for her business. Marisol believes that having a greater variety of inventory will help her retain her current customers as well as attract new clients in the neighborhood. 

In 2000, Marisol joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a microfinance institution and Kiva field partner in the Philippines. A loyal member of ASHI, Marisol has been a dedicated member with a solid performance in her previous credit rating – the basis of loans. Her long-term goal is building a concrete and durable home. With her hard work, focus and determination, Marisol is hopeful that support from ASHI and Kiva will continue to grow and improve the overall quality of living for her family: “Life that is far away from under the umbrella of poverty”.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Yek

texts.en: Mrs. Yek H. lives in Lach Long village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.35-hectare field on which she earns an income by growing rice. To produce a good crop, she has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. In addition to farming, she also earns a small income by selling fish in a local market. She is 30 years and has one child, who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar T. lives in the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old, married and has three grown children. To make a living, she runs a general store. She has been in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2004, Maricar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid eleven previous loans, and has applied for a new loan to buy more items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas J. is from the village of Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 48 years old, is married, and has five adult children.

Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling vinegar, soy sauce, oil, vegetables and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok O. is 45 years old and she is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Pheng Loch, are farmers who own a three-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they grow both rice and vegetables.

In this farming, Mrs. Sok O. does not have enough money to support her farm crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump and rice seed.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Sok O. is a grocery seller who owns a general store in the local village and is able to earn a small income to support her family. She is the mother of two children: one is a water seller while the youngest one is a grocery seller.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and rice seed for her farm

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
With her belief in getting out of poverty, Rodalyn P. decided in 2009 to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with the opening of having start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested in her buy and sell business, selling different goods, and embarked on a sewing business. The profit is what she uses for daily expenses.

During her almost one year in ASHI, Rodalyn has shown herself to be hardworking and she has strong belief to make her dreams come true. Rodalyn still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. 

Now on her second loan, Rodalyn requests 9,000 Philippine pesos to create a broader business. Specifically, the money will be used to purchase cotton and planel for her sewing business and an inventory of rice for her buy and sell business. She is very determined and disciplined to utilize the money which is lent to her.

Rodalyn is grateful to ASHI-Kiva partners for the support, even with all the dreams and challenges in her life.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and planel for her sewing business and inventory of rice

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en: Manolo M. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. He is 48 years old. Manolo is separated from his spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Manolo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Manolo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Manolo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manolo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Manolo is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Manolo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Ran's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ran N. is from Samphli village in the TaK. province. She is 54 years old and serves as group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by AMK. Each member of the group loan will use it to support different purposes.  
      
Mrs. Ran N. is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field and cultivates rice to earn a living for the family. On this farm, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farm crops. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for farm labor. Her husband, Mr. Chhon Tep, is a police officer and receives a small salary to support his family. 

Mrs. Ran N. is a mother of a child who is a farmer helping support her farm. Mr. Sith Vorng, who is a group guarantor, is also present in the village bank loan photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is the model of a strong woman who can flourish and make a living without a man. She is 31-years-old and a single mother with three small children. She lives with her sister in the province of Rizal, where she has had a business selling jewelry and accessories for almost two years. Marites would like a loan to increase her inventory of rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces and other supplies, which will result in increased revenue. A loyal member since 2009 of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Marites attends weekly meetings regularly and has repaid previous loans. Her long-term goals are to maintain the productivity of her business to support the education of her children. Marites dreams of a brighter tomorrow and a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of rings, earrings, bracelet, necklace, and other supplies.

loans.name: Cynthia

Cynthia S. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 52 years old. Cynthia is a widow with 5 adult children. Cynthia owns & operates a motorcycle, passenger transport business.  Cynthia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cynthia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cynthia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Cynthia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Cynthia from HSPFI. loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Парпиева Дилафруз проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 28 лет. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку на рынке, где продает вещи необходимые хозяйству. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и открыть собственный магазин.
texts.en:
Dilafruz P. lives in the region of Gissar. She is 28 years old. She is married and has two children. She has secondary education. She has been in the sales business for more than five years. She has a vendor point on the market where she sells household goods. She is taking out the loan to increase sales of goods. She wants to expand her business and open her own store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Satikulova Muhabbatkhan's Group

texts.ru:
Мухаббатхан, 41, замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Ее супруг находится на заработках в РФ. Клиент сама работает учительницей начальных классов в школе Узгена. Кроме этого она дома занимается откормом живности. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 1 коровы и дальнейшей отправки на пастбище. Обычно живность продается в конце осени с определенной прибылью. 

Равзахан 28 лет. Она замужем. Ее супруг работает в собственной столовой в Узгене, в основном приготавливает шашлыки. Сама же клиентка занимается оптовой торговлей потребительских товаров, а также кондитерских изделий. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 1995 года. Кредит будет направлен для закупа 50 кг печений, 100 кг конфет и 40 кг пряников. 

Азизбеку 24 года. Он холост и живет вместе с родителями в собственном доме. Клиент работает частным строителем по УЗгену. Кредит запрашивается для закупа стройматериалов для ремонта дома. 

Рахбархан, 36, замужем. У нее 4 детей: 3 сына и 1 дочь. Старшие двое сыновей учатся в школе. Ее супруг работает телемастером. Рахбархан занимается торговлей посуды и производственными товарами. Бизнес был начат 4 года назад по рекомендации соседки. Кредит нужен для закупа посуды в целях расширения ассортимента. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Muhabbatkhan is 41 years old, married and raising three children. Her husband now works in the Russian Federation. She works as a teacher of elementary grades in the school of Uzgen. Besides that she also feeds and grows cattle at home. She is asking for the loan to buy one cow for grazing. Usually the cattle sells at the end of autumn for a particular profit. Ravzahan is 28 years old. She is married. Her husband works in his own cafe in Uzgen, he makes mainly shishkabobs. She is in the wholesale of household goods and also confections. She has been in this business since 1995. The loan will be used towards the purchase of 50 kilograms of baked cookies, 100 kilograms of candy and 40 kg of gingerbread cakes. Azizbek is 24 years old. He is a bachelor and lives with his parents in their own home. He works as a freelance construction worker in Uzgen. He is asking for the loan to buy building materials for the repair of a house. Rahbarhan is 36, she is married. She has four children: three sons and one daughter. Two older sons go to school. Her husband works as a TV repairman. Rahbarhan sells china and other products. She started this business four years ago by taking her neighbor's recommendation. She needs the loan to buy china to expand the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy one cow, confections, building materials, china

loans.name: Omuralieva Jypargul`s Group

texts.ru:
Гулзада, 40, замужем. Ее супруг работает строителем в Москве. У нее 3 детей. Старшему 16, а младшему 12 лет. Все дети учаться в школе. Она занимается разведением и откормом скота. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 3 баранов, которые будут отправлены на пастбище. 

Жыпаргул молодая женщина, которой 27 лет. Она работает в школе учителем английского языка. Ее супруг работает таксистом, у нее 2 детей:дочь и сын. В школе клиент работает вот уже 3 год с момента окончания ВУЗа. Кредит будет использован для закупа пылесоса и стиральной машины для улучшения бытовых условий. 

Зарине 25 лет. Ее супруг также находится на заработках в России. Вместе с родителям супруга она занимается животноводством. Ежемесячная прибыль примерно равна 125 долларам, кроме этого ее супруг постоянно высылает деньги с России. Кредит нужен для закупа личных принадлежностей. 

Нурбек,39, женат. У него 3 детей. Его супруга работает в местной школе учительницей. Нурбек занимается растениеводством, выращиванием риса. Кредит нужен для оплаты весенних полевых работ, а именно для закупа семян риса. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Gulzada is 40 years old and married. Her husband works as construction worker in Moscow. She has 3 children. The oldest is 16, and the youngest is 12 years old. All of the children attend school. Gulzada is involved in breeding and fattening livestock. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of 3 sheep that will be sent off to a pasture. Jypargul is a young woman, who is 27 years old. She works as an English language teacher at a school. Her husband works as a taxi driver, and they have 2 children: a daughter and a son. Jypargul has been working at the school for three years, from the moment she finished a university. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of a vacuum cleaner and washing machine in order to improve household conditions. Zarina is 25 years old. Her husband also works in Russia. Zarina and her parents are involved in animal husbandry. The monthly profit equals to about 125 dollars, and besides, her husband always sends money home from Russia. She needs the loan for the purchase of personal goods. Nurbek is 39 years old and married. He has 3 children. His wife works as a teacher at a local school. Nurbek is involved in agriculture and grows rice. He needs the loan to pay for spring field work and specifically, for the purchase of rice seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 sheep

loans.name: Flor Fátima

texts.es:
La señora Flor Fátima C. S., tiene 49 años de edad es casada  y trabaja como profesora, pero su profesión es abogacía, es casada y su esposo le apoya económicamente, ellos son una familia de 4 miembros, una se encuentra casada y la otra estudia la carrera de medicina en Venezuela.

Dentro de las necesidades básicas que tienen en estos momentos la familia está el embaldosado del piso y levantar una pared de la casa para dividir una sala y crear un cuarto, esto traería mejores comodidades para la familia, ahora que vendrá de visita su hija a Nicaragua. Ellos son  una familia religiosa unidos por el amor de Dios y espera que se les apoye económicamente como en años pasados se les a podido apoyar.
texts.en:
Flor Fátima C. S. is 49 years old. She is married and currently works as a teacher, but is a lawyer by training. Her husband supports her financially. They have two children. One is married and the other is studying medicine in Venezuela.

In addition to providing for the family's basic necessities, they are also spending money to make renovations to their home. The family is currently tiling the floor and raising a dividing wall in their living room to create an additional bedroom. This will bring greater comfort to the family now that their daughter has come to visit Nicaragua. They are a religious family, united by the love of God. They hope that God will support them financially like they have been helped in previous years.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Floor tiling and construction of a dividing wall

loans.name: Matlyuba

texts.ru: Махмуродова Матлюба проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается тороговлей. У нее магазин, где она продает продукты питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Matlyuba M. lives in the Gissar district. She is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education and is involved in retail sales. Matlyuba has a store, where she sells food products. She has been in this business for 6 years. She is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Mersulita

texts.en:
Mersulita P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin province. She is 45 years old. Mersulita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Mersulita owns & operates a food production/sales business, selling specialty food products such as viands in the local community. Mersulita is just starting this business. Previously she was engaged in fish vending. 

In 2009, Mersulita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mersulita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mersulita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mersulita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Toktosunova Aysha`s Group

texts.ru:
Айша, 48, замужем. У нее двое детей оба находятся на заработках: дочь в Москве, работает продавщицей. А сын работает в Бишкеке на кирпичном заводе. Они оба регулярно отправляют деньги своим родителям. Айша вместе с супругом занимаются выращиванием риса, подсолнуха и пшеницы. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одной коровы для последующего производства молока.

Кенжехан 49 лет. Она вдова, ее единственный сын работает водителем в сельской администрации. Сама же клиент занимается полеводством, в основном выращивает подсолнух и пшеницу. На кредит она планирует закупить 150 кг семена, 150 кг удобрений и 100 лт солярки. 

Меринса, 53, вдова. У нее трое детей.  Старший сын работает в Бишкеке и ежемесячно отсылает домой около 150 долларов. Остальные двое учатся в школе. Меринса занимается животноводством.Кредит запрашивается для закуп одной коровы. 

Бурулбу проживает вместе со своей семьей в селе Мырзаки. Ее супруг работает в местной школе, а сын работает в России. Клиент выращивает сельхозпродукции на своем земельном наделе. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 2001 года. Кредит запрашивается для закупа дополнительных 0.5 га земельного надела, чтобы увеличить площадь посевных. 
  
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Aysha is 48 years old and married. She has two children, who both work. The daughter works as a salesperson in Moscow, and the son works at a brick factory in Bishkek. Both of them regularly send money to their parents. Aysha and her husband are involved in growing rice, sunflower and wheat. Aysha is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow for subsequent milk production. Kenjehan is 49 years old. She is a widow. Her only son works as a driver at the village administration office. Kenjehan is involved in farming and primarily grows sunflower and wheat. She wants to use the loan to buy 150 kg of seeds, 150 kg of fertilizers and 100 liters of diesel fuel. Merinsa is 53 years old, a widow. She has three children. The oldest son works in Bishkek and sends home about 150 dollars monthly. The other two children attend school. Merinsa is involved in animal husbandry. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow. Burulbu lives with her family in the village of Myrzaki. Her husband works at a local school, and son works in Russia. Burulbu grows agricultural crops on her plot of land. She has been involved in this business since 2001. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of additional 0.5 hectares of land in order to increase the sowing area.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Lidia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lidia del Socorro C. V., tiene 37 años vive, en el Barrio Laureles sur es casada y su marido trabaja como jardinero, apoyándole económicamente a los gastos mensuales del hogar, ella labora como afanadora en un centro de salud, su situación económica es bastante precaria, pero dentro de sus mayores aspiraciones esta la culminación estructural de su vivienda, es para esto que solicita de un préstamo, para la compra de materiales de construcción, para la edificación de una pared lateral, que le divida su terreno con la de su vecino y le brinde una mayor seguridad a su hijo, que cual actualmente está en una etapa de su vida en donde las males influencias pueden ocasionar malos caminos sociales, este apoyo les ayudara en gran medida a la familia, fortificando su hogar y brindándole mejores condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia del Socorro C. V. is 37 years old, she lives in Barrio Laureles sur, is married and her husband works as a gardener and supports her economically with the monthly family expenses. She works as a helper at a health center. Her economical situation is very poor, but one of her most important aspirations is to finish building her house and therefore she requests a loan to buy building material to build a side wall to divide her land from that of her neighbor giving more security for her son who is at the time of his life when bad influences can cause taking the wrong social path. This support will help the family a lot, making their home stronger and offering better economical conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a side wall

loans.name: Revelieta

texts.en:
Revelieta, 54, is a rice farmer who manages a rice field in Norala, South Cotabato. She has two children to support. She wants to sustain her business with the help of a micro-finance institution. She heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and joined in 2007.

She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which is enough to provide farming materials. This is very helpful since it is at a low interest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida Parveen is a citizen of the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She is an uneducated lady but she has good talking skills. Khalida Parveen runs a business selling women's clothes. Once a month, she travels to various places to purchase clothes for resale.
Her husband, M., has a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits from his cart in different areas. Khalida not only manages her business but also helps M. in his business by arranging the fruits on the cart, a job she does every day. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to expand her husband’s fruit-selling business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for resale

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.en:
Ambrocia L. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 60 years old, married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Ambrocia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ambrocia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ambrocia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ambrocia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma C. feels blessed in having her own business as a blacksmith making knives and other metal goods. Despite the limited opportunities she has had, the business makes enough profit to combat poverty and provide her family with its main source of income. To increase their income, Erma is requesting a loan to grow her business in partnership with her loving and very supportive husband. Once she has enough capital she plans to employ people to work with them and to expand the business into other areas of the province.

loans.use: To buy tools needed in her business

loans.name: Rosy Jean

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for 43-year-old Rosy Jean. She has a rice farming business in Norala, South Cotabato. She lacks capital to finance her business which is why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy farm supplies.

Rosy Jean is the mother of five children; the eldest is five years old. She wants them to have a bright future by providing for their needs. The loan will be of great help.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Imomali

texts.ru: Бабамуратов Имомали проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 60 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Имомали занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этой деятельностью занимается более 30 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и плиенки.
texts.en:
Imomali B. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 60 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Imomali is involved in agriculture. He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables. He has been involved in this business for over 30 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and plastic.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and plastic

loans.name: Rosa Erlinda

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Erlinda A. M., es casada y su marido es jubilado, le apoya económicamente y su hijo estudia el primer año de secundaria tiene 36 años, dentro de sus grandes prioridades esta la legalización de los terrenos de su hogar, y terminar la construcción de la misma.

Ella se dedica a la venta de carne y ropa de segundo uso, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de verano y aprovechar la temporada, esta inversión le apoyaría económicamente para conseguir sus objetivos que se ha planteado años atrás, espera que se le brinde ayuda y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Erlinda A. M. is married and her husband is retired, he support economically and her son is in the first year of middle school. She is 36 years old, and one of her greatest priorities is to legalize the land of her house and to finish building it.

She sells meat and second-hand garments for a living. She requests a loan to buy clothes for summer and take advantage of the season. This investment will help her economically to reach her goals which she planned years ago. She hopes to receive support and thus improve the life quality of her familiy.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase second-hand clothing

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en: Razia is a wife of A. M. and they both live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. They are both very hardworking. They work to manage the financial expenses of their family. Razia makes artificial flowers whereas her husband performs his duties as a mason. They both use their incomes to pay for utilities and their children's educational expenses. They are parents of three children – two sons and one daughter – and they want to raise them with a good education. Razia is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools for her husband so that he is better able to do his job and will not have to rent the tools.

loans.use: To buy masonry tools

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida G. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Nida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Nida is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tag-ibo, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rehana Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines. She has a two-roomed house where she has lived with her family for the past 20 years. She has one son, who is just eight months old. She takes care of him and also makes flower ornaments, such as rings, bracelets, etc. for brides and grooms to wear at their weddings, on order. Her work generates 10,000 PKR every month. 
Rehana Kosar's husband, S., has a milk-selling business. He purchases milk from milk shops and resells it in the community. He is unable to generate much income from this business because he has to pay the milk-sellers first. Therefore, Rehana has decided to apply for a loan to buy a dairy cow so that her husband can start to get milk from it and earn a better profit.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Félix Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Félix Antonio O. N., tiene la edad de 42 años, vive en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y su esposa es comerciante, y se apoyan económicamente para los gastos del hogar, tienen 4 hijos pequeños, él se dedica a la albañilería.

Dentro de las metas para la familia está la culminación de la construcción de su hogar, es por esta razón que el solicita de un préstamo para envergar el frente de su casa y brindarle una mayor seguridad a toda su familia, debido aquí ellos viven en un barrio en donde los índices de delincuencia son altos y amenazan a la población  que ahí habita, espera se le brinde un apoyo económico, tal y como lo han hecho en los años anteriores.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Antonio O. N. is 42 years old and lives in Barrio Laureles Sur. He is married, his wife is a merchant and they support each other economically with the family expenses. They have 4 young children. He is a construction worker.

One of the family's goals is finish building their home, for that reason he requests a loan to put up a wall in front of his house for more security for the entire family as they live in a neighborhood with high crime rate and the people living there are threatened. He hopes to receive economical support as in previous years.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille C. is from the village of Matab-ang, Dalipuga Iligan City. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lucille owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lucille has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2010 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucille joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products offered. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand the products offered

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia U. is a  49-year-old woman full of determination to rise above poverty.  She is married and the mother of three  children. She lives in coastal town of Cardona, Rizal Province, in the Philippines.

In 2005, she decided to join Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, hoping to access capital for her sari-sari store (general store). During her membership in ASHI, her performance has been noted to be very good. Now she is requesting a loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos to pay for an additional groceries among other inventory for the store.

With the opportunity given to her by ASHI and Kiva, she believes that she is getting closer to the accomplishment of her dreams. Herminia wants to help her children with their school fees and also to save for their future, since she and her husband, Leonardo are getting old already. Her long term goal is to have a growing business of full-fledged groceries to secure her monthly income.

loans.use: To pay for an additional groceries and other inventory for a general store.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old, widowed and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as bags and ready-to-wear items in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Julieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en: Nabeela is a wife of M. A., and they both live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. The city of Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a shop in the main market where he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He purchases the spare parts from the city of Lahore. He has been in this business for the past 25 years. Nabeela stays at home and manages the domestic chores and takes care of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to sell

loans.name: Lizhel

texts.en:
Lizhel M. is from the village of Matab-ang Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lizhel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lizhel has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lizhel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Gulmaira

texts.en:
Gulmaira is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Bayan-Olgii province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian tent. Her oldest son, Nurbol, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and one of her children attends a local secondary school.

During the day, she operates a meat trading business at a local market. She has been operating this business since 2002 and has expanded it. Previously, Gulmaira operated a food retailing business between 1998-2002. Furthermore, she has received nine loans from XacBank, and has been successfully operating her business. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. Gulmaira says, “I would like to be financially able to afford my son's university fees until he graduates.” She is requesting a 900,000 tugrug (~ 635 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesales price to resell it for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase meat at wholesale prices for resale

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en: Luningning D. C. is persistent and determined to reach her dream of growing her “sari-sari” (variety) store into a mini grocery store that has a huge volume of inventories. Despite having difficulty maintaining her business because she cannot re-invest her income into it since it is also the main source of her family's daily expenses, Luningning is not losing hope that someday her dream will land on the palm of her hand. With that, she wants to request a much larger loan to support the needs of her business and at the same to sustain its operation. With her passion for giving her children a better future, she will be willing to work hard and help her husband, who is a driver, earn money through her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her "sari-sari" store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: A. Beatrice is 34 years old, married with two children and a resident of Mutungo Kitintale Kampala. She has a soda and beer depot and has been in business for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase drinks such as soda and beer to supply to different customers. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose future hope is to have the biggest soda and beer depot in Mutungo.

loans.use: To purchase drinks such as soda and beer to supply to different customers

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old, widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Floro owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers from the local community. Floro has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Floro joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. Floro is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan he has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Гулбоев Урозали проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. Кроме того занимается животноводством. Разводит скот для перепродажи их на мясо. В этой области уже 3 года. Кредит берет для закупа скота и комбикорма.
texts.en:
Urozali G. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years.
