Besides this, he is also involved in animal husbandry. Urozali breeds livestock to resell it for meat. He has been in this field for 3 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock and livestock feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P. is from the village of Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 47 years old. Juliet is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Silab Group

texts.en: Pacha is a member of the Silab group. He lives in Surkh Road district. He is 29 years old and married with four children: two sons and two daughters. One son and one daughter are students in school. He is a taxi driver. His taxi tires are old and are not working properly and his business income is not enough to meet his family needs. Therefore, he wants to take a loan to buy new tires for his taxi to increase his business income. This is the only business he has to support his family members. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his taxi

loans.name: Mr. Chheun Chhil Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who make up this village bank loan, live in Krang Chheu Neang village in Kandal province. They will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. C. C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. He is a rice middleman and his wife, Mrs. Phorll Pou, is a pig breeder in her house. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand. Thus, Mr. C. C. decided to request a loan to buy more rice for re-selling. Through this activity, the couple supports five children, three of whom are seamstresses in a garment factoR., and the others are enrolled in a local public school. 

All the members are shown in the picture, but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy more rice for re-selling

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Ms. N. Aida is forty-three years old and she owns a boutique in Portbell, Kitintale Kampala. She has been operating the business for over ten (10) years. She is requesting the loan to purchase and stock more clothes and more shoes for sale. She is a hard-working business woman whose future hope is to open up another clothes shop.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more clothes and more shoes for sale

loans.name: Tonesita

texts.en:
Tonesita C. is from the village of Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 58 years old. Tonesita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Tonesita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Tonesita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Tonesita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tonesita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Flavia Harriet

texts.en: Miss Flavia Harriet N. is an encouraging business woman, thirty-five years old. She operates a bar business which she has stayed with for over four years. She wants the loan to purchase wines, beer, soda, water and so forth for her bar business to meet her customers' demands. Her dream is to build rental houses to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase wines, beer, soda, water, and so forth for her bar business to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov B. (pictured with her husband and sons) and her husband, Mr. Savit Uk, have been married since 1991 and have five sons. One of them is a carpenter, two attend school and the other two are still young. The family lives along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreypov has been selling corn for more than eight years and she sells mango as well. Her husband has been driving a motor taxi for more than six years. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for resale.

loans.name: Mrs. Yutheary Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Yutheary S. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. The nineteen members who make up this village bank loan all live in Chrouy Ampil village in Kandal province. Mrs. Yutheary S. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband is a government worker in a local village. This family has a big problem because their house is too old to live in. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Yutheary S. decided to ask for a loan to fix up her house. This couple has a child who is seventeen years old and studying in the local public school.

loans.use: To fix-up her house

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie R. really wants her “sari-sari” (variety) store business to grow and becomes stable in order for her to have a steady source of income to support the education of her two adopted children until they graduate from college and have their own career. With the support of her husband, Rosemarie did not have any problems paying the loan she received.  However, she had problems maintaining her business because her profit is insufficient to cover the cost of her family expenses. Therefore, she has to spend some of the money that is meant for business capital. Thus, Rosemarie is requesting a much larger loan and is excited to see her business grow by having a huge amount of capital. Furthermore, she hopes that someday their lives will improve and her business will gain more customers.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en: Enhtaivan is 52 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Enhtaivan makes gold and silver goods in his town. He started his business in 1995 with a working capital of $7 and over the years he has expanded his business and gained much experience. Currently, his working capital exceeds $845. Enhtaivan has a loyal customer base because of his well-designed and high quality products. Enhtaivan is requesting a $705 loan to purchase more silver for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more silver

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak S., age 27, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at home in her village, earning a gross income of $16 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a translator at a local garment factory, earning an income of $5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store and expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem S., age 31, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has four children. She is engaged in a business of selling ducks and chickens, earning a gross income of $15 per day to help cover the family expenses. She has been with this business since 2002. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike to transport ducks and chickens to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport ducks and chickens for sale

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en:
Reymundo S. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan City. He is 31 years old. Reymundo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Reymundo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Reymundo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $63 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Reymundo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reymundo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bahit

texts.en:
Bahit is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Bayan-Ulgiy province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  His two children, ages 14 and 10, attend a local secondary school. Bahit operates a clothing business in his town with the help of his wife. He sells a variety of clothes to many customers. 

Bahit has been operating his business since 2003, and has steadily expanded his business. During the summer, Bahit and his wife, Janargul, sell their products in two places, but during the winter they sell together in one place. They purchase their products from Ereen, a Chinese border town, and sell them to their customers. Since they have started the business, their quality of life has been improving. 

Bahit is a very hardworking person and he is focused on the future. He says, “I would like to purchase a car after my children grow up and graduate from the university.”

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory from Ereen to resell them for a profit

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Korng K., age 44, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has seven children. She is engaged in a business of producing Cambodian traditional cakes, earning a gross income of about $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband works at the market to help transport goods for the people at the market, earning an income of about $2 per day. K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a driver. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Marites' Group

texts.en:
Marites C. is from the village of Awallan, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Marites is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marites is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Marites joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support financially immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Tederlita

texts.en:
Tederlita T. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Tederlita is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Tederlita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Tederlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tederlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tederlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. 

Tederlita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Tederlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Hum

texts.en: Hum S., age 29, is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning a gross income of $15 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is employed as a construction worker, earning an income of $5 USD per day. S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store and to sell during Cambodian New Year. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 15, 13, and 10, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for five years.

Batsaihan operates a carpentry business in his town. His business is well known in the local province. Batsaihan designs and produces a variety of wooden products to sell to his many customers. He began his business in 2000 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~$70 USD). His business has grown quickly over the years, and he has a loyal customer base. With a lot of hard work and determination, his working capital has risen to 1,200,000 tugrugs (~$845 USD).

Batsaihan is an experienced carpenter and a very hardworking person. He would like to save money for his children's education. Batsaihan is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber

loans.name: Mot

texts.en:
Mr. Mot M. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Mon Pich, have been married since 1978. They are living along National Road No. 1, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mot raises cows to sell, while his wife sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from Koki market for resale at Phnom Penh market. Mot hopes to continue expanding his business and that it will keep doing well. Therefore, he is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Nat

texts.en: Nat V., age 41, is married and resides with her children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of selling coffee and groceries at home, earning an income of USD 6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike with a compartment attached to provide transportation services in the city, earning an income of USD 9 per day. V. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for one of her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike one of her children to commute to work

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
R. is the wife of Muhammad Riaz and they both live in a city named Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines.
Her husband is involved in a timber selling business. He sells timbers in the community. He started this business when there was no other person operating this business. But now he is facing high competition and to maintain the customers he needs capital to purchase timber in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase timber in bulk

loans.name: Nazarova Buzaynap`s Group

texts.ru:
Главной особенностью данной группы является то, что все участники работает в сельской больнице. 
Бузайнап является лидером данной группы. Ей 55 лет, она замужем. Ее супруг работает автошколе инструктором. У нее 3 сыновей. Старший сын помогет по хозяйству, младший сын школьник, а второй сын находится в России на заработках. Сама клиент работает массажисткой. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одной коровы для откорма.

Айгуль, 28, замужем.  Ее супруг находится на заработках в России. Старшие двое детей школьники и помогают по хозяйству своей матери. Клиент сама работает медсестрой. В данное время она проживает с детьми в недостроенном доме, в планах полностью закончить стройку дома. Кредит запрашивается для закупа одного теленка.

Урмат 45 лет. Она разведена, у нее двоей детей: сын и дочь. Она работает медсестрой. Кредит нужен для купить коз и начать бизнес по откорму и перепродажи скота. 

Темиркан 50 лет. Она также разведена, у нее два сына. Оба находятся в Бишкеке, старший работает специалистом по компьютерной диагностике авто, а млдший учится в юридической академии. Она также работает медсестрой. В прошлом году она начала бизнес по откорму живности.За это время она смогла увеличить поголовье скота, сейчас у нее имеется корова с теленком. Кроме этого она обеспечивает себя и соседей молоком. Кредит запрашивается для закупа 2 овец.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The main distinction of this group is the fact that all of its participants work at the village hospital. Buzaynap is the leader of this group. She is 55 years old and married. Her husband works as an instructor at a driving school. She has 3 sons. The oldest son helps with the household, youngest is a school student, and the middle son works in Russia. Buzaynap works as a massage therapist. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of one cow to fatten. Aygul is 28, married. Her husband is in Russia for work. Two of the oldest children are school students and help their mother with the household. Aygul works as a nurse. She currently lives with her children in an unfinished house and plans to complete the construction of the house. She is requesting the loan to buy one calf. Urmat is 45 years old. She is divorced and has two children: son and daughter. She works as a nurse. Urmat needs a loan to buy goats and start a business of raising and selling livestock. Temirkan is 50 years old. She is also divorced and has two sons, both of whom are in Bishkek. The oldest son works as a specialist in automotive computer diagnostics, and the youngest attends a law academy. Temirkan also works as nurse. Last year, she started a livestock fattening business. Since then, she was able to increase the livestock headcount and now has a cow with a calf. Besides, she also provides milk to herself and her neighbors. She is requesting the loan to buy 2 sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 27-year-old woman with three children aged 10, 8, and 6 years. She and her husband look after their family. They both contribute to the welfare of the family, which resides in a rented house. She deals in selling clothes on market days and has done the business for two years now. Her first line of business was selling pork. She would like to set up a shop to sell new clothing in the future and she believes she can do it with the help of credit from Hofokam and the profit from her current business activity. The purpose of the loan is to purchase clothes for selling.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Byambaahuu

texts.en: Byambaahuu is 65 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, Tomortulga, works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Byambaahuu operates a grocery store in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 with working capital of 1,000,000 tugrugs (~ 705 USD), and since then, he and his wife have built a stable operation. Today, his working capital exceeds 4,000,000 tugrugs (~ 2815 USD). They have been planning to expand their grocery store with their earnings in the future. Byambaahuu is a very hard working person who has good communication skills. He is requesting a 4,000,000-tugrug loan to purchase a variety of products from Narantuul trading center, the biggest market in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch D., age 27, is married and resides with his child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has a young child. He operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is a recycler, earning an income of USD 8 per day. His wife always travels throughout the city to buy and find recyclable material. D. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a trailer and more recyclable materials to expand his wife business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and more recyclable materials

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda F. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Luzminda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business selling snacks like rice cake, puto, suman and other Filipino native snacks in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,450 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 27 years old and married. She has one child, age 5, who is currently attending school. She runs a mixed farm in central Kenya, near the town of Nkubu, where she grows wheat, maize, potatoes, beans and black eyed peas. She also produces and sells milk in her area. 

Overall, Beatrice says there are a number of challenges to overcome to have continued success in her area. Expensive pesticides and farm inputs are a concern, as are low sale prices for her produce. Difficulty in finding markets for her produce, especially wheat, can also be an issue at times. 

Beatrice has a successful history with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, recently completing her first loan for 45,000 Kenyan shillings. She has now requested this loan for 70,000 shillings to purchase a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her child and also will assist in the expansion of her farm. She is also hopeful that she will be able to afford to pay someone to help her around the farm in the near future.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a citizen of a city named Borewala, in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. She is 40-year-old woman. Many years ago, she started a business making artificial flowers. She successfully obtained good customers with her struggle. Now this work gives her good income, which she uses to pay for utilities. 

Her husband's name is J. and he is involved in the timber-selling business. He has been in this profession for over five years. Naseem is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s timber-selling business.

loans.use: To buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is 34 years old and married with three children. They range in age from 2 to 6 years old, with two of them currently attending school. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been for over six years. His current production focuses on milk, maize and beans, but he is now looking to diversify. He says that the main challenge right now is stiff competition and the occasional spread of disease through animal stocks.

Ismael is a new Juhudi Kilimo client and has requested this loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to expand his poultry project. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him meet his family’s basic needs. He also hopes to expand his poultry operations in the future and purchase grade quality chickens, which will yield more income than local breeds.

loans.use: To expand his poulty business.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 47 years old and lives with his wife and son in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His son, Javlavtsogzol, is 8 years old and attends a local secondary school.

Byambasuren operates a motorcycle repairing and soldering business in his town. He has been operating his business since 1990, and has steadily expanded it and become a experienced repairer and solderer. With his earnings, he has been paying university tuition fees for his two older children and he was able to purchase a ger for them to live in while away from home. 

Byambasuren has been planning to purchase his own workplace for the repairing center in the future. Byambasuren is a very hardworking person who has a great business mind. He says, “I like to say the Mongolian quote: 'Right mind, right action.' In addition, I have a loyal customer base and I always try to communicate effectively with my customers. ”  

Byambasuren is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase more equipment and spare parts for his soldering and motorcycle repairing business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and spare parts

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., age 30, is married and resides with his wife and a young child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. He is a farmer, growing morning glories and selling his farming products for a gross income of about $13 per day.  His wife helps her husband in the business, earning a gross income of $12 per day.  

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike, morning glory seeds and pillars in order to increase agricultural output. He would like to use any additional profit to fix his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike, morning glory seeds and pillars

loans.name: Mamasydykova Minara`s Group

texts.ru:
Минаре 34 года. Она проживает вместе с мужем и двумя дочерьми. Дети школьники, супруг работает в России. Клиент занимается пошивом на заказ национальных изделий (жакандос, корпо). Ее старшая дочь помогает и учится у мамы кройке и шитью Кредит запрашивается для закупа материи метражом для пошива и реализации.

Маматкуловой Максуде 47 лет. Она также занимается кройкой и шитьем национальных изделий. Имеет свою постоянную клиентуру. Она замужем и мать 3 сыновей. Старшие сыновья работают и помогают семейному бюджету. Младший сын школьник. Кредит запрашивается для закупа материи

Зуура, 32, замужем. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом по городу Ноокат. У нее 5 детей. На кредит планируют купить дойную корову, для обеспечения семьи молочными продуктами. Кроме этого они выращивают картофель. 

Гулбарчыну 28 лет. Она также замужем, ее супруг занимается перепродажей скота. Бизнес они начали с покупки двух коз. На данное время увеличили поголовье скота -у них имеется 6 овец, 1 корова. Кредит запрашивается для закупа МРС


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Minara is 34 years old. She lives with her husband and two daughters. The children go to school, and the husband works in Russia. Minara is involved in sewing national goods (jakandos, korpo) to-order. Her oldest daughter helps her and learns tailoring and sewing from her mother. Minara is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric for sewing and sale. Maksuda Mamtkulova is 47 years old. She is also involved in tailoring and sewing of national goods. She has a loyal customer base. Maksuda is married and is a mother of 3 sons. The oldest sons work and help with the family budget. The youngest son goes to school. Maksuda is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric. Zuura is 32 years old, married. Her husband provides transportation services in the city of Nookat. Zuura has 5 children. They plan to use the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to provide the family with milk products. They also grow potatoes. Gulbarchyn is 28 years old. She is also married. Her husband is involved in livestock sales. They started this business with a purchase of two goats. Since then, they increased livestock headcount to 6 sheep and one cow. They are requesting the loan for the purchase of small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old and married. She has two children, aged 6 and 23, with her youngest currently enrolled in school.

Susan has been running her mixed farm in central Kenya, near the town of Nkubu, for five years now. Her primary focus is currently on maize, beans, and potatoes, but she is looking to expand her operations. She says that currently the main challenges in her business are the recent drought and issues with pests affecting crops.

Susan has a good credit history with Juhudi Kilimo, having recently completed her first loan of Kes 20,000. She has now requested this loan of Kes 35,000 to expand and improve her poultry-farming operations. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her standard of living and will assist in paying for her youngest child's education.

In the future, Susan would like to continue poultry farming and soon thereafter venture into dairy farming to expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her poultry business

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Mrs. Thary R., 41, and her husband, Mr. Bunna Chea, 45, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have two children: one son and one daughter.

Thary and her husband have been selling food for ten years. She hopes to expand her business, so she is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose. And she will use a part of her loan to expand her store as well.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S., age 68, is widowed and resides with her child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

S. rents part of her house to workers of a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2.50 per day. Her daughter is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to repair the house she rents. She would like to use any additional profit to purchase the neighboring house to rent to more workers.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house she rents

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida M. is still in the process of growing her sari-sari (variety store) business until it becomes profitable and stable. Loans she has been receiving through ASHI enable her to improve her business little by little. Her husband, who is a barangay (village) captain, is happy seeing his wife enjoying her business and making profit to meet the needs of their three children (one child presently goes to college and two are in secondary school). Though there are times when he feels unhappy to see his wife struggling to sustain her business, he remains supportive. Since his honorarium for being a barangay captain is just too small to financially support his family, he therefore agreed with Zenaida’s need to request another loan. With this loan, Zenaida will have capital to increase the inventory of her sari-sari store. Aside from that, she will also increase her revenue; thus, continuously helping her to reach her aspirations as a mother and a wife.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., age 62, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, known as the most populated city in the country.

S. is a farmer, growing morning glories; she sells her farming produce for a gross income of about USD 15 per day. Her husband also grows morning glories, earning an income of USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a stand at the market to sell her farm produce. She would like to use any additional profit to purchase more farmland.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a stand at the market to sell her produce

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem K. is married and lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its plantations.

K. produces traditional baskets and sells her products for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike with a trailer attached, earning an income of USD 6 per day.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new trailer for her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase a truck.

This is K.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a new trailer for her husband's business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie B. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 34 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Rosalie owns and operates a specialized retail business, peddling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community with the used of their motor vehicle. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Norith

texts.en:
Mr. Norith P., 36 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Savoeun You, 35 years old (pictured together), live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school.

Norith has been farming for three years, growing lotus and melon on his farmland in the village. His wife has been running a grocery store since 2006.

Norith is asking for his first loan of $600 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his lotus and melon farm and he will also use a part of the loan to help fund his wife’s business.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to purchase groceries for his wife's business

loans.name: Rum

texts.en:
Rum M., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its plantations. She is a butcher and sells pork for an income of about USD 5 per day. Her husband operates his motorbike as a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3.50 per day.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a trailer to transport pigs purchased from local farmers. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay her children’s school fees.

This is M.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport pigs

loans.name: Sharifan's Group

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 38-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Her husband is a farmer and he also raises animals. Selling animals he has raised is his special source of income. Sharifan also operates an embroidered clothes business to supplement her husband’s income.

Sharifan would like to ask for a loan to buy animals (goats and sheep) for her husband’s business. Accomplishing this will allow him to increase his income and better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase animals for her husband's business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 38-year-old married man living in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has five children, ranging in age from 6 to 16 years, with all five of them currently attending school.

Daniel has been running his mixed farm for over five years now and sells a wide variety of products at the local market. His primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, eggs and sheep, while he also earns income from running a small restaurant in town. He says that, lately, the main challenge to his business is marketing his farm produce.

Daniel has a successful history with Juhudi Kilimo, previously completing three loans of Kes 20,000, Kes 30,000 and Kes 50,000. He has now requested this loan of Kes 50,000 to expand his poultry farming operations and to construct a new dairy cow shed. He says that the extra income from this loan will help his children acquire an education, eat well, and be well clothed.

Daniel has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years, and his main goal is to have five quality dairy cows and more than two hundred hens. He wants to be in a position where he can offer employment opportunities to other people in his area.

loans.use: To buy chickens and build a dairy cow shed

loans.name: Kmor

texts.en:
Kmor T., 19, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She produces cow ties and sells her products for an income of about $0.70 per day. Her husband is a taxi driver from the province to Phnom Penh, earning an income of $5 per day.  

T. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a motorbike for the family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to fix the house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Trouk

texts.en:
Trouk H., 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She cooks porridge for people in her village for an income of about $2.50 per day. Her husband is a skillful fisherman, earning an income of $2.50 per day.

H. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase pig food to feed the pigs she is raising. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to purchase more pigs to raise. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy pig food

loans.name: Tasleem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Akhtar is a citizen of a city named Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala city is famous for its shrines. Her husband's name is M. H. and he has owned a convenience store for three years. With this business, he is able to care for his wife and his son. M. continues to work to increase his number of customers. His business is becoming popular in the neighborhood because of its great quality.

The loan will help M. grow his business by improving the facilities, and buying a greater variety of goods to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Rahat Akmatova`s Group

texts.ru:
Рахат, 51, замужем. Она мать 6 детей. Самому старшему 25, а самому младшему 12. Ее супруг занимается частным извозом. Клиент работает преподавателем в средней школе, кроме этого дома занимается птицеводством и откормом МРС. Клиент начинала бизнес с 10 куриц в 2001 году. В данное время у нее имеется 60 куриц, а также 5 коз. Цель кредита купить коня для использования в весенне-полевых сельхоз работах.

Калыйман 42 года. Она замужем, ее супруг работает преподавателем, также подрабатывает завхозом в школе. У нее 4 детей. Старшие сын и дочь студенты, а младшие дети школьники. Сама же работает поваром и техничкой в средней школе.   На кредит клиент планирует купить овцу.

Исламидину 23 года. Пока холост, однако в планах женится в этом году. Он в данное время проживает с родителями.  Исламидин занимается перепродажей МРС на местном рынке. Бизнес был начат с двух овец, сейчас у него есть 7 овец, а также за счет бизнеса купил дойную корову. Цель кредита закуп двух овец.

Айнагул 46 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает одного 1 сына. Он школьник. Ее супруг работает в цементном заводе. Клиент занимается откормом домашнего скота. Ранее клиент занималась торговлей, от прибыли купила 4 овцы. Сейчас она хочет расширить свой бизнес и докупить еще пару овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Rahat is 51 years old, married. She is a mother of 6 children. The oldest is 25, and the youngest is 12. Her husband provides transportation services. Rahat works as a teacher at a secondary school and is also involved in bird husbandry and raising small livestock. She started the business with 10 chickens in 2001. Currently, she has 60 chickens and also 5 goats. The goal of this loan is to purchase a horse and use it for spring field work. Kalyiman is 42 years old. She is married. Her husband works as a teacher and also as an office manager at a school. Kalyiman has 4 children. The oldest son and daughter are college students, and the youngest are school students. Kalyiman works as a cook and as a janitor at a secondary school. She plans to use the loan to buy a sheep. Islamidin is 23 years old. He is single for now, but plans to get married this year. He currently lives with his parents. Islamidin is involved in sales of small livestock at the local market. He started the business with two sheep and now has seven, and he was able to buy a dairy cow. The goal of this loan is a purchase of two sheep. Aynagul is 46 years old. She is married and is raising one son, who is a school student. Aynagul’s husband works at a cement factory. The client is involved in raising domestic livestock. She was previously involved in retail sales and used the profits from this business to buy 4 sheep. Now she wants to expand her business and buy a couple more sheep.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a horse

loans.name: Chourng

texts.en:
Chourng N., 24, is married and resides with her husband and child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She raises pigs at home to sell for an income of about $1 per day. Her husband (pictured) operates his motorbike with a trailer attached to give transportation services to villagers, earning an income of $4 per day.  

N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one because this motorbike often needs repairs. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair the house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: Née le 17 septembre 1967 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, M. Sophie vit à Fiégnon à Cotonou. Sophie est mariée à HOUNSOUCLE Daniel, un employé au parc, avec qui elle vit. Sophie et son mari subviennent ensemble aux dépenses du foyer. Pour apporter son aide a son mari, Sophie exerce comme activité principale la vente de divers produits (pâtes dentifrices, piles, bougies, sucres, conserves de tomâtes, lait, des paquets de cigarette etc.). De manière secondaire, Sophie vend également du charbon de bois. Sophie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et les revend à Fiégnon Jacko, non loin de son domicile. Sophie mène son activité depuis bientôt 11 ans mais n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Sophie a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans le but d’élever le niveau de ses activités et étant limitée par ses moyens financiers, Sophie sollicite un troisième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born 17 September 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Sophie M. lives in Fiégnon in Cotonou. She is married to Daniel HOUNSOUCLE, a park employee, with whom she lives. Sophie and her husband jointly share the household expenses. Sophie’s main occupation to help her husband is to sell various products (toothpaste, batteries, sugar, canned tomatoes, milk, cigarette packs, etc.). She also sells charcoal as a secondary activity. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market, and resells them in Fiégnon Jacko, not far from her home. Sophie has been pursuing these activities for almost 11 years. She has never attended school. Sophie has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. Wishing to increase the level of her activities but held back because of her limited finances, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (canned tomatoes and sardines, batteries, sugar, toothpaste, soap, cookies)

loans.name: Modupe

texts.en:
35-year-old Modupe is married and she is blessed with three children. She lives in Lagos State with her family. She has been a member of LAPO microfinance for some years with a good repayment record. Modupe is computer literate; she does computer training and other computer work to make a living. She also sells rechargeable phone cards for additional income. She hopes for a standard computer training centre that will develop into a school in the future. 

Modupe is requesting a 50,000 naira loan to improve the training centre and to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To improve a training centre

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai K. and her husband, Mr. Chun Nhem, have been married since 1985 and have five children: three daughters and two sons. Two of their daughters are garment-factory workers, one son is a construction worker and the other children attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Lai K. used to sell fish her husband caught. But now the couple stopped the fishing and fish selling business and run new businesses. Lai sells porridge in front of her house. Her husband is a construction contractor.

In addition, Lai hopes to buy rice for resale; she will be able to get extra income to better support her family. Hence, she is requesting another loan of $400 in order to buy rice for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is a 74-year-old widow with eight adult children. She has been farming for over 50 years in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. She sells a wide variety of produce at the local market, including potatoes, maize and beans, while she also earns income from her ownership of a few rental homes. She says that there remains a number of challenges in her farming, including high costs of production and high feed prices for animals. 

Janifer has a successful history with Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo, recently completing a loan for 32,100 Kenyan shillings. She has now requested this loan for 62,400 shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. As Janifer has all adult children, she says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her grandchildren in some ways, but the proceeds will mainly be used for philanthropic activities in her church, helping the needy in her area. 

In the future, Janifer hopes that her business will be big enough to help other people in the community. She hopes to provide employment opportunities to more than 10 people in the next few years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en: Sourn L., 34, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She is a housewife, while her husband sells car spare parts in the city, earning an income of $5 USD per day. L. is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more spare parts to expand her husband’s current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to pay for the children’s school. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts

loans.name: Adelaida's Group

texts.en: Adelaida M. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. She is 43 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Adelaida is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Adelaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase poultry feed and other supplies. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed and other supplies

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S., 48, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia — an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. She makes silk scarves which brings her an income of about $1 per day.  Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $0.3 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more raw silk to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to fix her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more raw silk

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.ru: Носиров Нематжон проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Образование средне- специальное "Электрик". По специональности работает уже 25 лет. Кроме того занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Имеет небольшой коровник. Он откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 9 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Nematjon N. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. He has a secondary-specialized education as an electrician. Namatjon has been working in his field for 25 years. Besides this work, he is also involved in animal husbandry and agriculture. He has a small cowshed. He fattens and sells livestock. Nematjon has been in this business for over 9 years. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn G. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old and single with one small child. To make a living, Jonalyn provides a motorcycle service transporting passengers around her  local community. She has had this business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials she needs to maintain her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jonalyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing  accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials she needs to maintain her business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean K. is a rice farmer in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds so is asking for a loan to do so. She would use the money to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband, Mr. Heng Lou, is a teacher who makes only a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sean K. is 51 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a government official while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Rathunona

texts.en:
Rathunona is a 58-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and one daughter, who is 25 years old. They live in the town of Hikkaduwa. There are many members living with them: her daughter, nephew, and their children are all living together. Rathunona is a educated lady.

Rathunona always provides support to her husband. She has a little timber cooperation business, which her nephew also provides support for. She started this business five years ago. The family has good experience in this field, and also has a good market in this business. Their personal discipline and organizational behaviors are very good.

Rathunona has requested a 40,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To expand her timber business

loans.name: Ahouassi

texts.fr: K. Ahouassi est née à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et vit à Fiégnon, un quartier de Cotonou. Ahouassi n’a jamais été à l’école mais exerce une activité depuis 10 ans. En effet, Ahouassi vend du « Manwè » (fait à base de maïs, servant à la préparation de l’akassa, aliment local) de façon ambulante. Ahouassi s’approvisionne en maïs à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Ahouassi voudrait renforcer son activité et produire davantage de « Manwè », en vue de satisfaire plus sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C’est la raison pour laquelle Ahouassi sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Ahouassi K. was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and lives in Fiégnon, a borough in Cotonou. Ahouassi has never attended school but has been active for the past ten years. In fact, Ahouassi is an itinerant vendor of “Manwè” (a corn-based product, used to prepare akassa, a local food preparation). She gets her corn supply from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She is a regular client of ALIDé, having already been granted three previous loans, all reimbursed in full. She would like to strengthen her activity and produce more “Manwè”, thereby increasing customer satisfaction and generating more revenue. This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of corn to prepare "Manwè"

loans.name: Niamatay's Group

texts.en: Niamatay aged 47, is married and lives with her four children in Borewala, Pakistan. She is a housewife who stays at home to look after the children and do household chores while her husband drives an auto-rickshaw (a three-wheeled motor vehicle) earning an income of Pak Rs. 300 per day. Their standard of living has improved since her husband has had this business. Niamatay is requesting a loan of Pak Rs. 20,000 to repair his rickshaw.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Sa-Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa-em C., is 38 years old  and her husband, Mr. Khoeun Moeun, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have four children— three sons and one daughter. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number four, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sa-em has been a garment factory worker for ten years, while her husband has been a construction worker for a year. She wants to supplement their income with a new business — raising cows. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a cow to raise as she will be able to get extra income from selling it when it grows big enough.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Theda's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Theda K. is the leader of a four-person group in Kor village in Takeo province. She owns a small general store in a local village and, since  business is going well, she wants to expand so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more goods to sell. Her husband, Mr. Khel Pros, is a farmer. Mrs. Theda K. is 31 years old and the mother of three children, two in school and a five-year old. Mrs. Korb Sok and Mrs. Kim Chun Bech who are group guarantors are also in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en: Ma. Victoria I. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Ma. Victoria is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ma. Victoria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Ma. Victoria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Victoria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Mrs. Som C. is 54 years old and is a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Som C. owns a rental kiosk in the local market where she sells food to people who come to shop. Also she relies on the income from her husband who owns a car he uses to pick up students, for a fee, who study in a private school.

This couple is married and is blessed with seven children. One of their children is now married and lives away from home while the remaining six are single. Two daughters are employed and provide their small income to support their family.

Som C. is applying for a loan to buy attractive accessories for her food shop and to repair an old car that often breaks down during her husband’s use.

loans.use: To buy attractive accessories for her store and to repair an old car used in her husband's business

loans.name: Nike

texts.en:
Nike and her family reside and trade in Lagos. She is married and her husband is a businessman; they have three children. She and her husband work hard to make sure there is comfort in the home.

45-year-old Nike is into molding and selling building blocks. She started the business some years ago and manages the business with the support of her employees. To increase her profit, she wants to buy more cement, sand and other material to mold more blocks to sell to her customers due to the increase in demand.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase the materials she needs. She appreciates lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more cement, sand and other materials

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, H. Anastasie vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Hlacomey à Cotonou. Anastasie est mariée à HODONOU Boniface et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un est à sa charge. Anastasie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Anastasie vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Pour assurer ses besoins, Anastasie prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs, accompagnés de différentes sauces) à son domicile. Anastasie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Anastasie exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans et a bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter sa production et de mieux répondre à la demande nombreuse de ses clients, Anastasie sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Anastasie H. has been living for the past 20 years in the Hlacomey borough of Cotonou. She is married to Boniface HODONOU and is the mother of two children, both having had schooling, and of whom one is under her care. She lives with her children and her husband. She helps her husband deal with various family expenses. To meet her needs, Anastasie prepares and sells food from her home (rice, cornmeal mush, accompanied by different sauces). She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. She has been in this line of business for 12 years and has already been granted four loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid in full. To increase her production and improve her response to a strong customer demand, Anastasie is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, corn and tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene M. is from the village of Barina-ut, Iligan City. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Arlene owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Barina-ut, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Nazik

texts.en:
Nazik H. was born in 1965 in Koti village, Ijevan area, and graduated from Ijevan State College. She is married and now lives with her husband in Sarigyugh village in Ijevan area.

Nazik is an economist and she works as an accountant in Sarigyugh village administration. At the same time, she and her husband are engaged in animal breeding and land cultivation which helps them to support their family's daily needs.

Nazik is borrowing for the third time from Nor Horizon, and now she asks for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for her farm animals and seeds for sowing. Her future income she plans to spend on her son's wedding.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her farm animals and seeds for sowing

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 40 years old, is a married woman living in Phnom Penh. She is a good homemaker who currently stays at home to care for the children and do housework.

Mrs. S. has seven five teenage children. She sometimes depends on her husband's income, who works as a temporary laborer in the construction field. In addition, S. has two daughters who are no longer in school and work as garment factory employees.

The family living conditions are not so good due to their house needing repair. Thus, S. is looking for a loan to mend and decorate her old house.

loans.use: To mend and decorate her old house

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea S., is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Korn Eng, is 29 years old. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter.

Sophea has been a driver for ten years, driving for a garment factory. His wife has been a garment factory worker for eleven years. He wants to buy motorcycle for commuting because he does not have transportation. Therefore, he is asking for his first loan $1,000 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Mrs. Sam Ross Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of seventeen people, is located in DaeU. Doung village in Takeo province and each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. S. Ross U. is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock to re-sell later at a better price. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep in stock.

Mrs. S. Ross U. has four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Mut Chek, is a motorbike taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loans.name: Chandrawathi

texts.en:
Chandrawathi is a 54-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has three children, two of whom are married, and the third is single. She lives in the town of Hikkaduwa. Her husband has a government job.

Chandrawathi has a business selling coconuts in her town, and her children help her in this business. She spends every penny of her earnings towards supporting her family's needs. For ten years she has been doing this job. She has gained sound experience in this business and she is active, honest and a hardworking woman.

Chandrawathi has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her coconut business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her coconut business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan K., 66, has been remarried to his second wife, Mrs. Yen Pan, since 2007 and has one daughter who attends school. They are living along National Road Number Five, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

The couple has been operating a business selling Khmer noodles since they married. They buy Khmer noodles from their village and transport them sell in other villages.

Chan K. is requesting his first loan of $300 to build a new staircase for his house. The new staircase will be stronger.

loans.use: To build a new staircase for his house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
For a hospitable woman like Elena C., gaining a lot of customers for their blacksmith business isn’t hard. It is meeting their increasing demands and the need to expand plus the increasing financial needs of her family that worries her.

For this reason, Elena and her husband decided to request a much larger loan through ASHI. Once their blacksmith shop becomes stable, in addition to her hog-breeding business, Elena believes that they will also be able to sustain the education of their children who are in college and will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for manufacturing bolos (large single-edged knives) and other knives

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: H. Françoise est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a environ 11ans que Françoise vit à Suru-Léré, un quartier de Cotonou. Mariée à ADENIGNI, Françoise est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Aucun des enfants de Françoise ne sont plus à sa charge. Françoise aide son mari à supporter les charges familiales en faisant du commerce. Ainsi, Françoise commercialise divers produits (conserves de tomâtes, cubes, pics dents etc.). Françoise achète et revend ses produits à Dantopka, marché international du Bénin. Cela fait 6 ans que Françoise exerce son activité bien qu’elle n’ait jamais fréquenté l’école. Françoise a déjà obtenu un premier crédit chez ALIDé et ce crédit a été bien remboursé. Françoise souhaite diversifier ses produits pour attirer plus de clients, c’est la raison pour laquelle elle désire bénéficier d’un deuxième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Françoise was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in Suru-Léré, a distict of Cotonou, for about eleven years.  Married to ADENIGNI, she is the mother of three children, who have all attended school.  None of her children are in her care any longer.  Françoise helps her husband to support the family through her business.  She therefore markets a variety of goods (canned tomatoes, bouillon cubes, toothpicks, etc.)  She buys and sells her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She has been in this business for six years, even though she has never attended school.  She once obtained a loan with ALIDé that has been repaid.  Françoise wishes to diversify her goods in order to attract more customers.  For this reason, she would like to obtain a second loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying canned tomatoes in bulk and packets of bouillon cubes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 20 to 25 years old. Her two youngest children are still enrolled in school.
