texts.en:
Leona is 61 years old and she had 4 children, 2 boys and 2 girls, all of whom are married now. She is a widow, dedicated to weaving typical clothing which she sells in the local market. This is the 2nd loan she has solicited with ASDIR. Her previous loan was repaid with much responsibility. Leona is well known for her participation and collaboration in her community. Despite her age, she has much energy and desire to achieve. She needs the financing to increase her working capital, and specifically, to buy thread for her artful weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING THREAD FOR WEAVING TYPICAL CLOTHING WHICH SHE SELLS

loans.name: Hector Otoniel

texts.es: Héctor es de 65 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos todos ya están separados de él, tiene establecido una tienda de consumo en la plaza del mercado local, junto con su esposa han salido adelante, los dos atienden el negocio, es el cuarto crédito que solicita en ASDIR, los anteriores los ha pagado sin problema demostrando su responsabilidad, necesitan el financiamiento para ampliar su tienda comprar más mercadería.
texts.en:
Héctor, 65, has five children who live independently. He has a grocery store located in the local market. He and his wife have gotten ahead in life together. Both tend to the business. This is his 4th loan with ASDIR; he repaid the previous ones in a timely fashion. They need this funding to buy more stock merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Señor De Muruhuay Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal SEÑOR D. MURUHUAY está conformado por 10 socias quienes se desempeñan en labores D. comercio minorista e informal y trabajan con nuestra institución hace 2 años, demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en su compromiso D. pago.
La Sra. Mahalda asume el cargo D. presidenta es una persona emprendedora y entusiasta con el grupo, ella se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales hace varios años, se inicio en este negocio ya que vio la necesidad D. apoyar a su familia económicamente, con este negocio aprendió mucho acerca D. los beneficios D. productos naturales y la mejora D. la salud, ella se siente muy contenta ya que pueD. ayudar e informar a otras personas.
Lorenza se dedica al negocio D. alquiler D. vestidos D. fiesta y ternos para ocasiones especiales. Con sus ingresos apoya a su familia con los gastos familiares además ha solventado la educación D. sus hijos juntamente con su esposo. Lorenza es la tesorera del grupo.
Hace muchos años Gladys se dedica a la venta D. golosinas ambulatoriamente, con sus pocos ingresos pueD. brindarles educación a sus 2 menores hijos, su principal objetivo es la mejora D. su negocio por lo cual con el préstamo recibido invertirá en la compra D. productos que le permitan tener mayores ganancias.
Todos nuestros socias agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen en cumplir con sus los pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
The communal bank Señor D. Muruhuay is maD. up of 10 members who are involved in different minor and informal commercial activities. They have worked with Señor D. Muruhuay for 2 years, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility with their repayment commitment. Señora Mahalda assumes the role of president and is an empresarial and enthusiastic person in the group. She has sold natural products for many years, beginning this business when she saw the necessity to support her family economically. With this business she learned much about the benefits of natural products and health improvements. She feels very content now that she can help and inform other people. Lorenza has a clothing hire business for party clothes and suits for special occasions. With her earnings she supports her family with the household costs and has been able to cover her childrens' education costs together with her husband. Lorenza is the treasurer of the group. Many years ago Gladys began working selling sweets on foot. With her little earnings she can proviD. education to her 2 youngest children. Gladys's principle objective is the improvement of her business, for which reason the loan she is seeking will be invested in the purchase of products that allow her to obtain better earnings. All of these members are thankful for the support given to them and promise to meet their repayments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products and inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 63 años de edad, se dedica a bordar blusas típicas, es el segundo crédito que solicita en ASDIR, su trabajo es muy cotizado ya que es elaborado a mano y es de buena calidad, el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar material que le servirá para seguir bordando blusas que le han encargado personas de su comunidad, con la ayuda de su esposo pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Paulina, 63, embroiders traditional blouses. This is her second loan request with ASDIR. Her creations are highly sought-after because they are hand-made and of very good quality. She needs funds to buy materials and supplies she can use to continue emboridering blouses that she has on order. Her husband will help her repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies.

loans.name: Johana Lorena

texts.es:
Johana tiene 22 años, y vive en casa de su suegra hace 3 años aproximadamente ya que 
convivía con el padre de su menor hija; actualmente se encuentra separada de él sin 
embargo a pesar de ello recibe el apoyo de sus suegros en cuanto a vivienda y 
alimentación. Ella tiene un carrito sanguchero en el cual se dedica a vender 
hamburguesas todas las noches en la puerta de su casa. Requiere el crédito para 
incrementar y diversificar sus productos, ya que desea que su negocio se desarrolle y 
poder ser una persona totalmente independiente para  poderle brindar bienestar y una buena 
educación a su menor hija.
texts.en:
Johana, 22, has lived with her in-laws for the past three years because she was together with the father of her daughter. She is currently separated from him but, despite that, her in-laws continue to help out providing her with housing and food. She has a small food preparation cart that she uses to make hamburgers every night at her doorstep. She needs funds to increase and diversify her products because she hopes that her business will grow so that she can become completely independent and be able to provide for her daughter's wellbeing as well as for her education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Isodora

texts.es:
Isidora, tiene 37 años y tiene una hija (Yaneth de 19 años), Isidoro es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a su hija. 

Isidora alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ella nos cuenta que lleva comida al hotel “Libertadores” de Urubamba todos los días. 

Isidora pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar fideos  y muchos más comestibles. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isidora, 37, has a daughter, Yaneth, 19. She is a responsible mother that always seeks ways to get ahead and provide, through her own efforts, a better future for her daughter. Isidora alternates her household chores with a small business that consists in preparing meals. She tells us that she takes food to the "Libertadores" hotel in Urubamba every day. Isidora is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "TERCER MILENIO" (Third Millennium) communal bank. She invested her first, 100-dollar, loan in her business. She is currently requesting funds to buy rice, sugar, pasta and many other food items. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta and many other food items.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis tiene 36 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos un varón y dos mujeres, se dedica a la venda de zapatos, cuenta con un local en la plaza del mercado local, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita el anterior lo pago puntualmente, necesita nuevamente el financiamiento para incrementar y surtir mejor su mercadería en zapatos de todo tipo y talla, su esposa le ayuda en atender el negocio y con la ayuda de ella pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Luis is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children, a boy and 2 girls. He sells shoes, and has a location in the plaza of a local market. This is his 2nd loan with ASDIR, and he paid off the first loan on time. Now he needs financing to increase and restock his merchandise with shoes of all types and sizes. His wife helps him to attend to the business, and with her help he will pay off this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shoes)

loans.name: Luzalva

texts.es:
Lusalva M. D. vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio de la ciudad de Barranquilla,   sector comercial y  también residencial. Lusalva se dedica a la confección de ropa para niños, necesita un crédito por valor de  $1.500.000, para comprar al por mayor y de contado, materia prima e insumos como telas, cintas encajes e hilos.
Inició su negocio en el año 1990; ella primero estudió modistería en Bucaramanga y trabajó en un taller de confecciones para luego independizarse y en la actualidad  trabaja con su hija que se dedica al corte y otra operaria que trabaja en el acabado de los vestidos y que con su encanto los adorna y decora, al igual que  la señora Susana  que diseña y confecciona en un extensivo horario d e 8:00 a m  a 8:00 P.m.  pues vive enamorada de su arte.
Luzalva M., vende por docenas a clientes de un centro comercial cercano a su taller, llamado Metrocentro y  a clientes varios ubicados en colmenas del centro de Barranquilla, donde  hay una gran competencia pero a ella la prefieren por la calidad en los acabados y su estricto cumplimiento en la entrega. Sus compras las realiza  semanalmente y algunos insumos como los detalles, botones  y adornos cada tres días.

Este es el noveno crédito realizado a  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización en la tiene 12 años de participación tanto en sus programas de crédito, como los de  capacitación. Estando vinculada a estos procesos  ha logrado modernizar su maquinaria: así fue cuando compró las 2 fileteadores, luego 2 máquinas de coser y también hizo adecuaciones a su apartamento.
Su gran sueño de montar una unidad de comercialización en un centro comercial de prestigio, pero reconoce que debe esperar haciendo esfuerzos mercadologicos, que le ayuden a aumentar la producción y las ventas de ropa de niños para  generar por lo menos un empleo más, ese es precisamente su gran desafío.
texts.en:
Luzalva M. D. lives in Barranquilla’s 20 de Julio housing project, which is both a commercial and residential area. She manufactures children’s clothing and needs a $1.500.000 loan to buy raw materials like fabric, ribbon, lace and thread at wholesale and retail. She started her business in 1990 having learned to be a seamstress in Bucaramanga. She was employed at a tailor shop but later became independent and currently works with her daughter, who does the cutting, and another worker, who does the finishing on the items and who uses her skills to decorate and adorn them, and with Susana who designs and sews; she works a long shift from 8am to 8pm because she adores her art. Luzalva M. sells by the dozen to customers in a shopping center near her shop called, Metrocentro and to customers located in colmenas (densely populated apartment buildings) in downtown Barranquilla. Competition is high but she is preferred thanks to the quality of her finishing and her strict adherence to delivery schedules. She buys most of her raw materials weekly but some of them like, details, buttons and decorations, every three days. This is her 9th loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization she has been collaborating with for 12 years, both in loan programs and in training sessions. Being tied to these processes has made it possible for her to modernize her equipment. This is how she was able to purchase two over lock sewing machines (special sewing machines to do finishing on garments) and do some home improvements to her apartment. Her great dream is to set up a store in a prestigious shopping center but she knows that she must wait and continue to make merchandising efforts that will help her increase production and sales of children’s clothes in order to generate at least one additional job. This is precisely her great challenge.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, lace, ribbon and other sewing supplies and materials.

loans.name: Agustin Haroldo

texts.es: Agustín es de 36 años de edad, es casado, tiene 4 hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, junto con su esposa han establecido un talles de fabricación de sandalias los comercializa en el mercado local, es el tercer crédito que solicita en ASDIR los anteriores los pago bien, acude nuevamente para adquirir un financiamiento que le servirá para ampliar su capital específicamente para la compra de materiales que se utiliza en la fabricación de las sandalias.
texts.en:
Agustín is 36 years old, married, and has four children (two sons and two daughters). Together with his wife, he established a workshop where they manufacture sandals to sell at the local market. This is the third loan he has requested from Asociación ASDIR. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

This new loan will serve to increase his capital, specifically for purchasing materials used in making sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making sandals

loans.name: Alikakay Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Alikakay' group from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. These are a group of small-scale-entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each member of the group in order to buy more goods to add to their business inventory. In this way, they can attract many more customers, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group is Fatu K.. The 46-year-old was born in Magburaka town; she is married to a shepherd and they have 4 children. Fatu sells market food and also rears and sells cattle. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will buy market food like rice, onions, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. to add to her business inventory.  

(Also in the picture is loan officer Abdul Karim, on the right.)

loans.use: Buy rice, onions, Maggi cubes, etc. wholesale

loans.name: Tamtamnehsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tamtamnehsu' group from the northern township of Magburaka. These women are petty traders who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata C.. Fatmata is a 31-year-old widow with three children to look after. A native of Magburaka town, she sells used clothes in the township. She has been running this business for ten years now. With her share of the loan, Fatmata will buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy a bale or two of used clothes

loans.name: Pammai Sellers Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are members of the 'Pammai Sellers' group from the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. For many years now, this group of women have been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil) in the town’s main market. They are applying for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to boost their businesses. 

The leader of the group is Marie K. in the lefthand side of the photo. The 50-year-old is a widow with five children. Two of her children are still in school and the rest are now grown-ups and living on their own. Marie sells palm oil and has been doing this business for many years now. She and her colleagues in the group will use their loans to buy "barters" (five gallons make a barter) of palm oil.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Small-Small Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Small-Small' group from Magubraka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to expand their businesses. Consequently, they can make more sales, better profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Fatmata S. K.. Fatmata was born in Magburaka. She is married and has five children. Fatmata’s husband is a motor mechanic and her children are attending schools – one in secondary school and four in primary school. For eight years now, Fatmata has been selling medicines. With her share of the loan, she will buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, and many different kinds of tablets to add to her pharmacy inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy Penadol, Chloroquine, ORS, etc., to add to her pharmacy inventory

loans.name: Ta-Muyusu Group

texts.en:
In the picture above are members of the 'Ta-Muyusu' group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. These women are petty traders who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to enable them to expand their businesses. 

Fatmata B. is the leader of this group of four. Fatmata, who was born in Magburaka, is a 45-year-old woman. She is married to a professional worker and they have six children – two are in secondary school, two in primary school and two are already married. Fatmata sells rice, groundnuts (peanuts), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of rice, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.  

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, groundnuts and gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 58 años D. edad, es separada y tiene un hijo ya indepedizado que aún vive con ella, residen en la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque y conocida a nivel nacional como La Ciudad D. la Amistad.

Se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, bebidas heladas (agua, gaseosas, frugos) y productos D. aseo personal, en el frontis D. un hospital D. Chiclayo, contando con más D. 04 años D. experiencia en este negocio. Esta actividad es muy util en el lugar ya que provee D. artículos que necesitan las personas que están D. visita y  hasta el mismo personal D. dicho nosocomio.

Para realizar esta labor, María Elena posee una vitrina D. regular tamaño (con ruedas) para la exhibición D. sus productos y un cooler para almacenar las bebidas. Cuando no trabaja encarga estos muebles en una vivienda cerca del Hospital. Este negocio es su unica fuente D. ingreso por lo que siempre da todo D. si para sacarlo adelante.

Actualmente María Elena se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1900 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. mercadería, en el arreglo D. las ruedas D. su vitrina y para comprar una nueva sombrilla. D. tal manera que pueda realizar su labor fácilmente. 

María Elena es una mujer bastante estimada y respetada por las personas que la conocen, ellos la consideran una persona amable y servicial. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María Elena is 58 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a son who is independent but still lives with her. They resiD. in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region that is known nationally as the City of Friendship.

María Elena sells candy, cold drinks (water, sodas, and juices), and personal care products in front of a hospital in Chiclayo. She has more than four years of experience in this business. Her activity in this place is very useful because she provides items that are needed by people who are visiting the hospital as well as the staff members. In order for her to work, María Elena has an average size display case on wheels that she uses to exhibit her products as well as a cooler to store the drinks. When she is not working, she keeps her equipment in a shed near the hospital. This business is her only source of income and provides everything she needs to get ahead.

María Elena is currently requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1900 PEN. She plans to use the money to buy merchandise, repair the wheels on her display case, and get a new umbrella so that she can easily perform her work. María Elena is well-liked and respected by the people who know her. They consider her to be a friendly and helpful person. She has previously worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that she is punctual and responsible when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise, repair the wheels on her display case, and get a new umbrella

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta es natural de Urubamba, tiene 27 años y  es una joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Violeta es profesora del nivel inicial y actualmente esta trabajando en la Institución  Educativa “La Salle” de Urubamba, ella y su familia abrieron un pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos (El anticucho es un plato de origen peruano que consiste en carne marinada en un aderezo especial a base de ají panca ensartada en un palito de caña o de metal y cocinada a la parrilla.). 
 

Violeta pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, cervezas y carnes. El anhelo de la socia es que su negocio se convierta en una cadena de anticucherias (Anticucheria, lugar donde se vende anticuchos). 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Violeta is 27 years old and a native of Urubamba. She is a responsible young woman who looks at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and strive daily to help her family.

Violeta is a pre-school teacher and currently works at an educational institution called “La Salle” in Urubamba. She and her family opened a small business selling “anticuchos” (a Peruvian dish consisting of meat that is marinated in a dressing made of aji peppers, skewered on sticks or metal rods, and cooked on a grill).

Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Her first loan as a member was for $100, which was invested in her business. She needs a loan to buy sodas, beer, and meat. Violeta hopes to convert her business of into a chain of establishments that sell “anticuchos”.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, beer, and meat

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a 28-year-old mother of two children aged 8 and 4 years old. Her husband is a driver and they live in Hoima, Uganda in a rented house with a family of five dependants. Both of them share the responsibilities for their family's welfare. Doreen has a salon she operates and has five years of experience in the business. This, she says, is her first job and business and she dreams of starting a cosmetics shop in addition to improving her salon. This is her 11th loan from HOFOKAM and she will use the loan funds to buy braids and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.use: To buy braids and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Cristo Es Vida Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CRISTO ES VIDA”

Elsa es L. presidenta del grupo “CRISTO ES VIDA”, elL. es madre soltera D. 63 años D. edad vive con su único hijo, que aun depenD. D. elL. porque esta en rehabilitación por haber consumido drogas, y con su nieto que aun esta muy pequeño.

ElL. nos comenta que años atrás tenía una empresa D. snack pero al enfermarse gravemente D. los bronquios no pudo hacerse cargo D. su empresa, su ayudante encontró otro trabajo, elL. pidió el apoyo D. su familia pero nadie quería hacerse cargo, así que su pequeña empresa quebró.

Al recuperarse, tenia que comenzar nuevamente, ahora elL. se dedica a L. venta D. desayunos frente a un mercado en un kiosco donD. venD. leche D. soya, quinua, maca, etc. y panes con queso, palta, huevo etc., también estando en casa se dedica a L. venta D. tamales. El préstamo lo usará para invertir en su negocio.

ElL. planea tener una casa para que pueda darles un mejor hogar a su hijo y a su nieto.
También le gustaría viajar en especial conocer el Cuzco.
texts.en:
“CRISTO ES VIDA” (CHRIST IS LIFE) COMMUNAL BANK Elsa, 63, is the group president; she’s a single mother living with her only son, who is dependent on her because he is in drug rehab, and with her grandson, who is still very little. She tells us that years ago she had a snack business but, having become quite ill with bronchial problems, she could no longer look after her firm. Her assistant found a different job; Elsa asked for help from her family but nobody wanted to take charge, so her small firm failed. When she got her health back she had to start over again from scratch. Now, she sells prepared brekfasts in a food stand aross from a market; she sells soy milk, quinoa, maca (a radish-like root), etc. as well as bread with cheese, avocado, egg, etc. Since she’s home, she also sells tamales. She will use the funds to buy inredients for her meals. She plans to have her own house so that she can proviD. a better home for her son and grandson. She would also like to travel, especially to Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meal preparations.

loans.name: Roberto Simón

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Simón R. L., tiene la edad de 40 años vive en Pilas Orientales es casado y tienen dos hijos de las edades de 13 y 9 años, ellos actualmente estudian. La familia se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años.

En su trabajo se le han presentado problemas de sequia por la escases de agua en la zona, ellos comenzaron a trabajar sus tierras con la ayuda de su tío y la reforma agraria, dentro de sus planes esta la diversificación de sus cosechas, solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y fungicidas que le permitan una producción de calidad y una mejor oferta que le permita mejores condiciones económicas, que beneficien a él y su familia
texts.en:
Sr. Roberto Simón R. L. is 40 years old and lives in Pilas Orientales. He is married and has two children, ages 13 and 9, who are currently in school. The family has been farming for four years.

Drought has caused problems for his work because water is scarce in the area. He started the work on his land with the help of his uncle and as a result of land reform. His plans include diversifying his crops. Roberto is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers and fungicides that will allow for quality production. This will help create better financial conditions that will benefit him and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & fungicides

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a 31-year old teacher. His wife is a housewife and he is the family’s breadwinner. Together they have one child and they live in a rented house in Hoima, Uganda. Ronald wants to indulge more in business activities and is set to start a piggery farm and poultry farm because he would like in three years to be self-employed in his businesses. This is his second loan from HOFOKAM. He intends to use the loan funds to buy pigs for his piggery farm and to put some money into construction of his residential house, which is not yet complete.

Note:  Ronald is pictured with the son.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pay for construction of his house.

loans.name: Tas Efi Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the 'Tas Efi' group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are a group of petty traders who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member of the group in order to boost their businesses.

Ya Fatmata B. is the leader of this group of borrowers. Ya Fatmata who sells plastic bowls, dishes, and gara lappers (locally dyed cloth) is approximately 37 years old. She was born in Mangay Bana village, near Magburaka town. She is married to a businessman and they have four children. Ya Fatmata, who has been a businesswoman for many years now, will use her share of the loan to buy dozens of plastic bowls, dishes and gara lapper making materials – inks, caustic soda, powder and the white cotton (called 'brillian').

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy gara lapper making materials – inks, caustic soda, powder and the white cotton and dozens of plastic bowls, dishes, etc.

loans.name: Houénagnon

texts.fr: L. Houénagnon est né en 1950 et vit depuis 30 ans à Gbèdjromèdé, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Marié à TETE Avocèfohoun, une revendeuse, Houénagnon est père de cinq enfants dont seulement quelques uns sont scolarisés. Houénagnon n’a que deux enfants encore à sa charge. Houénagnon vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Houénagnon est secondé par sa femme pour assumer les charges familiales. En effet pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Houénagnon mène comme activité, la transformation et la vente de noix d’acajou à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est également à Dantokpa que Houénagnon effectue l’achat de ses produits. Cela fait bientôt dix ans que Houénagnon exerce son commerce mais n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. ALIDé a déjà accordé un prêt à Houénagnon, prêt qu’il a bien remboursé. Dans le souci d’étendre son activité et ne disposant pas d’assez de ressources financières pour y arriver, Houénagnon sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Houénagnon L. was born in 1950 and has lived for 30 years in Gbèdjromèdé, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. He is married to Avocèfohoun Tete, a merchant. He has five children, not all of whom went to school. He lives with his wife and the two children who are still at home. He and his wife share household expenses. His business consists of processing cashews and selling them at Dantokpa, the international ,market of Benin, which is also where he buys the product. He has been in this line of business for ten years. He never went to school. He has repaid one prior loan from ALIDé. He is asking for a second loan to grow his business without straining his financial resources.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cashews

loans.name: Juana Matilde

texts.es: Juana es de 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos 1 varón y 3 mujeres, con el apoyo del esposo han establecido una venta de costes típicos en la plaza de la localidad, es el tercer crédito que solicita en ASDIR los anteriores los pago sin problema, demostrando su responsabilidad, solicita nuevamente el financiamiento para ampliar el capital en mercadería.
texts.en:
Juana is 43 years old, married, and has four children (one son and three daughters). With the support of her husband, she established a vending post in the town square where she sells traditional skirts. This is the third loan she has requested from Asociación ASDIR. Her previous loans were repaid without any problems. Juana has demonstrated that she is responsible, so she is requesting a new loan to increase her capital for acquiring merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos Antonio vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de material de construcción. El socio tiene 24 años es un joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Carlos Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal. Su primer crédito del socio fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar una mezcladora. El anhelo del socio es abrir su propia  negocio de fabricación de ladrillos y bloquetas de cemento. 

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio lives in the city of Urubamba and has a small family business selling construction materials. He is 24 years of age and a responsible young man who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strive each day to help his family.

Carlos Antonio is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. It has already been a year that he has participated in the Communal Bank. His first loan as a member was for $100, which he used to invest in his business. He currently needs a loan to buy a cement mixer. His wish is to open his own business manufacturing bricks and cement blocks.

Carlos Antonio is grateful for this opportunity and commits to making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cement mixer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 34-year-old lady living in Hoima, Uganda. She is married with two children aged 9 and 7 years. She sells cereals and dry foods and has been in the business for five years. She says the business is good because from its gains, she has been able to build a house and educate her children. She would like to have more stores with business stock in order to be a large-scale supplier of cereals and dry foods. She was, at first, a pump attendant at a petrol station before she started the produce business. The purpose of the loan is to buy rice, maize and millet to resell.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize and millet

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Castellón OC.   es un señor de 36 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años Don Carlos  se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece,  en especial  La leche. Don  Carlos considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, el podrá construir su propia casa ya que aun vive en la de sus padres con su hija y esposa.

En estos momentos don Carlos desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y generar los ingresos necesarios para construir su propia casa. 

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Carlos Castellón OC. is a 36 years old gentleman who lives with his wife and child in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. The community is situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with specific emphasis on the cultivation of grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Don Carlos has been raising cattle for several years. He sells to the neighbors in his community who are very satisfied with quality of his products, especially the milk. Don Carlos is grateful for the progress of his business, which will allow him to build his own home. He is still living at his parents’ house with his wife and daughter. At the moment, Don Carlos wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 665,000 CRC so that he can buy grass seeds and maintain the corral where he keeps his cows. This will help him improve his business and generate the income he needs to build his own house. Don Carlos is a member of Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He assures us that this loan provides great motivation for him to work hard so that he can access future loans and become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grass seeds & pay for maintenance of a corral

loans.name: Kamaria Chiki

texts.fr: R. Kamaria Chiki est née le 03 décembre 1985 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a 25 ans que  Kamaria Chiki vit à Gbèdagba, un quartier de Cotonou. Kamaria Chiki est mariée à KAMAROU Bello, un agent de sécurité, et a des enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Kamaria Chiki vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Kamaria Chiki  mène comme activité principale la vente de divers produits (conserves de laits et de tomâtes, pâtes alimentaires, mayonnaises, couscous, savon etc.) et de façon secondaire elle vend des produits de mercerie. Kamaria Chiki achète ses produits à Dantakpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lagos, capitale économique du Nigéria, pays limitrophe du Bénin.  Kamaria Chiki vend ses produits à Sainte-Rita, un quartier de Cotonou. Kamaria Chiki n’a pas été à l’école mais exerce depuis un moment son activité.  Kamaria Chiki a obtenu un prêt chez ALIDé, prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Kamaria Chiki souhaite élever le niveau de son activité en vue d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire, C’est la raison pour laquelle elle désire bénéficier d’un deuxième prêt chez ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kamaria Chiki R. was born December 3 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived for 25 years in Gbèdagba, one of Cotonou's neighborhoods. She lives with her husband Bello Kamarou, a security officer, and their children, all of whom are in school. The couple shares household expenses. To help out her husband, Kamaria Chiki sells various products (condensed milk, tomato paste, pasta products,mayonnaise, couscous, soap, and so forth). As a sideline, she also sells sewing needs. She buys her products at Dantokpa, the international marketplace of Benin, and in Lagos, the capital of the neighboring country of Nigeria, and sells them in Sainte Rita, a Cotonou neighborhood. She has not been to school, but recently started her business. She has repaid a prior loan from ALIDé, and is asking for another to grow her business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase miscellaneous products (mayonnaise, pasta, couscous, soap, etc.).

loans.name: Carmen Leonor

texts.es: Carmen es de 34 años de edad, es soltera, labora como secretaria en un Instituto de Educación primaria, en sus ratos libres y los fines de semanas se dedica a vender productos de belleza, lo cual le ha ayudado a complementar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos, en ASDIR es el quinto crédito que solicita los anteriores los ha pagado puntualmente, necesita el financiamiento para surtir y aumentar su mercadería en productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old, single, and works as a secretary at an elementary school. In her free time and on the weekends, she sells beauty products. This has helped to supplement her income for covering her expenses. She is requesting her fifth loan from Asociación ASDIR and has repaid her previous loans on time. Carmen needs the money to restock and increase her inventory of beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 46 years old. He is married with five children aged between 3 and 18 years old. Evariste's wife is a farmer. Both of them work for the development of their family. Evariste is a serious man in his business and works hard to gain more interest from his business. Normally Evariste sells different kinds of products such as plastic shoes, soaps, other cosmetic products and so forth. This is his second successful year in business. His small shop is open from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day.

Evariste is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more products. This loan will be important for him because he will be able to attract more customers by satisfying their demands. With this loan, Evariste believes he will obtain more profit, which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Diène est une femme   dynamique agee de 60 ans qui habite dans la localité de Yoff  plus précisément  dans le quartier de Mbenguene. Elle est mariée  et mère  de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 30 et 42 ans.  Elle était employée  à la conserverie de Dakar. Lorsqu’elle a pris sa retraite elle s’est lancée  dans le commerce et la vente de denrées  alimentaires.  Elle a choisi cette activité dans le but d’épauler  son mari dans les charges familiales. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la réalisation des bénéfices que lui procure cette activité. Elle avait arrêté  son activiste depuis un an pour des raisons de sante. Maintenant qu’elle s’est rétablie elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs pour relancer son commerce et acheter des thioubs et des denrees alimentaires. Le crédit lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diène is a dynamic 60-year-old woman who lives in the town of Yoff, and more precisely in its Mbenguene borough. She is married and mother of five children whose ages vary from 30 to 42 years. She used to be an employee at the cannery in Dakar. When she retired she launched herself into commercial activities and the retailing of food products. She chose this line of business to help her husband deal with family expenditures. What attracted her most in this activity were the profit-making aspects. She interrupted all activity for a year due to health problems. Now that she is recovered she is requesting a loan for 300,000 FCFA to restart her business and buy thioubs (dyed pieces of cotton fabric) and food products. The loan will enable her to improve her social situation.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase turnover

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, en el distrito de José Leonoardo Ortiz, limita con la ciudad de Chiclayo, es considerado el distrito más poblado de la región Lambayeque, pero también el que presenta más índices de pobreza, generalmente su población se encuentra ubicada en “pueblos jóvenes” (zonas urbano marginales). 

Desde hace 03 años se dedica a la venta de diarios recorriendo las calles del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz (donde reside) y Chiclayo, además suele ir a lugares con bastante concurrencia de personas, como terminales de transportes y mercados. Cliente también tiene un pequeño exhibidor en su casa donde su mamá le ayuda a vender. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos economicos con la que cuenta por lo que da todo de sí para sacarlo adelante.

La demanda por los diarios que ofrece ha aumentado, sobretodo porque los diarios ofrecen diversos suplementos que son de utilidad para su público objetivo. Luis se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de suplementos de diarios, como son libros, CDs, revistas, etc., que las personas suelen pedirle pero que no puede atender por falta de capital. 

Luis es un joven trabajador y con muchas ganas de progresar. Sus familiares y conocidos lo estiman mucho y lo consideran una persona responsable y servicial.
texts.en:
Luis is 25 years old, single, and lives in the home of his parents in the District of José Leonardo Ortiz, which borders the city of Chiclayo. It is considered to be the most populated district in Lambayeque Region, but it also has the highest poverty index, generally among those living in “pueblos jóvenes” (the marginal urban areas).

For the past three years, Luis has been selling newspapers around the streets of the District of José Leonardo Ortiz (where he lives) and in Chiclayo. He tends to go to places that are busy, such as bus terminals and markets. Luis also has a small newsstand at his house where his mother helps with the sales. This business is his only source of income, so he gives everything he has in order to succeed.

The demand for newspapers has increased because they provide enjoyment to his target audience. Luis is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can invest in the purchase of items to supplement the newspapers such as books, CDs, magazines, and other products that people often ask for but he hasn’t been able to provide due to a lack of capital.

Luis is a young worker who is eager to make progress. His relatives and acquaintances respect him greatly and consider him to be a responsible and helpful person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to add to his inventory of newspapers

loans.name: Rechael

texts.en: Rechael is a hardworking tailor. At 30 years of age, she is married and has three children. She was previously selling vehicle spare parts.  Rechael also earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. She took up tailoring after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya and she mainly makes table cloths for sale. She wants to buy two sewing machines and fabric. So, she has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to own her own company in the future so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and fabric.

loans.name: Venuste

texts.en:
Venuste is 44 years old and married with seven children between the ages of 8 and 20. Venuste has been a businessman for 12 years. Venuste’s wife does not work. She is a housewife. Venuste owns a small shop selling different kinds of products such as soaps, cosmetic products, water and so on. This business is profitable in this region, which is why Venuste chose it as his principal work. The hours of his shop are from 6 in the morning to 5 in the evening, every day except Saturday.


Venuste is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products. With this expansion, Venuste will be able to employ his wife so that she becomes productive in their family. Venuste’s target is to improve his family's economy as well as his community's by creating jobs for them.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Arcecio Andres

texts.es:
Arcecio C. de 37 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa le ayuda en el taller de costuras ellos tienen tres hijos. 

Arcecio aprendió a coser en una fabrica de costura coreana, pero desde pequeño el se trazo como meta tener su propio negocio y aprovecho los conocimientos aprendidos en la fabrica para poner su taller de costura. Arcecio presto una maquina de coser a un familiar y hay empezó su negocio. 

En la actualidad tiene dos maquinas de coser y una gran producción de ropa y mochilas que reparte en la bahía de Guayaquil (lugar donde vende mercadería los comerciantes informales). Trabaja en conjunto con su esposa todos los días. El taller de costura es el sustento principal de toda su familia. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar otra una maquina de coser, telas y sierres para su negocio. En el futuro quiere adecuar el patio de su casa para su taller y comprar mas maquinas.
texts.en:
Arecio C. is 37, and he lives in a development called Paraíso de Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and the only basic services he has are electricity and water. His wife helps him in the clothing workshop. They have three children. Arecio learned to sew in a Korean clothing factory, but since he was little, his goal was to have his own business. He took advantage of what he learned in the factory to set up his own clothing shop. He lent a sewing machine to a relative and that’s how the business began. Currently he has two sewing machines and they produce a lot of clothing and backpacks that are sold in the Bahia de Guayaquil (the place where merchandise is sold informally, not in stores). He works together with his wife every day. The clothing shop is the main source of income for the family. With the loan he wants to buy another sewing machine, fabric, and zippers for his business. In the future he would like to adapt the patio of his house for a workshop and to buy more sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sewing machine, fabric, zippers

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent was born in 1969. He is married with six children between 8 and 15 years old. Innocent has a business supplying water in his region. This business is very profitable simply because his community needs this service a lot. Innocent employs six people in his business as helpers. Innocent is a young entrepreneur. He has three years of experience supplying water. The hours of his service are from 5 in the morning to 6 in the evening, every day except Saturday and Sunday.

Innocent is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to be a good supplier by purchasing some equipment used to supply water, like a tank that can be used to keep a lot of water. With this equipment, Innocent will be able to serve more customers at a time, which in turn, will allow him to obtain more profit.

loans.use: To buy a tank for water

loans.name: El Maodo Malick

texts.fr: Monsieur Maodo M. est un jeune pâtissier  de 23 ans qui habite dans la localité de yoff Dagoudane. Il est membre de l’institution depuis janvier 2010. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est après  avoir arrêté ses études qu’il s’est lance dans l’activité de pâtissier. Il a une activité diversifiée car il fait aussi de l’aviculture. Il capitalise une expérience  de 2 ans dans la pâtisserie.  Monsieur M. a choisi cette activiste par l’intermédiaire de ‘un de ses amis dont la mère  gérait un service traiteur. Les meilleurs moments qui lui procurent plus de bénéfices  sont les weekends  et les périodes d’événements  heureux.Il sollicite  un crédit de 500 000 frs pour acheter des poussins, de l’aliment, des vaccins et des vitamines. Ce crédit lui permettra d’avoir plus d’autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Mr. Maodo M. is a 23-year-old pastry-maker, living in the town of Yoff Dagoudane. He has been a member of the micro-finance institution since January 2010. He is unmarried without children. He embraced the pastry business after interrupting his studies. His activities are diversified as he also raises chickens. He has now accumulated two years’ experience in pastry-making. Mr. M. chose this activity influenced by a friend whose mother managed a deli business. The times of most profit to him are weekends and family festivities. He is requesting a loan for 500,000 francs to buy chicks, chicken feed, vaccines and vitamins. This loan will give him more financial autonomy.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase working capital

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 38-year-old married man who has four children in school. He earns a living by renting out his houses and selling water. Besides these businesses, he is employed and also earns extra income from farming. He has been a member of Faulu Kenya and had previously taken out a loan of KES 20,000, which he used to start his water distribution business. He hopes to open up many other water points in his residential area. He has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to install water for sale in his rental houses. He sees himself having his own borehole to enable him to distribute water more efficiently in the future.

loans.use: To install water for sale.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Appoline Afiavi

texts.fr: G. Appoline Afiavi est née le 08 Février 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Appoline Afiavi réside au quartier Agontinkon à Cotonou depuis 28 ans environs. Appoline Afiavi est mariée et a trois enfants à sa charge, tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Appoline Afiavi a très peu fréquenté. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Appoline Afiavi vend du charbon de bois à son domicile et au marché de Wologuèdè à Cotonou. Parallèlement à cette activité, Appoline Afiavi vend des calebasses. Appoline Afiavi se ravitaille à Djidja au Bénin. C'est la première fois que Appoline Afiavi sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, prêt qui lui servira à reconstituer le stock de ses produits et à mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Appoline Afiavi G. was born 6 February 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has lived in the Agontinkon borough of Cotonou for the past 28 years. She is married and has three children to care for, all having attended (or still attending) school. The couple jointly shares family expenses. Appoline Afiavi had very little schooling. To meet her diverse needs, she sells charcoal from her home and at the Wologuèdè market in Cotonou. As a second activity, she also sells gourds. Her supplies come from Djidja in Benin. This is Appoline Afiavi’s first loan request from ALIDé, which will serve to replenish her stock supply and give better response to customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fredick

texts.en: Fredrick is 37 years old, with one child who goes to school. He has been running a tailoring shop for five years to earn a living. He also runs a salon to earn enough money to pay for his family’s expenses and to educate his child. He hopes to buy more sewing machines to expand his business. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy an overlock machine, fabric, threads, linings and pins.

loans.use: To  buy overlock machine, fabric, threads, cloth linings and pins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jotham

texts.en:
Jotham was born in 1975 and remains a bachelor. Jotham owns a small business selling beans. He says that this business is profitable in his region because they are foodstuffs that each family in Rwanda uses. Jotham works hard in order to improve his economy. The hours of his business are from 7 in the morning to 3 in the evening, everyday except Sunday.  Jotham is so young in this field. He has one year of experience.


Jotham is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more beans and other foodstuffs, which can help him attract more customers.  This attraction will allow him to sell a large quantity, which is a way to earn more profit. Once the profits accumulate very fast the way Jotham wants, he will try to save money to build or buy his own house. In fact, Jotham needs to get married as long as his target will be reached.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been running a tailoring shop for five years to earn a living. His wife also does tailoring business and, together, they are able to support their family. Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, his business has really grown since he can access loans.  He hopes to stabilize his income and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moussa Maurice

texts.fr: Monsieur Moussa Maurice S. est un yoffois de 30 ans qui loge dans le quartier de Dagoudane. Il est societaire de la caisse depuis novembre 2009. Il est marie et père d’un enfant de 4 ans. Monsieur S. évolue  dans le secteur du carrelage mais aussi en même  temps dans  l’élevage  avicole. Il a une expérience de plus d’un an dans l’aviculture, activite qu’il a choisi par passion. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans l’activité c’est le fait de satisfaire la clientèle et la réalisation de bénéfices. Il emprunte un montant de 350 000 frs en vue d’acheter des poussins et des sacs d’aliment. Ce crédit pourra lui permettre de mieux gérer l’entretien de sa femme et de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Maurice S. is a 30-year old man from Yoff who lives in the Dagoudane district. He has been a shareholder-member of the savings bank since November 2009. He is married and father to a four-year old child. Mr. S. is developing an activity in the tiling business and at the same time in the poultry farming business. He has more than a year's experience in poultry farming, an activity which he chose out of passion. He is most interested by the satisfaction he affords his customers in this business and by the money he makes. He is borrowing 350,000 francs with a view to buying chickens and bags of food for tehm. This loan will allow him to take better care of his wife and children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Onesme

texts.en:
Onesme is 40 years old and married with six children between 3 and 14 years old. Onesme is a motorbike driver. This business of transportation is very profitable for him. Onesme has been in this service since last year. He is very young in this field but he gains more profits from his business. The hours of his business are from 5 AM to 9 PM every day, even during the weekend.

Onesme is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to replace his old motorbike with a new one. This new motorbike will help him to attract more customers simply because normally the clients choose the one who has the new motorbike. With this loan, Onesme expects to earn more profits from his transportation service.

loans.use: To buy a the new motorbike

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Née en 1973, H. Pascaline est mariée à KAKPO Sylvain, un couturier. Le couple a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a environs trois ans que la famille s'est installée au quartier Dodomey à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Pascaline apporte une aide financière à son mari et partage avec lui les charges de la famille. Pour y arriver, Pascaline mène comme activité la vente de volaille à Allada. De façon secondaire, Pascaline vend des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières et bols en séries) à Allada. Pascaline s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et aussi à Allada. Pascaline exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé. Pascaline a bien remboursés lesdits crédits. En vue de rehausser son activité et d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire, Pascaline sollicite un troisième crédit ; ce qui lui permettra d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Born in 1973, Pascaline H. is married to Sylvain KAKPO, a couturier. The couple has four children who are all at school. Around three years ago the family settled in the Dodomey district of Allada, in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique. Pascaline helps out her husband financially and they share responsibility for the family expenses. In order to do this, Pascaline has an activity selling poultry at Allada. As a secondary activity she sells kitchenware (ice-boxes and sets of bowls) in Allada. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, and also in Allada. Pascaline has been carrying out this business for around ten years and has already had two loans from ALIDé. She repaid both these loans without incident. In order to increase her business and her turnover she is applying for a third loan which will allow her to enhance her income.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of poultry

loans.name: Sylverien

texts.en:
Sylverien is 37 years old and married with three children between 2 and 12 years of age. Sylverien is a motorbike driver. He offers the service of transportation in his region. Sylverien’s wife right now is a housewife. The hours of his work are from 5 in the morning to 10 in the evening every day, except on Saturday. Sylverien has been in this business for three years.

Sylverien is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to improve his family's economy through creating another business of selling shoes. This new business will be operated by Sylverien’s wife in order to help her to contribute to their family. This loan will be fruitful in this family simply because both will work hard for family and community.

loans.use: To start a business selling shows

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a 29 year old lady, married, and has a four year old daughter.  She has been selling clothes and hair products for two years. She was previously working in a hotel. Her husband is employed as a driver in a security firm. She has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes, shoes and bags to sell. She hopes to have her own house in the future. She dreams of owning rental houses, a taxi van and a series of shops.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and bags.

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie was born in 1979. She is married with two children. The first-born child is seven years old and the last is three years old. Pascasie owns a small business selling green potatoes in the Musanze market. In the picture of Pascasie, you will find someone appearing behind her. That is a buyer of her green potatoes. Pascasie’s business is well organized. She employs one person as a helper so that her business runs well. This business has been chosen by her to serve her neighbors who are the first consumers of those kinds of products. 

Pascasie is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by adding new products such as rice, salt, sugar and other foodstuffs needed by her customers. This loan will allow her to attract new clients, which in turn will help her to obtain more profits. With the extra money, Pascasie will try to save money for the future

loans.use: To buy new products

loans.name: Niagna Ndiaye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Niagna Ndiaye N. est une demoiselle de 28 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou à Yoff et évolue dans le secteur de la coiffure depuis 10 ans. Elle gère un salon de coiffure non loin de chez elle. Parallèlement  elle fait le commerce de produits de beauté. Elle a choisi l’activité  de coiffure par passion dans l’objectif de gagner sa vie et d’éviter la dépendance. Ses moments préférés sont les week end et les périodes  de fête car ce sont les moments d’affluence. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner son salon de  coiffure. Ce crédit lui permettra d’embellir le salon et d’attirer d’avantage la clientèle.  Ceci est un moyen d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Niagna Ndiaye N. is a young lady of 28 years of age, who lives in the neighborhood of Ngaparou in Yoff and has worked as haidresser for 10 years. She runs a hair salon near her home. Besides, she is also in the cosmetics business. She chose to be hairdresser out of passion and also to earn her living and avoid dependency. Her favorite time is the weekend as well as the holiday season, as these are the peak times. She is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs in order to refurbish her salon. This loan will allow her to improve the facility and attract more customers. In this way she hopes to increase her revenue.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha was born in 1973 and is married with 8 children aged between 4 and 16. Liberatha’s husband is a farmer; in fact, however, this activity is not fruitful in her region so Liberatha decided to be a businesswoman in order to help her husband to provide the necessities for their family.  The family works hard, especially Liberatha who is in the business of selling different products such as: water, juice, totes, cosmetic products, and so on. Liberatha is a young entrepreneur. This is her second year of being successful in her business.

Liberatha is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more products for her shop. This loan will help her to obtain more profits from her sales. With extra profits Liberatha hopes her earnings will be important in her life and for her family; she expects to pay school fees for her children and save money for the future.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua N. is a happily married woman with five dependents. She has no formal educational background. She sells dough-nuts at Jukwa market, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a driver. Ekua uses her income to help her husband in taking care of the needs of her children and other needs that may arise. Ekua will use the loan she will be getting to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make dough-nuts in larger quantities, to be able to meet the demands of her customers. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to give a better education to her children.

loans.use: Ekua will use the loan she will be getting to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients to make dough-nuts in larger quantity.

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is 24 years old and married with one child.  Jonas is known for the business of selling a variety of goods in his shop.  Those goods include body lotion, cooking oil, cylinders, watches, batteries, etc.  This is his third successful year in this business, and he is open from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Jonas is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can expand his business through adding foodstuffs to his shop, as they are highly demanded.  Those foodstuffs include rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans etc.  With these additional goods for sale, Jonas hopes to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to create some other sources of income by reinvesting some of his profits.  In doing so, he will be able to create jobs for the people from his community.

loans.use: The purchase of rice, sugar, Irish potatoes, beans etc.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia N. is single and has received senior high education. Afia bakes bread and sells fried fish at Jukwa. Afia, at the time of our visit, had already dispatched the bread she had baked to her sellers and is shown standing by her fish to sell. She uses her income to pay for her rent and other expenses. Afia will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake, and boxes of fish to fry for sale. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to build a house of her own.

loans.use: Afia will add the loan to her initial capital to purchase bags of flour, sugar and other ingredients to bake, and boxes of fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Mukisa Women's Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
With hand raised in the group photo is N. Teddy, a 48-year-old married mother of eight kids who also takes care of two orphans.

Teddy operates a bar in Namataba, Lugazi, infamously known for its sale of that highly favored delicacy. Though frowned upon as an unorthodox means of earning a living by some sections of society, it is a roaring business that brings in good profits - that’s if you are taking the example of Teddy.

Teddy also sells pork to her customers which goes hand-in-hand with the beers they buy. She has been running this business for the last eight years and she cites the scarcity of pigs as a major inconvenience for her business. On a weekly basis, she makes 30,000 shillings and 50,000 shillings respectively from her businesses.

The reputation of Teddy’s business has also largely been enhanced by her hygienic operating environment. With this loan she wants to purchase more stock for her growing business.

loans.use: To buy more beers and pigs for her business expansion

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga es de 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija, se dedica a la compra venta de delantales típicos en la localidad, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita, el anterior lo pago bien, el financiamiento lo necesita para ampliar su capital de trabajo lo invertirá en la compra de mas delantales para surtir su venta y ganar más clientes, con la ayuda de su esposos pagaran el préstamo.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and married with one daughter. She sells traditional aprons in the market. This is her second loan from ASDIR. She paid off her previous loan without any problems. She needs the financing to increase her working capital, which she will use to buy more aprons to supply her business and gain more clients. She will pay off the loan with her husband's help.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Angie Katherine

texts.es:
Angie Katherine V. Ramírez, tiene 19 años y vive en el barrio Gualí de Bogotá,  la capital de Colombia. Angie tiene un gran sentido ecológico y quiere generar una cultura de protección medioambiental, por eso se dedica a la elaboración de bolsos y bolsas en un material biodegradable llamado Cambrell y con ello no solo produce y genera sus propios ingresos, sino que también genera ingresos a mujeres cabezas de familia que constituyen la mano de obra de este producto. Es la primera vez que recibe crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando a un monto de $1.000.000 para invertirlo en telas como yute, Cambrell y tambien para pagar la mano de obra de una preventa, porque ya tiene su tarea productiva programada con las mujeres que participarán en la elaboración de bolsos y bolsas.  

Su gran sueño es generar una mentalidad medioambiental y disminuir el consumo de bolsas plásticas  en los supermercados y amas de casa especialmente; su mayor desafió es lograr que su  empresa de nombre Organika M & E, crezca y sea reconocida a nivel local, nacional e internacional. Justamente por eso desde muy joven se dedica a esta tarea en su negocio donde tiene su propio empleo. Angie es una joven emprendedora y está muy contenta con el barrio donde vive, porque dice que tiene un entorno ecológico, rodeado de zonas verdes y lo habita  gente trabajadora y honesta por eso  es que sus áreas comunes son muy seguras.
texts.en:
Angie Katherine V. Ramírez is 19 years old and lives in the Gualí neighborhood of Bogotá, the capital of Colombia. Angie is very environmentally conscious and she wants to work towards a culture of environmental protection. That's why she works making bags of various types out of a biodegradable material called Cambrell. With this business she not only produces and generates earnings for herself; she also generates earnings for the group of single mothers who work making the final products. This is the first time she has taken out a loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [the Kiva field partner] and she is asking for 1,000,000 Colombian pesos to invest in fibers such as jute and Cambrell. She also needs to pay for extra labor to work on an special order, because she already has her regular production planned out with the women who work making the bags. Angie's greatest dream is to create a mentality of environmental consciousness and to reduce the use of plastic bags in supermarkets and among housewives in particular. Her challenge is to see her business, called Organika M & E, grow and be recognized locally, nationally and then internationally level. This is why she has started out with her own business at such a young age. Angie is very enterprising and is happy with the neighborhood she lives in. She says the neighborhood has an ecologically conscious feel, as it is surrounded by green space and inhabited by honest and hard-working people. This is why the public spaces where she lives are so safe.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in fibers such as jute and Cambrell and pay for the labor on a special order

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: M. Cathérine a 50 ans et elle vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à AITCHEDJI Henri un enseignant, Cathérine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Seulement, un des enfants n'est plus à la charge de Cathérine et de son mari. La famille vit ensemble à Allada. Le couple supporte les différentes charges de la famille. Il y a deux ans que Cathérine a commencé la vente de sucre en poudre et d'oeufs à Allada. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l'aidant à se prendre en charge et à assurer les besoins de ses enfants. C'est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et à Allada que Cathérine fait ses provisions. Cathérine a déjà obtenu deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Cathérine souhaite élever le niveau de son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de beaucoup plus s'impliquer dans les dépenses familiales. Pour y parvenir, Cathérine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Catherine M. is 50 years old and for the past 20 years has lived in the Dogoudo borough of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. Married to Henri AITCHEDJI, a teacher, she is the mother of three children, all having attended (or still attending) school. One of the children is no longer dependant on Catherine and her husband. The family lives together in Allada, and the couple shares the various family expenses. Two years ago Catherine started selling powdered sugar and eggs in Allada. The activity provides income to help her take charge of her own needs and meet those of her children. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and in Allada. Catherine has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. She wishes to increase the level of her activity to better satisfy her customers and become more involved in family expenditures. To reach that goal she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 12 egg trays and 3 bags of powdered sugar

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina S. is involved in the sale of varieties of cloth at Jukwa market. She sells by moving from one person to another. Augustina has received junior high education. Her husband also sells soft drinks. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation and utility bills. Her loan, which will serve as  additional capital, will be used to buy a shop to sell her goods in at Jukwa market. She hopes to use the new income she may get as a result of the loan, to save to buy more cloths to fill the shop that she hopes to buy.

loans.use: Her loan, which will serve as an additional capital, will be used to buy a shop in which to sell her goods.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar C. L. tiene 57 años y vive en el barrio Nuevo Chile de Bogotá, donde tiene una tienda en la cual comercializa víveres; este hombre casado y con cinco hijos está solicitando un crédito por valor de $1.000.000 para comprar mercancías como dulces y víveres en general y venderlos en su tienda ubicada en su propia casa. Desde hace dos años que se vinculó al proyecto Raíces Nuevas, convenio realizado con la Unión Europea, la Secretaría  de Gobierno distrital, la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y el SENA, que generó alternativas emprendedoras   a desplazados ubicados en sectores marginales de Bogotá y   a través del fondo rotatorio de este programa, Edgar pudo acceder a crédito  y hacer real su emprendimiento.
Con su primer crédito pudo comprar canastas de refrescos, que lo ayudaron a aumentar sus ingresos y dirigirlos al bienestar de su familia, que aunque fueron  desplazados de una población del Tolima hace 6 años, lograron con mucho esfuerzo, iniciar su nueva vida en Bogotá la capital de Colombia, pero han conseguido muchas amistades, pues en  el sector donde viven es usual  que se realicen eventos de integración como campeonatos de futbol entre diversos sectores y esto ha ayudado a mucho a el ya su familia.

loans.use: comprar mercancías como dulces y víveres en general

loans.name: Gerardo Porfirio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo Porfirio C. C., se dedica a los trabajos de  campos desde hace más de 35 años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de agua en el verano   y en algunas ocasiones el mal invierno, él  inicio con el apoyo de otros agricultores, los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder  hacer trabajos de conservación de suelo, para mejorar  la   producción y venderla a  un mejor precio,  el habita en el municipio de Nindiri , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los ingresos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos de 25,18,15 todos varones los mayores ya son independientes; el menor estudia su secundaria , los planes hacia su familia es poder  brindares una mejores condiciones de vida . Agradece a los fondos Kiva ya que a través de Afodenic, recibe el financiamiento para la comprar de insumos y fertilizantes para la aplicación de dicho cultivo.
texts.en:
