Mr. Gerardo Porfirio C. C. has done farm work for more than 35 years. His greatest difficulty is the lack of water in the summer and the occasional bad winter. He started wiht the support of other agricultural workers. His future plan for his crop is to be able to do soil conservation work to improve production and be able to sell at a better price. He lives in the town of Nindiri with his wife who helps with the expenses of the home. They have three children who are 25, 18, and 15 years old, all are male, and the older two live on their own and the youngest studies in high school. His plans for his family are to provide them with a better quality of life. He is thankful for the Kiva loans, as Afodenic has provided the loan money to buy fertilizers for his current crop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, H. Sogbossi vit depuis 20 ans au quartier Gbégamey à Allada. Mariée à MINANKPE Antoine un chauffeur, Sogbossi est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Sogbossi vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Sogbossi n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sogbossi prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagnée de diverses sauces) à Allada. C’est également à Allada que Sogbossi fait ses approvisionnements. Sogbossi exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sogbossi désire augmenter sa production et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. Pour cette raison, Sogbossi sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Allada in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique, Sogbossi has lived for the past 20 years in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Allada. Married to Antoine MINANKPE, a driver, Sogbossi is mother to five children, all at school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple share responsibility for the family expenses. Sogbossi never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she prepares and sells food (rice accompanied by various sauces) in Allada. She also gets her supplies in Allada. She has been carrying out this activity for three years and has already had two loans from ALIDé, both of which she repaid without incident. In the face of increasing demand from her customers, Sogbossi would like to increase her production and be able to satisfy better this demand. For this reason she is applying for a third loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of rice, a can of oil and condiments for sauces

loans.name: Guadalupe Socorro

texts.es: Guadalupe es de 26 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija, en ASDIR es el segundo crédito que solicita pagando bien el primero, se dedica a tejer cortes típicos de la localidad, solicita nuevamente el préstamo para ampliar su capital en materiales, esto le ayuda a mejorar sus ventas. Los pagos lo realizaran con el apoyo del esposo.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 26 years old. She is married and has a daughter. This is the second loan she has applied for at ASDIR, having paid off the first one well. She weaves typical fabrics of her area. She is applying for a loan again to increase her capital materials. This will help her increase her sales. She will make the payments with the support of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials

loans.name: Good Hope Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
S. Vincent, shown in the photo with his hand raised, is the leader of his lending group. He is a hardworking 24-year-old married man with three kids.

Vincent is into the transportation business with a boda-boda (a motorcycle fitted with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel) as his only viable means of providing for his children’s welfare. He has a pedigree of five years in this business.

Vincent wants a loan to be able to fund his new blueprint project of rearing pigs. With this loan he also hopes to add to his savings buy a new motorcycle to diversify the boda-boda business that he runs in Lugazi town.

Since he began, Vincent has been making 100,000 shillings weekly. That is a much bigger amount than the peanuts he was making when he was still a fishmonger.

loans.use: To renovate his pigsty for better output and to top up on his savings to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama W. is married and has five dependents. She has received a senior high education. Ama sells salt by moving from house to house and customer to customer in and around Jukwa. She has been selling salt for quite some time now. Ama uses the income she generates from her selling of salt to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  

Ama will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell in her already built shop, which is in addition to her salt business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell in her already built shop

loans.name: Alejandra Isabeth

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra Isabeth Z. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como secretaria, es casada tiene un hijo,  habita en el barrio Roberto González.

La señora Alejandra Isabeth Z. solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda en conjunto con su esposo para asegurar lo más pronto posible, ya que su esposo es transportista pero trabaja por cuenta propia.
texts.en:
Alejandra Isabeth Z. works as a secretary for the municipality of Chinandega. She is married and has one child. She lives in the Roberto González neighborhood. Alejandra Isabeth Z. is requesting a loan to improve her home together with her husband, so that they can get this work done as quickly as possible. Her husband works as a transport driver, but he is self-employed.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roger Antonio L. A., es un pequeño agricultor de la zona rural de la Concepción , tiene la edad de 43 años , desde hace 21 años se dedica a cultivo de piña , la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el humo del volcán, que le afecta enormemente el cultivo , el cual necesita financiamiento para poder comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mantener un cultivo sano de plagas y otros factores que afectan al mismo, él inicio esta actividad agrícola gracias al apoyo de su esposa y suegros que le apoyaron con las tierras , Don Roger ha luchado junto a su esposa que labora como costurera, para sacar hacia adelante sus tres hijos que actualmente estudian; los planes hacia su familia, es poder darle una educación mejor y apoyarlos siempre. A la vez sus sueño es, que algún día obtenga la capacidad para poder cultivar las diversas especies de piña.
texts.en:
Señor Roger Antonio L. A. is a small farmer in the rural zone of Concepción. He is 43 years old. For 21 years he has grown pineapples. The greatest problem he has is smoke from the volcano, which affects the crop enormously. He needs financing to be able to buy fertilizers and supplies necessary to maintain a crop free from pests and other factors that can affect it. He began this agricultural activity thanks to the support of his wife and in-laws, who helped him with the land. Don Roger has struggled together with his wife, who works as a seamstress, to advance their three children, who are now in school. His plan for his family is to be able to give them a better education and always help them. At the same time, his dream is that one day he will have the means to be able to grow difference species of pineapple.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Álvaro José

texts.es:
El señor Álvaro José M. es trabajador de Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operario de Limpieza, es acompañado,  tiene un hijo y solicito el crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

El señor Álvaro José M. lleva ya 7 años trabajando con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Álvaro José M. works as a cleaner for the municipality of Chinandega. He has a live-in partner and one child. He is requesting this loan in order to improve the family's living conditions. Álvaro José M. has had previous loans with Ceprodel during the past 7 years, and he has shown himself to be a hard-working person who is very responsible with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, nails and zinc sheets

loans.name: Arlen Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Arlen D. Sánchez, es casada tiene dos hijos menores de edad vive detrás de Camanica, ella trabaja atendiendo un Bar de Una Escuela Ubicada en su misma comarca.

La señora Arlen solicito el crédito para asegurar mejor su casa ya que sus paredes son de zinc, y lo tiene bien deteriorado para asegurarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos, lleva dos años trabajando con Ceprodel y ha demostrado ser muy responsable y una mujer muy emprendedora.
texts.en:
Arlen D. Sánchez is married and has two dependent children. She lives outside of Camanica and works at a snack bar in a school located in the same area. Arlen is requesting this loan in order to improve her home, which has walls made of zinc sheets and has deteriorated greatly. She wants to renovate it in order to provide better living conditions for her children. She has been a client of Ceprodel for two years, and she has shown herself to be a very enterprising and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying zinc, nails and wood

loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: D. Geneviève est née en 1980 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique. Cela fait bientôt 12 ans que Geneviève vit à Sékou, à Allada. Mariée à D. Rigobert, un extracteur de vin de palme, Geneviève est mère de cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Geneviève a encore trois autres enfants à sa charge.  Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Geneviève seconde son mari pour assurer les charges de la famille. En effet, pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, Geneviève exerce comme activité principale la production et vente de l’huile de palme. De manière secondaire, Geneviève vend également du « Sodabi », une boisson locale. Geneviève commercialise et fabrique ses produits non loin de son domicile. N’ayant jamais fréquenté l’école, Geneviève exerce son activité depuis bientôt six ans. En tant que cliente fidèle de ALIDé, Geneviève a déjà obtenu deux prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés. Geneviève envisage obtenir un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour assurer un bon fonctionnement de son activité et par la même occasion augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
D. Genevieve was born in 1980 in Allada in the Atlantic district. It's almost 12 years since Genevieve has been living in Sekou, in Allada. Married to D. Rigobert, a palm wine tapper, Genevieve is the mother of 5 children who are all in school. Genevieve has 3 more other children at her care. The couple lives together with their children. Genevieve supports her husband to take care of family expenses. Infact, to contribute to family expenses, Genevieve engages in the production and in the sale of palm oil as her major trade. She sells equally Sodabi, a local drink, as a secondary business. She sells and makes her products not far from her home. Never ever attended school, Genevieve has been doing this trade for almost 6 years. Being a faithful customer of ALIDe, Genevieve already had two loans that she repaid. Genevieve intends to get a third loan from ALIDe in order to insure the smooth running of her business and also to increase her turn over.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 5 basins of palm nuts and 50 liters of Sodabi

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
La señora Flor de María D. S. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Colectora de Impuestos, es soltera habita en el barrio Ayapal.

La señora Flor de María D. S. solicito el crédito para cubrir gastos de su matrícula en su Universidad ya está estudiando contabilidad pública y para comprar materiales de estudios.
texts.en:
Flor de María D. S. works for the Chinandega town hall as a tax collecter. She is single and lives in the Ayapal neighborhood. She is requesting a loan to cover her university tuition and course materials, since she is enrolled and is studying public accounting.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay university tuition and for school supplies

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: La señora Alma Nubia C., habita en las Pilas Orientales, Ubicado en Masaya, junto a esposo, él cual labora como Albañil, ellos tienes cuatro hijos dos de ellos ya independientes y  los menores estudian por la mañana,  y por las tardes le apoyan con los trabajos de campo, doña Alma desde hace siete años, se dedica al cultivo de yuca, y la mayor necesidad es la falta de recursos económicos para poder adquirir toda la madera, esa madera despues se reproducira en yuca, por otra parte se ve afectada por la escases de agua ya que es una zona muy alejada de la cuidad. Los planes hacia un futuro hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida  y reconstruir su vivienda para tener más privacidad.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia C. lives in Pilas Orientales, Masaya, with her husband, who is a bricklayer. They have four children, two of whom are independent and two still in school during the morning. In the afternoons, they help Alma with her farm chores; she has farmed manioc for the last 7 years. Her biggest concern is the lack of financial resources to buy wood which will later become manioc. On the other hand, she is also affected by water shortages because she lives very far from the city. Her plans for the future are to improve her family’s standard of living and to remodel her house in order to have more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: He’s 24 years old and married, and he passed the primary level of education. He will use this loan to purchase two barber rotation chairs and new equipment like scissors, shaving machines and hair dryers. He will hire a new employee after taking this loan and thinks he can attract more clients. He expects that his income will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing barber rotation chair, hair dryer

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Héctor Manuel B. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante y habita en el barrio  la Florida.

El señor Héctor B. es casado y su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía es operaria de limpieza,  ambos luchan para mantener su familia en las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Hector works as a security guard in the Chichadega city hall and lives in the Florida neighborhood. He is married and his wife also works as a cleaning lady for the city hall. They both struggle to provide the best possible conditions for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio A. M., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como fontanero, es casado y habita en el barrio Luis Anduray.

El señor José Antonio A., solicito el crédito para mejorar su casa ya que con los crédito anteriores la ha ido remodelando poco a poco, pero el techo no lo tienen completo y desea cambiarlo antes que llegue el invierno, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad.
texts.en:
José works as a plumber in the Chinandega city hall. He is married and lives in the Luis Anduray neighborhood. He is asking for this loan in order to make improvements to his home, as he has been doing little by little. The roof has not been completed and he would like to finish it before winter. He has three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha Cecilia Díaz tiene 44 años, está separada y es madre de tres hijos de 21, 15 y 13 años. Vive en el barrio Compartir La Margarita en el suroccidente de Bogotá, cerca del Portal de las Américas, estación terminal del TransMilenio, concepto bogotano de transporte que combina aspectos de los sistemas de metro con los de bus y significa que uno puede desplazarse rápido a otras partes de la ciudad. En este barrio tiene su negocio de producción y comercialización de dotaciones llamado “Dotaciones Macedy” que inició hace alrededor de 7 años. Durante los últimos 5 años ha venido capacitándose y en la actualidad se dedica completamente a la confección.
Este es su segundo crédito y con el anterior compró una máquina plana y una fileteadora que le han permitido producir generar más utilidad en el negocio. El crédito que ahora solicita lo quiere invertir en materia prima, insumos  y una mesa de corte. Manifiesta que uno de sus desafíos más grandes, es la falta de una mesa de corte ya que tiene que irse donde una amiga para cortar y desde ahí volver con el trabajo a su taller. Más adelante, sueña con agrandar su taller para dar trabajo a otras madres cabezas de familia.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia Díaz is 44 years old, is separated, and is the mother of three children, ages 21, 15, and 13. She lives in the Compartir La Margarita neighborhood in the southwestern part of Bogotá. Her home is near the Portal de las Américas, the terminus station of the TransMilenio—a Bogotan concept in transportation that combines aspects of metro systems with those of buses and which makes it possible to travel quickly to different parts of the city. Her dressmaking shop is also located in this neighborhood—her business is called “Dotaciones Macedy”, and she started it about 7 years ago. During the last 5 years she was training and she is currently making a living entirely from dressmaking. This is Martha’s second loan. She used her previous loan to purchase a sewing machine and an overlock stitching machine, which made it possible for her to generate more profits in her business. She wants to invest her current loan in raw materials, supplies, and a cutting table. She says that one of her biggest challenges is not having a cutting table, since she has to go to a friend’s shop to cut cloth and then go back to work at her own shop. In the longer term, her dream is to expand her shop so that she can provide jobs for other mothers who are supporting families.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in raw materials for dressmaking, such as fabric, thread, and a cutting table

loans.name: Josefa Benita

texts.es:
La señora Josefa Benita M. S., es trabajadora  de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, habita en el Barrio de San Agustín no tiene hijos a cargo.
	
La señora Josefa Benita M. S. solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras en su casa, ya que desea asegurarla por que permanece la mayor parte del tiempo sola y teme se le metan a robar sus pertenencias.
texts.en:
Señora Josefa Benita M. S. works for the mayor's office of Chinandega as a cleaner. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood and has no children. Señora Josefa is requesting a loan for improvements to her house to make it more secure, since she is alone most of the time and fears having her possessions stolen.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Lester Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Lester Manuel C. M. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante y habita en el barrio  la Florida.

El señor Lester Manuel C. M. es casado y su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía es operaria de limpieza,  ambos han tenido crédito con Ceprodel y han demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Lester Manuel C. M. works as a security guard for the city hall of Chinandega. He lives in the La Florida neighborhood. Lester Manuel C. M. is married and his wife also works for the city hall as a custodian. They have both taken loans with CEPRODEL before and have shown themselves to responsible people who are reliable with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal expenses

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo A. T. tiene 56 años y vive en Barranquilla en el barrio Me Quejo, nombre que demuestra el buen sentido de humor propio de los barranquilleros. Está separado y tiene dos hijos de 27 y 10 años de edad: la mayor está terminando su licenciatura en música y es bailarina de ballet, mientras el menor estudia. Gustavo proviene del departamento de Norte de Santander, llegó a Barranquilla desde  joven y empezó su único negocio hace 7 años después de terminar de vender mercancías, como el champú, de puerta a puerta. El negocio de Gustavo se llama “Productos Naturales Renacer” y él elabora productos alimenticios naturales, como la fibra, la granola y la avena. Por ser un país donde casi toda la población come mucha carne o mucho pescado, no es común encontrar a alguien como Gustavo que es vegetariano desde hace 30 años. Fue su vegetarianismo que lo impulsó a estudiar la comida vegetariana y le dio la idea de iniciar su negocio; cuando comenzó no tenía más que una cacerola para elaborar sus productos. Ahora los prepara en un horno y durante sus 3 años de créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ha podido comprar una nevera, un molino y otros implementos necesarios para aumentar la producción. Además, a través de los programas de la Fundación, adquirió su registro de INVIMA, ente que controla y vigila la calidad de productos alimenticios en Colombia. Actualmente comercializa sus alimentos en restaurantes vegetarianos y tiendas naturalistas de Barranquilla, pero su meta es poder penetrar en los almacenes de cadena y así promocionarlos, hecho que también es su mayor desafío, visto que en estos momentos no tiene los recursos para dar este paso.
Ahora solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 que quiere invertir en fibra y en aumentar la producción de su turrón de ajonjolí, maní, coco y miel. Acaba de empezar con los turrones y han tenido mucho éxito, pero es necesario invertir un dinero para tener mayor capacidad. Gustavo también piensa en impulsar sus productos más con tarjeticas que quiere imprimir y más adelante, sueña con tener su propia vivienda en Villas San Pablo, macroproyecto de domicilios donde la Fundación fundamenta la construcción de una comunidad sana.
texts.en:
Gustavo A. T. is 56 years old. He lives in Barranquilla in the neighborhood Me Quejo ("I complain"), a name demonstrating the barranquilleros' good sense of humor. Gustavo is separated from his wife and has two kids, who are 27 and 10 years old. His eldest daughter is a ballet dancer finishing her degree in music, while his younger child studies. Gustavo is from the department of Northern Santander. He came to Barranquilla when he was young and started his own business seven years later after selling merchandise, like shampoo, door to door. Gustavo's business is named "Productos Naturales Renacer" ("Natural Products Reborn"), and he makes natural food products like fiber, granola, and oatmeal. In a country where nearly all the population eats a lot of meat or a lot of fish, it is uncommon to find someone like Gustavo, who has been a vegetarian for thirty years. It was his vegetarianism that led Gustavo to study vegetarian food and gave him the idea to start his business. When he started, he only had one pan to make his food. Now he prepares the food in an oven, and during his three years of loans with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation he has been able to buy a refrigerator, meat grinder, and other kitchen tools necessary to increase his production. Additionally, through the Foundation's programs, he obtained his registration with INVIMA, the organization that controls and oversees the quality of food products in Colombia. Currently, he sells his products in vegetarian restaurants and natural food stores in Barranquilla. His goal is to break into the chain grocery store market and promote his products there. His biggest goal is also his biggest challenge, seeing as he currently lacks the funds necessary to reach this step. Gustavo is asking for a loan of $2.000.000, which he wants to invest in fiber and increasing his production of nougat candy made of sesame, peanut, coconut, and honey. He recently started making nougat candy and he has been very successful, but it is necessary to invest money to have a greater cooking capacity. Gustavo is also thinking about promoting his products with cards he wants to print. In the future, he dreams about having his own home in Villas San Pablo, a macroproject of houses where the Foundation has started the construction of a healthy community.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fiber, sesame, peanut, coconut, and honey to make nougat candy

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
F. is from the city named Arifwala in Pakistan. She has a three-room house, where she has lived with her family for the past 30 years. She is a very active and friendly woman. She owns and operates a clothes-sewing business. She specifically sews clothes for women. She does this work to generate income with her husband.

Her husband's name is A. G. and he runs a bookshop in the market. He sells all kinds of books, such as syllabuses, religious and comic books. He has been in this profession for over five years. F. is requesting a loan to buy books to expand her husband’s book-selling business.

loans.use: To buy books for her husband's bookshop

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Ouidah, une ville historique du Bénin, B. Odette vit depuis sept ans à Allomey, à Allada dans le département de l’atlantique. Odette est mariée à ADJADI François, un transitaire, avec qui elle a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Odette a encore un autre enfant à sa charge. Odette vit seule avec ses enfants mais elle est secondée par son mari pour subvenir aux divers besoins des enfants. Pour participer à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants, Odette mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (huile de palme, chaussures, condiments etc.) non loin de son domicile. Odette fait ses provisions à Lomé, capitale économique du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, et au Nigéria, pays limitrophe du Bénin. Odette a laissé les classes au cours primaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 10 ans. ALIDé a déjà accordé un prêt à Odette, prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Odette souhaite accroître ses revenus pour pouvoir s’acheter une parcelle, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Ouidah, a historic village of Benin, B. Odette has been living for 7 years in Allomey in Allada in the Atlantic district. Odette is married to Adjadi Francois, a freight broker with whom she has 4 childern all in school. Odette has one more child at her care. She lives alone with her children but she is supported by her husband providing various needs of the children. In order to take part in the education of her children, she engages in the sale of various products( palm oil, shoes, ingredients etc) not far from her home. Odette gets her provisions in Lome, the economic capital of Togo, a neighboring country of Benin, and in Nigeria, an adjoining country of Benin. Odette abandoned primary school and has been doing business for almost 10 years. Odette already got a loan from AlIDe which she repaid. Odette wishes to increase her profits to be able to buy a plot of land. That is the reason for which she is requesting a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, shoes and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Asi

texts.en: Asi Y. sells fresh peppers at the Jukwa market. She is divorced and has three children. She is responsible for the general welfare of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh peppers to resell and to process into powder for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fresh peppers to resell and to process into powder for sale

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora María de los Ángeles P. M.  es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, Habita en el barrio san Agustín.

La señora María de los Ángeles P. M. tiene 4 hijos pero ninguno depende de ella y   solicito el crédito para mejorar su casa ya que necesita asegurar su puerta con portón de verjas, y terminar el frente de concreto de su casa, lleva ya 5 créditos con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una señora bien luchadora y muy responsable.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles P. M. works as a janitor at the Chinandega city hall. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood. She has four children, but they are all on their own. She has requested a loan for home improvements, since she needs to secure her door with a wrought-iron gate and finish up the front of her house with concrete. She's had five loans with CEPRODEL and has shown herself to be a real fighter and very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blocks, cement and a wrought-iron gate.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roberto Antonio P., es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, se desempeña como Vigilante, es casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolares,  habita en el barrio La Florida.
	
El señor Roberto Antonio P., solicito el crédito para mejorar su casa ya que se acerca el invierno y desea asegurar a su familia para no mojarse.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto Antonio P. works for the Chinandega mayor's office, as a security guard. He is married and has two school-aged children. The neighborhood where they live is called La Florida. He is requesting this loan in order to improve his house, since winter is approaching and he wishes to keep his family safe and dry.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement and cinder blocks, and to pay for manual labor

loans.name: Davi

texts.en: Davi K. is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background. Davi sells roasted plantain at jukwa. Her husband is a farmer. Davi uses her income to support her husband in the upkeep of the home. Davi will use the loan to buy extra quantities of ripe plantain to roast for sale. She also plans to employ someone to sell some of the roasted plantain in Abura market. With the new profits from her extended business, Davi plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: Davi will use the loan to buy extra quantities of ripe plantain to roast for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Izela

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Izela V. es trabajadora de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como operaria de Limpieza, Habita en el barrio Guadalupe.

La señora Rosa Izela V.  solicito el crédito para mejorar su cas cambiar una parte del techo ya que se le moja en invierno, y asegurar un poco sus puerta, ya que con las lluvias anteriores se la han deteriorado un poco
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Izela V. works for the Chinandega mayor's office as a custodian. She lives in the Guadalupe neighborhood. Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her house. One part of the roof needs to be replaced, since it leaks in the winter. Also, she would like to repair her door, since the rain has left it a little deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, nails, and wood

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a wife of M. H. and they both are citizens of a city named Arifwala, in Pakistan. Her husband is involved in a spare parts business. He sells, specifically, motorbike spare parts, which he purchases from the city named Lahore. He has been in this profession for over 10 years. He is a mechanic also and he can repair every type of vehicle from two wheels bicycle to four wheeled motor cars. 
Shahnaz is requesting a loan to buy motorbike spare parts to expand her husband’s spare parts sales business.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Martha Jovanis

texts.es: La Sra. Martha Jovanis Sánchez Alegría ella se desempeña como Enfermera del centro de salud S.R.S. ella tiene de laborar para esta institución  catorce  años, es madre de un hijo en edad escolar, ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  seis  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación y este crédito ella lo quiere para hacer una construcción de un porche  en su casa de habitación  y así tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Jovanis S. A. has worked as a nurse at the S.R.S. Health Center for 14 years. She is married and has one son, who is of school age. So far, she has had six loans with CEPRODEL, and each one has served to make improvements to her house. Currently, she is requesting a loan to build a porch for her house, in order to have a decent and respectable home.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials, such as cement, sand, gravel, stones, etc. for home improvements

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Marlene P. P., es comerciante se dedica a la venta de queso en el mercado central de Chinandega, es casada tiene un hijo en edad escolar.
	
La señora Silvia Marlene P. P., solicito el crédito para realizar compra de queso ya que en esta temporada las ventas le aumentan.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Marlene P. P. is a merchant who sells cheese in the central market of Chinandega. She is married and has one son, who is of school age. Currently, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase more cheese, since her sales increase during this season.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheese for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amigas Compartiendo Exitos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “AMIGAS COMPARTIENDO EXITOS”

La alcancía comunal “AMIGAS COMPRATIENDO EXITOS” trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD 6 meses, una D. sus miembros es la señora Dina que tiene 51 años D. edad, es madre D. 5 hijos D. L. cuales 3 ya son independientes.
Muchos años atrás Dina se dedicaba a la venta D. zapatos, ella misma viajaba a otros lugares del país para comprarL. y en Lima L. vendía, pero por el mal gobierno D. ese entonces, provocó que L. pasajes y L. productos subieran D. precios radicalmente e hizo que Dina dejara D. viajar, por lo tanto dejó D. dedicarse a ese negocio.
En la actualidad Dina se dedica a la venta D. golosinas y dulces, como gelatinas, mazamorras, queques, tortas, etc. negocio que realiza en la entrada D. su casa, ya tiene 8 años con su negocio, desD. que comenzó con solo 35 vasos para gelatina, ahora tiene 90 vasos L. cuales L. distribuye a sus clientes fijos y a las personas que quieran degustar sus productos.
Empezó con la idea D. querer ganar más dinero para cubrir L. gastos D. su casa, así desD. entonces ha conseguido desenvolverse en el negocio D. L. dulces, también gracias a sus ganancias ha dado educación a sus hijos, y terminar D. construir su casa.
El préstamo actual lo usará para capital D. trabajo, ya que su plan es la D. mejorar negocio.
El sueño D. Dina es tener un par D. tiendas dentro D. una galería para ponerL. en alquiler y así ganar un dinero fijo mensual.
texts.en:
The "Amingas Compartiendo Exitos" [friends sharing successes] Communal Bank The communal bank "Amingas Compartiendo Exitos" [friends sharing successes has been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for six months. One of the members is Dina, who is a 51 year old mother of five; three of her children are already living on their own. Many years ago, Dina was working selling shoes. She herself would travel to other parts of the country to buy shoes to sell in Lima. However, due to the poor government at that time, travel tickets and product costs increased significantly, so Dina had to stop traveling and stop working on her business. Currently, Dina sells candies and sweets such as gelatin, puddings, cakes, pastries, etc, a business which she operates from the entryway to her home. She's been working at this business for 8 years, starting with just 35 gelatin molds. Now, she has 90 molds which she distributes to her steady customers and to those who would like to try her products. She started with the idea of wanting to earn more money to cover the expenses of running her home and since then, she has been able to get involved in the sweets business. Also, thanks to her earnings, she has been able to educate her children and finish building her home. The loan itself would be used for work capital, since her plan is to improve her business. Dina's dream would be to have a pair of shops insiD. a mall to rent them out and be able to gain a steady monthly income.

Translated from Spanish by Raquel Perez-Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells plastic containers, utensils and oranges at Jukwa. She moves from house to house during the day with the plastic containers and sells the oranges in the evening at the entrance of her home, since a lot of people pass by her house very frequently. Maame has received junior high education. She is married and stays with her two children. Her husband is a teacher. She supports her husband in the payment of rent and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more bowls, utensils and more oranges for resale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a shop for her sales business.

In the photo, she has some of the oranges and some few plastic products for display.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more bowls, utensils and more oranges for resale.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is the wife of A. R. and they both live in a city named Arifwala in Pakistan. They have been there for the past 35 years. They both are very hard working people. They manage their grocery shop, which is situated in the community. People come to their shop for purchasing groceries. They both help each other by dividing their time. Suraiya minds the shop in the morning and her husband minds the shop in the evening. Their income helps them to improve their standard of living.

Suraiya is requesting of a loan to purchase items, including cooking oil, rice and beverages to diversify their grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase goods for grocery shop.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with two children. She is a farmer from Kamenka. Tatyana grows early spring vegetables such as tomatoes and radishes. She owns 2 big greenhouses and one separate, spacious greenhouse for seedlings. Tatyana started this business 10 years ago. Presently, she has about 40,000 Grivnyas invested in this business. Annually she spends about 15,000 Grivnyas on seeds and film. 

Tatyana is requesting a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 3 rolls of polyethylene film to repair her greenhouse and to buy fertilizers for the upcoming sowing season. Tatyana enjoys learning new things. Currently she is studying in a local college of business and finance to get a degree and to learn some banking and financing principles. Tatyana’s elder son is just about to finish school. Therefore, she is hoping to generate additional income and save some money to help him through college.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, fertilizers and to repair her greenhouse
